loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn N. is from the village of Naggasican, Santiago City. She is 41 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana R. de 62 años es una mujer muy fuerte y emprendedora, que con su negocio de fabricación de productos alimenticios como deditos, empanaditas, arepas y pastelitos de queso, carne , o pollo, a los que imprime el sabor de la comida de su natal Cartagena,  ha logrado sostener   su hogar; Ana  llegó de su tierra desde sus 7 años a Barranquilla, ciudad capital,  donde hizo estudios primarios, contrajo matrimonio, tuvo 8 hijos y finalmente se separó de su esposo  e inició su propio negocio, que  al principio   fue la  preparación de fritos en su propia casa, actividad que  cambió por la de panadería , con la que se posicionó por muchos años en el mercado y construyó su legado familiar en este oficio, pues  todos sus hijos en las edades de 25 a 38 años tienen su propia microempresa en panadería, o en preparación de productos derivados de la harina de trigo. 
Hoy  su principal actividad es la fabricación de deditos, pastelitos, empanaditas de queso, pollo o carne, los cuales distribuye en los colegios de los barrios aledaños a su vivienda y en tiendas donde es muy reconocida. Su meta principal es diversificar sus productos y la apertura de nuevos y permanentes mercados y este es justamente su gran desafío.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante la línea credikiva, ya que su capital de trabajo es muy pequeño y quiere fortalecerlo comprando, materias primas de contado para obtener descuentos por el volumen de compra, especialmente Harina de trigo, y azúcar, que aumentan sus precios permanentemente. El negocio de Ana en este momento presenta una Rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 1,3 días, una rotación de inventarios de 5 días, mientras su  rotación de cuentas por pagar es de 2, 5 días y su endeudamiento con el nuevo credikiva es de 11,20%. Ana Isabel es una gran madre que ha apoyado siempre a sus hijos y en la actualidad ellos la poyan también,  por eso su sueño es verlos realizados y con vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Ana R., age 62, is a very strong and enterprising woman.  She makes food products like deditos (a type of fried snack); empanaditas (little turnovers); corn cakes; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies.  She makes them with the flavor of food in her native Cartagena.  She has managed to support her household.

Ana left her land and arrived in Barranquilla, the capital city, seven years ago.  She attended elementary school, got married, and had eight children.  She eventually separated from her husband and started her own business.

At the beginning she made fried food in her own house.  She traded that activity for a bakery, which has been located in the market for many years.  She built her family legacy through this occupation.  All of her children, ages 25-38, have their own small bakery businesses or make products derived from wheat flour.

Now she primarily makes deditos; corn cakes; cheese, meat, or chicken empanaditas; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies.  She distributes them to the schools in the neighborhoods surrounding her house.  She also delivers to stores where she is very well-known.

Her main goal is to diversify her products and to open new and permanent markets.  This is precisely her great challenge.

She is currently applying for her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through Kiva.  She has very little work capital, and she wants to strengthen it by purchasing raw materials for cash.  She will do this to get volume discounts, especially for wheat flour and sugar.  These prices are constantly rising.

Ana’s business now has a turnover on accounts receivable of 1.3 days, a 5 day turnover of inventory, and its turnover for accounts payable is 2.5 days.  Her debt with the new Kiva loan is 11.2%.

Ana is a great mother who has always supported her children.  Now, they support her as well.  Therefore, her dream is to see them become successful and have their own homes.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Manuela, tiene 57 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre y dos hermanas. El negocio de ella es la venta de tostadas, enchiladas y mariscos, este comenzó con el apoyo de su madre y hermanas, quienes hasta el momento le ayudan a atenderlo, no tiene un horario fijo de atención, pero cuenta con una larga experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales como plátanos, yuca, bolsas plásticas, ya que son los necesarios para atender a los clientes, esta inversión será una gran ayuda que le permitirá continuar trabajando y generando ingresos para su familia.
Doña manuela aspira mejorar la atención a la clientela, aumentando la producción y realizar los alimentos cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Manuela is 57 years old and she lives in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her mother and her two sisters. She sells tostadas, enchiladas, and seafood. She started out with the support of her mother and sisters who until now have been helping her run the business. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule and she has many years' experience.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients such as bananas, yucca, and plastic bags. These are necessary to attend her clients. This investment will be a great help because it will permit her to keep working and generating an income for her family. 

Manuela aspires to provide her clientele with better service by increasing production and preparing her foods every day a little better.

loans.use: To purchase bananans, yucca, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 36 years old. Her husband’s name is M. and he has a power loom business. He operates his business from his home and it is going well for him. Because of his experience of 18 years in his business, he receives a good number of orders every month and they earn him regular income. Shahnaz also helps her husband in his business, when M. goes out of home to collect orders. Shahnaz operates his power loom machine for preparing bed sheets.

She is also a very good mother and takes care of her children very well. She has enrolled them into school and they are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread to prepare larger quantity of bed sheets which will help him to complete larger orders on-time and to earn better profits. Shahnaz is very confident that the loan investment will help him earn better profits and she will be able to live a better standard of living with her family as a result.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her s econdloan application. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time.

She lives in Kasur which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan which is famous for its leather industry. She lives there in a small home which contains two rooms in the area of Bhutta sohan din.

loans.use: To buy thread for bed sheets-making business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina P. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Cristina is married and has nine adult children. 

To make a living, Cristina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, beverages, powdered juice, shampoo, soap and biscuits. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory for working capital. 

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and biscuits. This will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and biscuits

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tobacco sales business. She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of tobacco to offer for sale. Brigida has been in this business for 25 years. She earns additional income from tablea and handwoven (banig) making.

Brigida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to expand her business in order to support the family needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of tobacco to offer for sale

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 60 años, vive con una de sus hijas en su casa que es propia. Hace  más de 6 años vende mazamorras, postre típico de su zona, y que actualmente lo ofrece en un puesto que estableció hace 4 años. Es así que atiende desde la mañana hasta llegada la noche. Durante la semana se da el tiempo suficiente para abastecerse de mercadería para continuar con la preparación de éste postre. Ante el buen gusto de preparar mazamorras  y el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, le ha favorecido en las ventas, es por eso  que se proyecta a elaborar en mayor proporción mazamorra. Es su crédito número 15  que tiene con MFP,  considera que su experiencia de trabajo que ha realizado en su banco comunal es muy positiva ya que significó para ella un espacio de aprendizaje y agradece ese apoyo comprometiéndose a seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Genoveva, age 60, lives with one of her daughters in her own house. For over six years, she has been selling mazamorras -- a typical dessert in her area (a sweet corn-based pudding). She currently sells them from morning till night from a vending post that she has installed four years ago. During the week, she has enough time to replenish her stock of ingredients necessary for the preparation of this dessert.

Genoveva's skill in preparing manzamorras and the good service she offers to her clients have allowed her to grow her sales; it is for this reason that she plans to make manzamorras in greater quantity. 

This is Genoveva's 15th credit with MFP, and she feels that her experience as part of the communal bank has been very positive, given that it gave her a space where she could learn new things. She is grateful for this support and is committed to repaying the loan in a timely manner. She plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients as well as to improve the infrastructure of her vending post.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the preparation of mazamorra (a sweet corn-based pudding) as well as to improve the infrastructure of her vending post.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward K. is a 41-year-old farmer from the village of Jocho, West Georgia. He is married and has a five-year-old daughter Mariam. 

Edward and his wife Mzia have a one-hectare plot of agricultural land. They grow a variety of vegetables and fruits on this plot. Harvested products are sold locally to the retailers of fruits and vegetables. Also, the family owns a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Mzia and Edward produce traditional Georgian cheese and sell it on the local market. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, they have three beehives with bee colonies. A small amount of gathered honey is sold. 

With the requested loan, K. will purchase an additional seven beehives and will be able to gather more honey and sell it in season. Part of the increase in profit will be reinvested in bee-keeping business development and the other part will be spent on renovation of the house to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase seven beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia, de 53 años de edad, está casada con Agustín de 54 años de edad y fruto de ese amor concibieron 05 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa situada  en la ciudad de Sante Rosa. Para tener su propia heladería, no fue tan fácil como ella lo esperaba, ya que el primer mes de funcionamiento solo tuvo escasos clientes y lo que percibía solo le alcanzaba para su canasta familiar. Dionisia puso mucho empeño en mejorar en la elaboración de sus helados, en donde introdujo nuevos sabores como: mango, pera, plátano, guanábana, entre otras frutas, con la finalidad de que sus clientes estén más que satisfechos. Con el transcurrir de los meses perfeccionó su producto, hoy tiene un lugar considerable en su localidad y reconoce que la clave de su éxito radica en la perseverancia y en la innovación de sus nuevos sabores, es por ello que se siente contenta con su negocio. Sin embargo las temporadas de lluvia perjudican su negocio. Con el transcurso del tiempo anhela ampliar su puesto ya que cuenta con espacios masivos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además está satisfecha por el buen trato que recibe por parte de los socios de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará nuevas maquinas para la elaboración de sus helados.
texts.en:
Dionisia, who is 53 years old, is married to Augustín, who is 54, and as the fruit of this love, they conceived five children. They live together in their own house located in the city of Sante Rosa. It was not as easy as she expected to have her own ice cream shop, since the first month it was open, she only had a few customers, and what she earned was only sufficient for her family expenses. Dionisia put much determination into improving the manufacture of her ice creams, and she introduced new flavors such as mango, pear, banana, and guanábana (a tropical fruit), among other fruits, with the result that her clients are more than satisfied. With the passing of the months, she perfected her product. Now she has a substantial location, and she recognizes that the key to her success is rooted in perseverance and in the innovation of her new flavors. This is why she feels satisfied with her business. Nevertheless, the rainy season hurts her business. With the passing of time she wants to enlarge her stand because there is ample space available. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she promises to continue fulfilling her obligations to make payments. Furthermore, she is satisfied with the good treatment that she receives from the members of her communal bank. With the loan that she is applying for, she will buy new machines to make her ice creams.

loans.use: to buy machines to make ice cream.

loans.name: Juarez Group

texts.es: Este grupos solidario se llama Juárez, está Ubicado en San Andrés Cuauhtempan, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por la señora Ana Laura va a comprar con su crédito aceite para mantenimiento de sus maquinas, la señora Gabriela y la señorita Noemí van a comprar maíz para sembrar, cosechar y vender. El señor Ismael va a comprar fertilizante y abono para el nopal, el tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre tiene 1 hija Ana Itzel de 4 años de edad, el tiene su parcela de nopal y solicito su crédito para comprar abono para abonar su siembra de nopal y produzca mas, para vender, también siembra maíz, el inicio su negocio hace 3 años su papa le enseño a trabajar en el campo, el siembra nopal, maíz y cuenta con borregos para crianza, su negocio es importante porque va saliendo para ir comiendo, lo que más le gusta es cuando corta el nopal y lo vende, este negocio es muy conocido internacionalmente por sus propiedades alimenticias y curativas, los desafíos que enfrenta su siembra de nopal es el clima en temporal le salen manchas, cuando graniza rompe el nopal, sus sueños y esperanza son crecer la siembra de nopal, componer su casa hacer mas cuartos, crecer su negocio de borregos y que no le falte nada a su hija que estudie y que crezca sana. San Andrés Cuauhtempan es un pueblo bonito ahí el nació, cuenta con todos los servicios, es de clima templado, siembran maíz, jitomate, nopal, frijol, tomate. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por apoyarnos con sus préstamo, por la confianza que nos dan y que nos sigan apoyando cada día mas, vamos a salir bien en los pagos para que nos sigan apoyando”.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Juárez” is located in San Andrés Cuautempan, which is in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The members are as follows: • Sra. Ana Laura will use her loan to buy oil for maintaining her machines. • Sra. Gabriela and Srta. Noemí will buy corn to plant, harvest, and sell. • Sr. Ismael will buy fertilizers and compost for growing “nopal” (the edible leaves of the prickly pear cactus).

Sr. Ismael is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a four-year-old daughter named Ana Itzel. He owns a parcel of land on which he grows nopal. Ismael is requesting a loan to buy compost for fertilizing his crop of nopal so that he can produce more to sell. He also grows corn. Ismael started his business three years ago. His father taught him how to work in the fields and grow nopal and corn. Ismael also raises sheep. His business is important because it enables him to get ahead and feed his family. The part he enjoys most is harvesting and selling the nopal. This type of business is recognized internationally because the nopal is known for its flavor and medicinal properties. His main challenge is dealing with the weather during the harvest season. If there is hail, the impact from the hail will leave marks and cuts on the nopal leaves.

His hopes and dreams include increasing his nopal harvest, adding more rooms to his house, growing his sheep business, and seeing that his daughter grows up healthy and lacks nothing in her education. San Andrés Cuauhtempan is a beautiful town and Ismael was born there. It receives all services and has a mild climate. The crops that are grown there include corn, nopal, beans, and both red and green tomatoes.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for supporting and trusting us with this loan. We appreciate the continued support each day and plan to succeed in submitting our payments.”

loans.use: to purchase compost for fertilizing a crop of "nopal".

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. Lorena has operated a shop selling home care products, pillow cases and fragrances for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy stock from Personal Care and Natasha. Lorena has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lorena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Personal Care and Natasha

loans.name: Silvia Argentina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, la señora Silvia Argentina  es una  persona, responsable, trabajador con bueno valores morales, que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su familia y  ha logrado mantener estabilidad en  su hogar.
Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar  un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda, con este desembolso comprara materiales de construcción tales como lamina de zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra, para  reparar   el techo que esta en mala condición   y poder dar una mejor  vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In Managua, Silvia Argentina is known as a responsable and hard worker with good values who strives to improve conditions for her household.
She now seeks a loan from Ceprodel in order to make needed housing repairs.  She plans to buy construction materials such as tin roofing and also to cover labor costs with this credit, to replace and reinforce the roof which is in disrepair.  In this way, her family will be better off.

loans.use: to make housing improvements

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hard working 53 year old business man.  He is married and blessed with 5 children aged: 28, 25, 23, 20, and 16 years old.  For the last 8 years, to provide for his family he has been doing welding.  He supplements his income by renting out his rental houses. 

Previously he was a salaried employee.  He wants in the next 5 years to expand his welding business and his dream is to venture into the farming business.  He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy grinders and welding materials.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to learn business management skills that he employs to properly run his business.

loans.use: to buy grinders and welding materials

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 54 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Jovita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yolima

texts.es: Yolima de 29 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia con su esposo, donde se dedica a la venta en volumen de hielo y boli; negocio que surgió justamente observó la gran demanda de los habitantes de este municipio, que posee  vocación turística, por estar ubicado a la orilla del mar y provisto de playas, que albergan a su alrededor negocios como restaurantes y muchos vendedores ambulantes y que por su cálido clima, sus habitantes y turistas buscan refrescarse continuamente para calmar su sed, especialmente en los meses de verano, época en la cual se impactan mayormente este tipo de ventas. Sus principales clientes son los vendedores al detalle que no tienen neveras y suelen enfriar sus refrescos con hielo y le siguen en su estructura de compradores los restaurantes. Como Yolima es una joven consciente de la oportunidad, también vende mercancías variadas, como blusas, zapatos, pantalones y accesorios femeninos que compra en la ciudad de Barranquilla y los distribuye entre sus clientes en el municipio mediante plazos de pago adaptados a sus necesidades, facilitando que sus clientes puedan acceder a las mercancías que necesitan, para pagar en varias partidas. Su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacer crecer ambos negocios, el primero ya requiere un congelador y el segundo exige responder a su creciente clientela que solicitan mercancías variadas a Yolima y es muy difícil ser oportuna. Esta es la razón de aplicar a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará un congelador y ropa femenina y accesorios femeninos. Porque su sueño y gran desafío es crecer, hasta convertirse en la mayor distribuidora de su municipio. Mientras esto ocurre, Yolima trabaja persistentemente en su negocio con un margen de contribución del 80% y con sus inventarios rotando cada 3 días.
texts.en:
Yolima is 29 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia with her husband.  She sells ice in bulk and "boli" (flavored water in small plastic bags).  This business came about as she observed great demand by the inhabitants of this municipality.  The area has tourist potential, being located by the sea and beaches.  It is also home to businesses such as restaurants and many vendors.  The area is also known for its warm climate, so inhabitants and tourists alike continually seek to cool off and quench their thirst, especially in the summer months,which is a major impact on sales.  Yolima's main customers are vendors who do not have refrigerators and often cool their drinks with ice for restaurants to purchase.

As Yolima is a young woman who is aware of opportunity, she also sells general merchandise such as shirts, shoes, pants and accessories for women. She buys the items in the city of Barranquilla and distributes them to her customers in the municipality by payment terms tailored to their needs.  She enables her customers to access the goods they need by allowing them to pay in several payments.  Her working capital is not enough to grow both businesses; the first requires a freezer and the second requires responding to her growing clientele seeking a variety of goods, and it is very difficult for Yolima to be timely. 

This is the reason why Yolima is applying for a loan with Kiva and this is her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to buy a freezer and women's clothing accessories.  Her dream and challenge is to grow and become the largest distributor in her municipality.  Until this happens, Yolima will work persistently in her business with a contribution margin of 80% and inventories rotating every 3 days.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and women's clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a determined business man aged 37 years. He is married. For the last seven years he has been operating a retail shop in order to support his family. In the next five years, he wants to have established his business as a wholesale one. His dream is to be a successful business man. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 to buy flour, salad, rice, and soap. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy flour, salad, rice, and soap for his store.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a 37-year-old single mother of two children aged 14 and 9. They live in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been the sole breadwinner. For six years, she has been operating a drugstore. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Winfred needs the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is a married woman with two adult children. She works as a farmer in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Manuela primarily grows rice crops to sell. She needs farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. That’s why she requested this loan. Manuela hopes to have a better income so she can make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old.  She lives in the village of Tsakhani, Adigeni District.  Marina is married.  She lives with her husband Shota, her 22-year-old son, 18-year-old daughter and 72-year-old mother-in-law. 

Marina and Shota lead the agricultural business of the family.  They have a dairy farm and sell cheese in a local market.  Along with the dairy, they grow various types of vegetables and corn on the family's own land and sell other harvested products locally. 

Marina requested credit for paying the study fee for her daughter, a student at high school.  After paying the study fee, Marina’s daughter will continue to study at the high school.  She studies well and tries her best to get good education in order to ensure a sustainable future for herself.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's high-school study fee.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a widow who has 10 children. She is standing in front of her grocery shop at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. 

Efua uses her earnings to see to the well-being of her family and home.  She will use the loan to procure other types of groceries which she doesn’t have to supply her customers. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build another shop.

loans.use: to procure other types of groceries which she doesn’t have to supply her customers.

loans.name: Hali Ya Hewa Group

texts.en: Magret, who is in her early 30s, is married with one child who still goes to school. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase her food stock so that she can sell more food. Her dream is to be able to buy a plot of land one day and build her own house. Magret will share this loan with her group, Hali ya Hewa, which has a total of 16 members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase food stock to sell more food.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel a diario labora en una institución en su municipio con el fin de proporcionar el pan diario a su casa. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz y junto a ella se esfuerzan para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción como cerámica, cemento, arena y el pago de la mano de obra ya que requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Es menester señalar que este es el segundo crédito que se le otorgará el cual le ha ayudado de mucho ya que empezó a construir y con este otro terminará la construcción que tanto anhela para así cumplir sus metas de un mejor techo donde habitar.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel works for a municipal institution daily to provide daily bread for her home.  Her husband’s an auto mechanic and together they strive to improve their living conditions.  She is asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies like ceramic tile, cement and sand and to pay labor costs because she needs to do some home improvements.  It’s worth mentioning that this is the second loan she’s been granted and it’s helped her much already because she started to build and with this last one she’ll finish the construction that she so much wants to reach her goals of having a better home to live in.

loans.use: to buy tile, cement and sand.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La joven Juana, de 27 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, es una humilde, comerciante, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad esta estudiando la primaria ella es comerciante y trabaja como operaria en una zona franca cosiendo y armando ropa. Inicio con su negocio de pulpería a la edad de 18 años de edad, comenzó vendiendo frijoles y leñas en su humilde y sencilla cocina de leña , fue ahorrando poco a poco y comprando mercadería para vender hasta que logro poner su mini pulpería de la cual siente mucho orgullo por que ha significado un sacrificio de 9 años trabajando duro para lograr mantener su negocio funcionando. Aunque su salario como operaria en una zona franca no es mucho  ella se ayuda con lo que le genera las ventas en su pulpería es de esta manera que sale adelante con su familia en sobrevivir día a día. Ella  requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, leña, gaseosas, snacks, azúcar, aceite. Atravez de esta inversión podrá adquirir mas productos para vender en su pulpería. Entre sus expectativas futuras quiere comprar un freezer, vitrinas y comprar 2 estantes de hierro para colocar y mostrar sus productos.
texts.en:
Juana is a young woman of 27 who lives in the city of León.  She is a humble shopkeeper.  She has two children who are 9 and 7 years old and attending elementary school.  Juana is a shopkeeper and also works as a laborer in a free-trade zone, sewing and assembling clothing.  She started her grocery store business at the age of 18.  She started out selling beans and firewood in her humble and simple wooden kitchen, then gradually saved up and bought more merchandise to sell.  Eventually she managed to set up her mini grocery store, of which she feels very proud because it represents 9 years of sacrifice and hard work which she has made in order to keep her business running.  Although her salary from her job as a laborer in the free-trade zone isn't much, she helps herself with the money she makes from selling goods in her grocery store.  In this way, she provides for her family and survives from day to day.

Juana needs a loan to buy rice, beans, firewood, soda, snacks, sugar and oil.  Through this investment, she will be able to acquire more products to sell in her grocery store.  In the future, Juana hopes to buy a freezer, display cases and two metal shelves on which to place and display her products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, firewood, soda, snacks, sugar and oil

loans.name: Vevilyn

texts.en:
Vevilyn is 36 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

Vevilyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase fish to sell.

Vevilyn has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Vevilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 36 years old, married and has one child, who is 12 years old. In 2004, she went into business by selling items for babies. Her goal was to improve her family's standard of living. She works six days a week, 10 hours a day, and earns about Le 1,200,000 a month. She is applying for a loan for Le 3,000,000 to buy baby powder, napkins and other items that mothers need to take care of their children. Her goal is to increase her profits by about Le 300,000 a month. In the future, Mamie plans to build a house and educate her child to the university level. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy baby powder, baby Johnson, napkin, and flask and mother care for her business.

loans.name: Toribia Susana

texts.es: La señora Toribia es cliente nueva en la institución vive en la zona de las lomas se dedica al barnizado, afinado y acabado de sillas su taller esta en el mismo domicilio vive con sus hijos y su esposo que se dedica  a la carpintería  realiza puertas  y closets para cocina el crédito esta destina  a la compra de madera aglomerado y materiales para el afinado y acabado de muebles vive en casa propia a medio construir. Mas adelante tienen planificado realizar la construcción de su vivienda y así brindar mas comodidad a su familia, Trabaja toda la familia, apoyándose juntos en la fabricación y comercialización de muebles, con el tiempo desea tener un taller mas grande y así poder emplear mano de obra ya que otros jóvenes también aprendan el oficio de la carpintería.
texts.en:
Toribia is a new loan client. She lives in Las Lomas zone and works in carpentry, mostly varnishing, detailing and finishing chairs. Her workshop is located in a room in the house where she lives with her children and husband, who also works in carpentry making doors and kitchen cabinets. 

This loan will be used to buy wood composite boards and furniture making supplies. The family owns their home, which is still under construction. They hope to finish construction in the near future so that the family can live comfortably. Everyone in the family works making and selling furniture. They hope to expand the workshop in the future and be able to take on hired help and apprentices who would like to learn the trade.

loans.use: Purchase of wood, wood composite boards, and carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Ukombozi - Mbuji Group

texts.en:
Elgius is a 42-year-old father of five children. He is hardworking in his farming activities, growing maize, coffee and beans for over six years. He is facing agricultural problems such as crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Elgius is requesting working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. He has a commitment to expand his farming activities in five years from 6 to 13 acres so as to earn more income to help purchase carpentry equipment and an insecticide pump machine and to cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Doña Catalina como es llamada por sus amigos y vecinos, esta casada, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su propia casa de habitación en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras. El negocio de Doña Catalina es un Hotel y Comedor, en donde ofrece servicio de habitación y venta de desayunos, almuerzos, cenas, pescado frito, camarones, curiles, refrescos y golosinas.
Doña Catalina tiene su negocio ubicado en la  zona sur de Honduras. Esta solicitando la cantidad de 10,000.00 lempiras para la compra de refrescos, verduras, carnes, mariscos, agua y otros productos, y de esta manera generar mayores ventas en su negocio, por lo que sus ingresos serán mejores.
Entre sus sueños a futuro de Doña Catalina esta la idea de expandir mas su negoció con estos ella y su familia tendrán una mejor vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Catalina, 55, is married and lives with her husband and son in their own home, which is in the Department of Valle in Southern Honduras. Catalina's business is a Hotel with Dining Services, where she offers room service and sells breakfast, lunch, dinner, fried fish, shrimp, mollusks, drinks, and sweets. 

Catalina's business is in the southern region of Honduras. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempira to buy drinks, vegetables, meat, seafood, water, and other products. This way, she can increase sales at her business and gain more revenue. Among Catalina's dreams for the future is the idea of expanding her business further, and with this her family will have a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, meat, seafood, water, and other products for her business

loans.name: Balabeyim Baylar Giz

texts.en:
Balabeyim is an old internally displaced person (IDP) who is the mother of one child. Her family\'s living condition is not very good. The family income is rather limited.

Since 2000, Balabeyim has supported her family by working as a cook in her small business. Actually, she is a very communicative person who loves people and accepts them as they are. In her view, cooking is some kind of art which reflects the feelings and mood of a cook. She likes international cousine but national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favorite ones.

Now, she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business, to buy new kitchen appliances, to increse her incomes via diversifying the menu and attracting more clients.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ela Tillette’s shop is located in the front of her house. Ela was in America for years, but she came back to take care of her aged grandmother. She also cares for her two young kids. They are both at school, and Ela is solely responsible for them. She is on her 4th loan of $2250 and she uses her loans to purchase more stock for her successful shop. Ela’s customers are her nearby neighbors and village people. She is a very hard worker, operating her shop 7 days a week from 7:30am-10:00pm. She is requesting a loan so that she can continue to offer more products in her business.

loans.use: To purchase snacks, soaps, rinso, toothpaste, icepops, flour, sugar

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 25 years old, and she has 2 children. She works as an artisan. She buys fabric to make napkins, tablecloths, skirts, pants, and blouses. All of these are made with special embroidery. This may seem like simple work, however, in reality it requires a great amount of time. For this reason she intends to use the loan to purchase more material and employ 2-3 people to embroider, thus selling larger quantities. Candelaria’s husband traveled north in search of better opportunities because for those without a profession work is limited. Candelaria is part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

CANDELARIA TIENE 25 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA, COMPRA TELA Y LAS CONVIERTE EN SERVILLETAS, MANTELES, FALDAS, PANTALONES, Y BLUSAS, TODO ESTO LLEVA UN BORDADO ESPECIAL. APARENTEMENTE TODO ESTO ES MUY FACIL, PERO EN REALIDAD SE REQUIERE DE MUCHO TIEMPO, ES POR ELLO QUE CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA MAS MATERIAL Y EMPLEAR A DOS O TRES PERSONAS MAS PARA EL BORDADO Y ASI VENDERLO POR MAYOREO, SU ESPOSO VIAJO HACIA EL NORTE DEL PAIS EN BUSCA DE MEJORES PERSPECTIVAS, YA QUE EN LA CIUDAD PARA LAS PERSONAS QUE NO TIENEN UNA PROFESION HAY MUY POCAS POSIBILIDADES DE TRABAJO. CANDELARIA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase material for her textiles business

loans.name: Andrés

texts.en:
Andres B., 54, is married, with 5 children, one of whom died 4 years ago. He works every day producing chipas, a common street cornbread snack in Paraguay. He dedicates the time from 1 am to 4 am to make the chipas. He makes 20 kilo of chipas per day, about 400 chipas.

His wife and one of his daughters, aged 26, travels to Asuncion on an hour and half bus ride every morning to sell the chipas after Andres finishes baking the chipas.

Andres and his youngest daughter are shown in the photo. His wife is not in the photo because she is in Asuncion with her other daughter selling the chipas. Andres is requesting a $200 loan to buy more ingredients in larger quantities in order to keep his costs low. He needs to buy almidón, which is an essential ingredient to make chipas, cheese, and eggs.

Andres is member of a committee of men and women. This group lending system allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of almidón, cheese, and eggs.

loans.name: Coleta Laurencio

texts.en:
Coleta (54 years old) is engaged, with her husband’s help, in selling basic foodstuff and other goods in her ‘colmado,’ a typical Dominican small store where simple goods are sold. The couple has 5 children who are unemployed. For more than four years, her business has had a positive impact in the community, since it brings in a convenient manner goods that otherwise people would obtain in the town, which requires a walk of more than two hours.

Coleta wants to purchase new types of products in order to increase the variety of goods that her business brings to the community, so that people can have access to a wider range of basic goods. She also aims to augment her profit so that she can better face her family issues.

loans.use: To expand and diversify the business

loans.name: Ana De

texts.es:
Ana is a 45 year old woman, who lends her services as a dressmaker (on request) and also receives income from renting rooms in her home. Ana's family includes her husband and one son, who all live in a home together. Ana has 23 years of experience as a dressmaker and during that same time has been renting out rooms. There is a good deal of competition for both things, but her clientele is so well established that she is at an advantage. Since she is so well known, she is recommended by her neighbors, who also are frequent clients themselves. She is always looking for new clients, too, for both of her businesses. The current loan is to finish work on an addition to her home, a project which began with a previous loan from the same institution. Right now Ana only borrows with Agrocapital, and does not have any other debts and her credit history is very good.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana es una señora de 45 años de edad, que se dedica a prestar sus servicios como modista (a pedido) y también percibe ingresos por alquileres. La familia de Ana está compuesta por su esposo y un hijo, mismos que viven en una vivienda propia. Ana tiene más de 23 años de experiencia como modista y el mismo tiempo aproximadamente renta cuartos en su casa. Existe bastante competencia en ambos rubros, pero la antiguedad de la cliente le permite tener una ventaja, ya que es conocida, entonces es recomendada por los vecinos, también cuenta con clientes fijos y siempre trata de captar nueva clientela para cualquiera de sus negocios. La presente solicitud es para terminar la obra fina de la ampliación de su domicilio, misma que empezó con un crédito anterior en nuestra institución. Actualmente Ana sólo tiene crédito con Agrocapital, no tiene otras deudas y sus antecedentes crediticios son bastante buenos.

loans.use: To increase and improve her home

loans.name: Santa Alcántara

texts.en:
Santa is twenty-five years old, and she and her partner have three sons who range in age from one to five years old. Santa has been running a pastry shop for five years. She operates her business within her house. As she wanted to expand her business and diversify what she has for sale, Santa took a loan from FSMA which she invested to add pâtés and empanadas to the business. She sells the latter products in the afternoon in the public square.

Santa envisions her business becoming one of the best known and most frequently visited pastry shops in her community. Once she gets a locale, she will operate her two businesses in the same place. The entrepreneur wants to increase her income to keep on providing education for her sons and to pay for her studies at the public university in Santo Domingo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients needed to keep on preparing and selling pâtés and empanadas

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is a trader who sells canned foods, washing and toilet soaps. She is married to an electrical engineer but his monthly income is not enough to meet the family’s expenses. Kate is supporting the family financially. She wants to expand her business and increase her sales.

She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to purchase more stock for her shop.

loans.use: As additional capital to purchase more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 43 year old father of two. He works and lives with his wife and children in south Lebanon, in Saida. Mohamad is in the retail and wholesale business of selling watches and electronic devices. He needs a loan to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 35 years old and is widow with one child, aged 12 years old. Saumu makes and sells batique. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Saumu has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 8 and 3 years old. Halima is a clothes seller which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Suada

texts.en: Suada is a 39-year-old woman and she is from the town of Breza. She is divorced and she has one daughter who is married. She works at the market selling clothes and she can earn about 500 KM  (US$ 400) monthly. Suada will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy more clothes for re-sale. Her wish is to earn enough money in order to open her own shop for selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Olafumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo S. has a small kiosk in  Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. she sells phone accessories, recharge cards and also makes phone calls. She learned this business for 4 year. she has been in this business since 2003. Fumilayo is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more recharge cards and phone accessories for sale.

loans.use: To buy more recharge cards and phone accessories for sales.

loans.name: Elaysa Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. G. de 35 años de edad, casada con una hija estudiando el 4to grado de primaria, trabaja en el Liceo Agricola desde hace 8 años, ocupando el cargo de secretaria-cajera. AFODENIC le ha otorgado 7 creditos, los que ha pagado con responsabilidad en y le han servido para mejorar su vivienda. Este crédito lo utilizará para embaldozar el piso de la casa de su mamá, pues es de tierra y con el invierno se hace mucho lodo y quiere darle mejor comodidad, evitando riesgos de salud para su familia. Plantea que los créditos le han servido de mucho apoyo para mejorar su vivienda y ahora quiere apoyar a su familia. Sus créditos han sido de mayor monto, pero este lo desea de menor cantidad para no quedar mal, ya que la situacion economica esta un poco dificil.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. G. is 35 years old and married with a daughter who is in 4th grade. She has been working in the Liceo Agricola for 8 years as the secretary – cashier. AFODENIC has given her 7 previous loans which she has paid with responsibility and she has used to improve her home. She will use this credit to tile the floor of her mother’s home since it is currently a dirt floor. In the winter this is very problematic as it often turns to mud which causes health problems in the family. She states that the previous loans have enabled her to improve her home and now she would like to help her family. Additionally, the other loans have been for larger amounts but this time she would like a smaller amount due to her current economic situation to avoid problems with the repayment.

loans.use: Lay tile on the floor of her mother’s home

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells glass jars at the local city market. The business helps provide her family with essential food products. Due to the current conservation season, Mahbuba wants to purchase additional merchandise. If she earns well this season, she will be able to feed her family during the winter. Her business earns no income during winter and spring. This is why Mahbuba decided to obtain a 12-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Нишонова Махбуба Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Махбуба на местном рынке города Турсунзаде торгует стеклянными банками. Этот вид деятельности помогает ей обеспечивать свою семью самыми необходимыми продуктами питания. Сейчас киентка хочет закупить товар,так как сейчас сезон консервирования.Если в этот сезон она хорошо поработает ,зимой она сможет прокормить свою семью.Так как с зимы до весны этот вид деятельности уже не приносит дохода. Пооэтому она решила взть кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin sells plastic items of different sizes and shapes. This includes plastic chairs, plates, jugs, spoons, buckets, and bowls. Toyin is a hardworking woman. Her plastics are uniquely arranged in her shop. Her customers are happy with her choice of plastics. She has been in this trade for a long time.

Toyin is 49 years old and she is married to Mr. O.; they have three children. Toyin hopes to train her children up to the university level so that she can be called "mama graduate". Toyin needs the loan amount of $450 to purchase more plastic items for sale. She says plastic business is good for the market.

loans.use: Purchase more plastic items for sale

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan is married and has 4 children. He lives in a town called Khachmaz and earns income running a farming business which he started 10 years ago. At present, Ziyadkhan needs a loan of US$500 to buy seeds for his farm.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for a farming business

loans.name: Kay

texts.en: Mrs. Kay N. is a villager in Ka Sen village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Soung Sopheap, is a motorbike driver. He faces a small problem with his motorbike. Thus, Mrs. Kay N. decided to request a loan to replace her husband’s motorbike. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To request for a loan to change her husband’s motorbike.

loans.name: Deth

texts.en: Mr. Deth C. is 28 years old and makes a living climbing palm trees to make palm juice. He makes over fifty liters per day and turns it in to palm sugar or palm wine to sell in font of his house. His wife, Mrs. Chaiya An, 26, is a pig raiser, has no children, and lives in Kompong Tom Province. Deth requests a loan of 700,000 riel ($175) to purchase food for pigs. The loan will help to accrue their income to support their family’s living expenses adequately.

loans.use: to purchase foods for pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 43 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ  tình thương  thu nhập của gia đình chị L. chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị L. đã vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh buôn bán. Hiện nay chị L. đang là chủ của hàng tạp tại xã Hưng Đạo  huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Công việc kinh doanh đang phát triển thuận lợi và đem lại cho gia đình chị L. thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị L. mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh daonh buôn bán của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L. is 43 years old. She has been a regular participant in the TYM Fund since 2002. Before she was able to borrow from the TYM Fund, her family’s income depended on raising animals and farming. Once she became a regular borrower from the Fund, she invested in a retail business. Now Mrs. L. is the owner of a grocery shop in Hưng Đạo commune, Hưng Nguyên district, Nghệ An province. Her business is growing successfully and now earns her family about 3,000,000 VND (180 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (900 USD) to invest in her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata Djiré est âgée de 50 ans, mariée elle vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants  dans une grande  famille traditionnelle avec plusieurs autres ménages dans le quartier Somono de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ancienne élève coranique, elle commença très tôt à mener les activités commerciales notamment la fabrication du savon  indigène, qu’elle apprena auprès de son grand frère. Après avoir fait plusieurs années d’apprentissage riche d’expériences et de savoir faire, elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant  10 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation à Ségou et dans les villages environnants où elle a beaucoup de clients.
Pour faire du savon traditionnel, elle brûle 5 litres d’huiles de karité dans une marmité ou dans une barrique ensuite elle met 40 litres d’eau, ½ kgs de farine  et 3 kgs de soude caustique dans cette marmite. Puis elle procède au malaxage  à l’aide d’une grande louche jusqu’avoir la pâte servant de savon.
Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande de la clientèle qu’elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 3 ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel pour un montant de 150 000FCFA et compte l’utiliser pour acheter 20 kgs d’huile de karité, 6 kgs de farine, 9 kgs de soude caustique. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Ségou. Madame Diarra Aminata Djiré vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes ruraux et citadins.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et de faire face à certains événements sociaux (baptême, mariage). Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Aminata Djiré is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and four children in a large traditional family with several other households in the neighbourhood of Somono in Ségou, Mali. She is a former student of the Qur'an. She began her commercial activities at a very young age, notably making soap which she learned from her older brother. After many years of apprenticeship she is now very experienced and knowledgeable as she has been making soap for 10 years now and enjoys great reknown in Ségou and nearby villages where she has many customers. In order to make traditionnal soap, she burns five litres of shea oil in a pot or in a barrel, to which she then adds 40 litres of water, ½ kilogram of flour and 3 kilograms of caustic soda. She then mixes everything with a large ladle until she has a paste from which to make the soap. She has a 3-year relationship with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinancial institution and is asking for a loan to increase her business so that she can satisfy her customers' demand. She has had three previous group loans, all repaid. This is her first individual loan. With the loan requested of 150,000 FCFA she will buy 20 kilograms of shea oil, 6 kilograms of flour, 9 kilograms of caustic soda. She gets her raw materials locally in Ségou. Diarra Aminata Djiré sells both for cash and on credit to clients, both men and women, rural and city-dwellers. She expects to make a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which she will use to pay for her children's tuition and a number of social events (baptism, wedding). Her goal is to build a house.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make soap.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es: Ceferina, es una madre abnegada, que desea con todas sus fuerzas ver profesional a su único hijo, a sus 54 años a logrado tener su casa propia, pero aun quiere obtener muchas cosas más. Para Ceferina, su hijo Cristian de 11 años, se ha convertido en el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con su bolsa de cosméticos en mano, sale todos los días a convencer a sus clientas de comprarle una crema o alguna pieza de maquillaje, Ceferina es muy convincente en su trabajo, no en vano es una de las mejores vendedoras y lleva ya 3 años en este negocio, del cual lo que más le gusta, es conversar con sus clientes e informarle sobre los productos más novedosos, en el futuro le gustaría poner su tienda de cosméticos, puesto que se le hace muy difícil cobrarle a sus clientes todos los meses. Ella trabaja sin descanso mes a mes con el único fin de mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva su adorado hijo Cristian. MFP le a concedido por primera vez un préstamo a Ceferina, quien esta muy feliz por ello, ha trabajado mucho en su banco comunal para lograr este crédito y no quiere faltar a ninguna de sus cuotas. Con este préstamo, Ceferina comprará más cosméticos, invertirá todo el monto en incrementar su mercadería, para tener productos más surtidos.
texts.en:
Ceferina is a selfless mother who wants, with all her might, to see her only son adopt a profession. At 54, she's managed to get her own house but there are still a lot of things she wants. For Ceferina, her son, Cristian, 11, has become the focus of all her efforts. With her bag of cosmetics in hand, she goes out every day to convince her customers to buy a cream or some item of make-up from her. Ceferina is very persuasive and it's not surprising that she's one of the top saleswomen. She's operated the business for 3 years. What she likes most is talking to customers and telling them about new products. In the future, she would like to set up her own cosmetics shop becuase she's found it difficult to see all of her customers during every month. Ceferina works tirelessly, month after month, with the single-minded goal of making a better life for her beloved son, Cristian. This is Ceferina's first MFP loan and she's very happy to get it. She's worked hard at her community bank to get this loan and doesn't want to miss a single installment. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics, investing the total amount in adding merchandise so that she has the stock she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add merchandise.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. B. was recognized as a Paglaum member on 29 May 2007 and is a resident of Barangay Guinabut. She is married and has six children, three of whom are studying and working while living with relatives. Her husband is sickly because he has asthma, so she raises her children through her own efforts.

Mrs. B. considers herself fortunate to be part of Paglaum's membership, because she has already enjoyed its programs and services. She says that without the help of Paglaum's credit services, she would not have been able to open her business selling whole coconuts and coco shells. Her family has slowly overcome their previous difficulties, because now they have their own means of earning a living.

She is now requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP ($200) to buy more whole coconuts and coco shells for her business. She aspires to someday expand her business more and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase whole coconuts and coco shells for her business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Mme Adjoa A. est née en 1974 à Vogan avec quatre (04) personnes en charge dont son mari licencié abusivement. Elle est donc seule à faire face aux charges du ménage avec son commerce de vente de riz blanc préparé. Afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et avoir un rendement meilleur, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker  du riz, faire un apâtame et mieux s'équiper. Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle subviendra mieux aux charges de sa famille et aura contribué à soulager leur peine.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjoa A. was born in 1974 in Vogan and has four people to take care of, including her husband who was improperly fired. She thus is the sole caretaker of her family with her business of selling cooked white rice. In order to increase her profits and increase her productivity, she seeks a loan to stock up on rice, build a hut and get better equipment. With the profits, she will better meet the needs of her family and help relieve some of their suffering.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is 63 years old. He lives with his wife in a private house in Beregovo. He sells various home products in his kiosk located at the central market. Boris has been in this business for 5 years. The good location of his kiosk, large assortment of goods, and low prices bring many customers in. Moreover, the business of selling small home products does not have seasonal ups and downs. It enables Boris to have a stable income. 

Boris would like to borrow 6,500 Ukranian Hryvna to increase the assortment of his goods. He came to the conclusion that a larger assortment would enable more people to purchase what they need at one location. Thus the assortment is the key factor for his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Abigail es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras.
Abigail es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Abigail viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende pescado, verduras y de la selva compra frutas variadas que luego transporta en carro alquilado y lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Abigail necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos.
Los sueños de Abigail son comprar una computadora para sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Abigail is a member of the Palmeras [Palm trees] Community Bank. She has a common-law husband, is 40 years old and has two children. Abigail travels to the jungle in the Ayacucho region to sell fish and vegetables. While there she also buys various fruits which she then hauls in her rented car and sells in the food market in the city of Ayacucho. Abigail needs a loan of 600 Peruvian soles [about US $ 200], which she will invest in the purchase of chickens. Abigail's dreams are to buy a computer for her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Tusajigwe

texts.en:
Greetings from Tanzania! This is Tusajigwe S. from Tukuyu. She is twenty-five years old and married with a three-year-old child. She is also supporting two children who were orphaned. Tusajigwe has been running a business selling used clothing since 1998. She works at her business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, assisted by two employees. She currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. Tusajigwe thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Audelys Isabel

texts.es: Audelys Isabel M. M. tiene la edad de 41 años, ella tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 20 años respectivamente. Audelys se dedica al destace de cerdos desde hace 11 años, para el inicio de este negocio, su esposo le dio la idea de comprar un cerdo para engorde y luego matarlo para vender su carne,  ellos vieron que en este negocio había rentabilidad, de esta manera decidieron no solo destazar cerdos sino también reces y todo tipo de ganado, además alquilan sus tierras para que los animales puedan comer pasto, esta actividad en un comienzo la realizaban dos veces al mes, años mas tarde al cambiar de domicilio empezaron a destazar grandes cantidades de animales, en donde Fundación León 2000 ha sido una mano amiga por medio de financiamientos, y asi sigue deseando una excelente preparación para sus hijos y el bienestar de su familia, ya que esto es lo de mas valor que el podría dejarles a su familia. Audelys precisa de un financiamiento para comprar al menos 10 vacas al mes, para aumentar sus ganancias y proyectar su negocio como una microempresa, además ayudar a sus padres quienes por su vejez han estado un poco enfermos.
texts.en:
Audelys Isabel M. M. is 41, and has 2 children, ages 17 and 20. Audelys has been a pig farmer for the past 11 years. To begin this business, her husband gave her the idea to buy a pig to fatten and then slaughter to sell its meat. They realized that this business was profitable, and decided to begin fattening all types of livestock animals. They also began to rent out their land for grazing purposes, which they initially did twice a month. Years later, they moved to a new home and began to fatten even more livestock. Fundación León has been financial help in this regard. Audelys continues to desire an excellent preparation for her and the well-being of the family, as this business is the most valuable thing she could leave for the family. Audelys needs a loan to purchase at least 10 cows per month, in order to increase her income and increase her business as a small business. She also needs to help her parents, who, do to their old age, have been a bit ill.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hard-working vegetable vendor in the village of San Jose Norte 1, town of Mallig, Isabela. She is married to Melchor, a simple farmer. Farming is the major source of income in the village.

Zenaida is seeking the support of KIVA lenders who are willing to fund her loan for business improvement. She is proposing to borrow the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital. Zenaida is hoping to maintain her business's good quality to able give her customers better satisfaction.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: María Isaura R. C. tiene la edad de 41 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. María inicio ofreciendo sus productos visitando a algunas amistades, por lo que con la ayuda de ellos fue que logro obtener popularidad para vender sus productos, ya que tuvo que recorrer distancias mucho más larga, algunas veces recorría municipios, pero lo hacía con la esperanza de que a sus hijos no les faltara el pan de cada día. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calcetines, camisas, pantalones y toallas. Su deseo es comprar un lugar que facilite las condiciones para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Isaura R. C. is a 41 year old single mother of 2 dependent children. She has been selling clothing for more than 3 years. María started offering her products while visiting friends. With their help, she managed to obtain a following for her line of products. María has to travel great distances, even into the cities, as part of her job. She does this with the hope that her children won’t go hungry. The loan she is requesting is for working capital to purchase socks, shirts, pants and towels. She hopes to buy a suitable place where she can offer her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida O. is an abiding resident citizen of San Isidro Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, happily married and blessed with six school-aged children. She is a good member and business partner of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since she became a member/client of the Cooperative.

Currently she is into an Agri-Business Venture and owns a business of raising crops and selling them to Public Markets and to its regular customers. She has owned and operated the business for 15 years now. In order to be more productive with her business operations, she availed herself of a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase fertilizers such as animal manure & other types of fertilizers which suits the needs of her business. With this she knew that she could uplift the general loving conditions of her family both financially and emotionally.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia  es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de septiembre”, en el centro poblado de Mquera del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, ella pudo estudiar segundaria incompleta (2do grado).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con lo cual pudo adquirir animales menores.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para la compra de animales mayores vacas y vaquillas, ella los adquiere en las comunidades de la zona, y los vende en las ferias de Ilave y Juli.

Su deseo es aumentar sus animales para poder comercializar a los mayoristas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia is a member of the community bank "September 22nd," in the town center of Mquera of the key district, in the province of El Collao in the Puno department. She is 43 years old, cohabits and has 5 children. She has completed studies through 2nd grade. Lucia has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years, and her first loan was for 300.00 new Soles, which was the reason she was able to acquire small animals. Currently, she requests a loan of $875; the loan will enable her to purchase large animals like cattle and heifers; she acquires them in the in the communities of the region and sells them in the fairs of key and Juli. Her wish is to add to her animals to be able to sells to the wholesale market. She likes meetings and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cattle and heifers

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Idunda D borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 10,5 years.

Hilda started her own business selling charcoal 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 185,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Hilda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Hilda hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina T., 33, is a rice grower from Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She has two children. Her eldest child is 12. Her husband is also a farmer that helps her manage the farm. She said that her CEVI loans help a lot to sustain her livelihood. She inherited the farm from her parents and hopes that it will provide for the needs of her family, especially food and clothing. 

Now she wants to grow her business. By taking a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos with CEVI, she will have the chance to grow her harvest. The loan will be used to pay the laborers as well as the owner of the equipment they used during land preparation.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 35 year old mother of one. She sells bananas in Gikomba market in Nairobi, a business she has been operating for the last three years. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 40,000 in order to add stock of bananas. She hopes to educate her daughter and give her family a good life. She plans to one day run an established business. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: La Luna Nueva Group

texts.es:
La   señora Dolores Alarcón C. es originaria de un pueblito muy pequeño escondido entre los cerros  llamado Buenos Aires ubicado en el estado de Oaxaca, ella es madre soltera de 2 niños  pequeños  hasta hace poco trabajaba en otra comunidad retirada de su hogar  como empleada domestica para solventar los gastos de su familia  pero descuidaba  asus pequeños hijos, hace 5 meses ella decidió emprender un negocio propio es la venta venta de antojitos típicos de la región y venta de carne de pollo lamentablemente es muy costoso trasladarse de su hogar a acatlàn de Pérez  Figueroa a conseguir el pollo en pluma para venderlo en su comunidad por tal motivo ella solicito un crédito por que  ella desea hacer una pequeña granjita ahorrase los gastos de traslado y  así poder estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos y asegurarles una educación y prepáralos para un futuro mejor . Con el préstamo  la señora Dolores comprara pollos en pluma, bebederos y alimento. Mismo motivo por el cual la señora  Dolores  se unió al grupo La L. nueva para solicitar el crédito grupal a Fundación Realidad A.C. los  otros  miembros  del grupo son:

1.-Margarita A.  Ladino______venta de dulces.
2.-Silvia García Hernández_______venta de comida.
3.-Noemí O. Solís__________venta de comida.
4.-Martha C. Perea__________venta de refresco y molino de nixtamal.
5.-Benito Alarcón González_______venta  de maíz y fríjol.
6.-Felicitas Alarcón L.._________venta de refrescos.
7.-Bernarda M. Méndez_______venta de ropa.
8.-Juana C. González___________venta de maíz.
9.-Benigna C. Perea__________venta de cerdos.
10.-Victoria Sánchez  Martínez_____venta de antojitos.
11.-Cirila Gómez Ramírez_________venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores Alarcón C. is originally from a small town hidden in the Buenos Aires hills in the state of Oaxaca and is the single mother of two young children. Until recently she worked as a housekeeper in another remote town to support her family, causing her to neglect her two small children. Five months ago she decided to start her own business and begin selling typical local snacks and chicken. Unfortunately, the trip from home to Acatlàn de Pérez Figueroa to buy live chickens to bring back home to sell is very expensive. Because of this, she is requesting a loan. She wants to start a small farm to save on travel expenses, be more devoted to her children, ensure they get an education, and prepare them for a better future. With the loan, Dolores will buy live chickens, water troughs, and feed. For these same reasons, Dolores has joined La L. Group to apply for a loan from the Fundación Realidad A.C. The other members of the group are: 1.-Margarita A. Ladino________Candy Sales. 2.-Silvia García Hernández________Food Sales. 3.-Noemí O. Solís____________Food Sales. 4.-Martha C. Perea__________Beverage and Flour Grinder Sales 5.-Benito Alarcón González________Corn and Beans Sales 6.-Felicitas Alarcón L..__________Beverage Sales. 7.-Bernarda M.
