Méndez_______Clothing Sales 8.-Juana C. González___________Corn Sales. 9.-Benigna C. Perea__________Pig Sales 10.-Victoria Sánchez Martínez______Snack Sales 11.-Cirila Gómez Ramírez__________Snack Sales

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUY SUPPLIES NECESSARY TO START  FARM/ CREATE BETTER RETURNS FOR HER LABORS

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una joven mujer de 34 años, tiene tres pequeños hijos: Kevin de 13, Nicole de 10 y Milena de 6 años. En la actualidad solo vive con ellos, porque su esposo Roberto se encuentra trabajando en otra ciudad, pues se dedica a la agricultura.

Desde hace 2 años por circunstancias de la vida empezó a dedicarse a la venta de carbón en un mercado ubicado en la zona por donde vive. Al principio era temporal, porque tomó el puesto de una señora que lo dejó a su cargo y con el tiempo se hizo su trabajo fijo, el que le permitía ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y otras cosas personales.
A ella le gusta atender en su tienda porque no tiene competencia y le es rentable porque según sus propias palabras “si no lo hubiera dejado, lo continué porque me rendía bastante”.
Martha puede atender el negocio en el mercado y al atardecer regresar a su hogar para ver a sus hijas, ella no se cansa porque es una mujer muy laboriosa, pues quiere salir adelante; y algún día ampliar el negocio para vender carbón al por mayor en un amplio local, ya casi lo puede imaginar porque su mente de empresaria se lo permite.

Es por eso, que aunque ya es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, está completamente segura de cumplir con puntualidad porque sabe que tendrá otros préstamos que le permitan mejorar en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita mejorará las instalaciones del local que tiene en la actualidad, ya que está medio deteriorado. Empezará por arreglar el piso para que su tienda de carbón proyecte una mejor imagen.
texts.en:
Martha is a young woman of 34 with three children: Kevin, age 13; Nicole, age 10; and Milena, age 6. She currently lives alone with them, since her husband Roberto is working in another city in the field of agriculture. Two years ago, due to the circumstances of her life, Martha began selling charcoal in a market near her home. At first, the work was intermittent; she substituted for a woman who would leave the shop in her care. Over time, it became her permanent job, allowing her to help her husband with the household costs and other personal expenses. Martha enjoys running her shop, because she has no competition and it is profitable. In her own words, "if she hadn't left it, I still would have continued, because it brought me plenty of income." Martha is able to run her business at the market and return home in the evening to see her daughters. She does not get tired, because she is an extremely hardworking woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She hopes someday to expand her business and sell charcoal wholesale in a large facility; thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit, she can already picture this in her mind. This is Martha's fourth loan with MFP, and she is completely confident that she will repay it punctually, because she knows that she will have other loans in the future that will permit her to enhance her business. With the funds she is requesting, she will improve the infrastructure of the shop she currently operates, since it has deteriorated somewhat. She will begin by repairing the floor, so that her charcoal shop will project a better image to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovating her charcoal shop

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente G. is 50 years old and resides in Barangay Estefania Amulung, Cagayan. He is happily married and blessed with five loving children: Rovida, 31 years old and married; Reyfel, 27 years old and a graduate of an automotive course; Rexon, 17 years old and studying criminology; Rochavin, 12 years old and a sixth grade pupil; and Rovie, 10 years old and a fourth grade pupil. 

Vicente sells rice. His wife is a local vendor who sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables in their village. Since his wife does not have regular work, he started his own business as another source of income. Together they are helping one another to provide for their basic needs. Vicente wants to improve his business; consequently, he is asking to borrow PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. He plans to use the money to buy several sacks of rice and other commodities that he can offer to his customers.

loans.use: purchasing several sacks of rice and other commodities

loans.name: Twekembe Amina Nabukenya Group

texts.en: Amina N. is the group president; she is a promissing business lady of thirty-one years old. She lives with her spouse and they are blessed with four children of whom two are going to school. She is using the loan to purchase restaurant items such as saucepans, plates, and so forth, plus renovating her restaurant. She is sensing a big change in her restaurant business. Her future plan is to prosper and change or improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant items such as saucepans, plates, etc. plus renovating the restaurant

loans.name: Habibemi

texts.en: Habibemi is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells cement. She wants to add sales of drums and minerals to her business in order to increase her profit. She is therefore requesting a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase drums and minerals to sell. She hopes that this loan will help build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase drums and minerals to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 45 years old and the mother of six children. She sells cooked foods in a location which is very accessible to most of her customers. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Comfort is requesting the loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 35, has been spending time to cultivate a rice crop since she was single. She now has a partner in her husband, who assists her on the farm. The couple has two teenage kids who are going to school.

San S. needs a loan to buy a neighbor’s cow, which she will use to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To buy a neighbor’s cow

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly S. is a modest citizen living in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she has made a living selling fish in the busy local market since 2001. She has a partner in her husband, who assists her in conducting the business. The couple now have five children who are attending school.

Ly S. has been planning to redecorate her old house for a long time but she doesn’t have the capacity to do that, as she has only a small income. Therefore, Ly S. is applying for a loan of US$ 1000 which will allow her to redecorate and mend her house. (Ly S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To redecorate and mend her house.

loans.name: Eugénie Rufine Aimée

texts.fr: G. Eugénie Rufine Aimée est née le 10 Août 1956 au Congo, pays voisin du Bénin. Il y a 8 ans environs que Rufine Aimée s’est installée à Sékou à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Rufine Aimée est en effet mariée à NASSARA Florentin, un comptable retraité, et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Rufine Aimée a trois autres enfants à sa charge. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Rufine Aimée a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Rufine Aimée vend des boucles d’oreille à Sékou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Rufine Aimée vend également des foulards, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Rufine Aimée s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Rufine Aimée souhaite augmenter le stock de ses produits pour mieux faire face à la demande des clients. C’est pourquoi Rufine Aimée sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Eugénie Rufine Aimée G. was born August 10, 1956 in Congo, a country adjacent to Benin. About eight years ago she settled in Sékou in the Allada area, part of the Department of the Atlantic, where she lives with her husband and children. Rufine Aimée is indeed married to Florentin NASSARA, a retired accountant, and is the mother of two children, both of whom have had schooling. Rufine Aimee has herself attended school up to secondary level. She has three other children under her care, and the couple share responsibility for household expenses. To meet her needs, Rufine Aimée sells earrings in Sekou. As a side business, she also sells scarves, which provides her with several sources of income. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Faced with an ever-increasing customer demand, Rufine Aimée wants to increase her stock of supplies and improve her response to customers. This is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 jewelry assortments and 20 scarves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Odion

texts.en:
Odion sells groceries and drinks at retail prices. She has been in this business for three years. She is 39 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their household.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and a generator. She says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and a generator

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody R. is a 39-year-old strong woman with the faith and determination to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother of 5 young children.

As a mother of big dreams, in 2005 she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since then, she has started selling rice and fish and this really helps them to meet their needs.

Now Melody requests her 5th loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her business. Specifically she will buy 8 sacks of rice and fresh fish.

She hopes that with the help of ASHI and KIVA she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her five children in school until they complete their college degrees.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of rice and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Sary Yan Village Bank Group

texts.en: There are eight people, living in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province, who make up this village bank loan. They will use the loan for different purpose in order to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. S. Y. is the village bank president, as selected by all the members in this village bank loan. She and her husband, Mr. S. An, are farmers who own 4-hectare of land to grow rice to sell so they can support their family's living costs. They are diligent and yet still, they can earn little income because their field has infertile soil and it is far from any irrigation system. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. S. Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump machine. Through this activity, they can support three children, two of whom are laborers, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine.

loans.name: Nhyira Akwan Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
John describes himself as hard-working, a man who sees no challenge as too great. He is 40 years old and is the leader of the “Nhyira Akwan” (translated as 'Ways of blessings') borrower group. John is a petty trader and trades in toothpaste and brushes. He has been selling these for the past ten years. He is excited to be taking out this loan, which he will use to purchase assorted toothpastes and brushes to serve his customers. He is divorced and the father of three children of ages 10-15. 

The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, smoked fish, palm oil production, grocery sales, used clothing sales, etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. They hope to put aside more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children, hopefully through university level.

loans.use: To purchase assorted toothpastes and brushes in bulk

loans.name: Yoma

texts.en: Yoma R. is currently in the business of selling cocks and hens and is requesting a loan to purchase turkeys to sell. Yoma is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend her business by constructing enough room for keeping domestic birds to sell. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase turkeys to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Silvia Filomena

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada, tiene la edad de 62 años, desde hace varios años logro poner su propio negocio un salón de belleza, con ayuda de sus hijos que están en el extranjero los cuales aun aportan con remesas.
La iniciativa comienza para lograr mejores condiciones en su vida, además ya cuenta con más edad, lo que se le hace difícil, poder trabajar
Ala empresa privada. 
 Contenta por que a través de sus trabajos ha logrado captar sus clientes, también da trabajos  a dos jóvenes que son auxiliar y trabajan juntas, ya que hay día que el salón esta lleno.
Con el financiamiento logro pintar unos cuartos que alquila que son otras entradas para lograr pagar los gastos básicos.
Con este préstamo cambiara el techo que esta viejo y quiere mejorar esta condición por que cada que llueve se le pasa el agua.
Para esto comprara zinc nuevo, perlines, golosos, pintura de aceite para pintar los perlines, cener entre otos productos para mejorar el techo.
texts.en:
Silvia is a very hardworking woman. She is 62 years old. Several years ago she opened her own beauty salon, with the help of her children who live abroad and send remittances to her. She would like to make some improvements in her home because she is older, which makes it difficult to work in her business. She is happy because through her work she has secured her clients. She also provides work for two young people who help out and work together because there are days when the salon is full. With this loan she will paint some rooms that she rents out for additional income, which she uses to pay basic expenses. With this loan she will also change the roof, which is old, because every time it rains, water gets in. She will buy new tin roofing, metal beams, bolts, paint for the beams and bolts, and other products for improving the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New tin roofing, metal beams, bolts, paint for the beams and bolts, and other products for improving the roof of her house

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda J. is from the town of Talibon. She is 34 years old. Belinda is single. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She recently started selling ready-to-wear clothes and hopes to be able to expand her new venture. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

Belinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Belinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is single. She lives in Zaporozhye and runs her retail business in one of the city markets. Irina sells women's footwear and sock liners, as well as shorts and shirts for men. She is the only entrepreneur in the marketplace who has such big vending kiosks. Irina started her enterprise 3 years ago. Currently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory.  

Irina is requesting a loan of 5,400 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal footwear and re-stock her merchandise before fall. She is also hoping to diversify men's clothing merchandise in her second location. She is seeking to further develop her business. Irina is very goal-oriented which has been instrumental in her business achievements.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal footwear.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is from the village of Salay in the municipality of Angadanan in Isabela Province. She is 48 years old. Nenita is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years, and she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to add to working capital. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nenita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo M. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 32 years old. Eduardo is single. To make a living, Eduardo owns & operates  a business primarily raising pigs for fattening and sale. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when he sells his raised animals.

Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Daysi Elizabeth

texts.es:
Daysi es una señora que se dedica a la venta de pupusas y panes con pollo, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 19, 12 y 8 años, ellos residen en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután; el negocio fue iniciativa propia ubicándolo en su propia casa, y lo atiende desde las cuatro de la tarde hasta las diez de la noche.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, pollo todo para la elaboración de la pupusas y los panes, Deysi desea invertir para aumentar su preparación y así que sus ventas e ingresos sean mejores y poder ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos diarios.
Este préstamo ayudara a fortalecer su negocio a cubrir mayores demandas de los clientes. Doña Daysi aspira tener un negocio grande, con muchos clientes para darle a su familia una mejor vida y que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Daysi engages in selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) and “panes con pollo” (bread stuffed with chicken). She is married and has 3 children aged 19, 12 and 8: they all live in Jucuapa, in the Usulutáan department. She stated this activity of her own volition establishing it in her own house, and working form 4 pm to 10 pm. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy maize, pork cracklings, quesillos (tortillas with cream cheese filling) and chicken to prepare pupusas and chicken stuffed bread. Daysi wants to invest in her activity to increase her production: this will help her improve her sales and increase her income, thus being able to provide for her children and face their daily expenses. Through this loan she will consolidate her activity and satisfy a higher number of requests. Daysi wishes to own a big shop and to have many customers, in order to offer to her family better life conditions; she also wishes that her son get an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare pupusas and chicken stuffed bread.

loans.name: Fe En Dios 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.es:
Georgina es una de los miembro del Grupo Fe en Dios 4, 5, y 6, compuesto por 13 mujeres y dos hombres microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, joyerias, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su pareja y tres hijos, de los cuales aun dos viven con ellos. Nos dice que su actividad favoritas es comer, por lo que disfruta cada horario de comida. 

Georgina está muy emocionada de recibir su Segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 15 años, el cual inició vendiendo prendas de Oro. Georgina está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de 15 unidades de perfumes y Diez pares de zapatos. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para construir un habitacion en su vivienda, y aportar a los ingresos de la familia. Su sueño es poder viajar por varios paises, y poder comprar mercancias en el exterior, ve su sueño muy facil de cumplir si se dedica y continua desarrollando su negocio a traves de los prestamos.

Está asociada de Esperanza adqurio un prestamo con nosotros porque tenía el deseo de superarse y seguir inyectando capital a su negocio. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de Samana, una ciudad turistica en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Oceano atlantico, con hermosas playas y rica en recursos naturales.
texts.en:
Georgina is one of the members of the Grupo Fe en Dios 4, 5, & 6 [Faith in God 4, 5 & 6 Group] composed of 13 women and two men, owners of microenterprises in the areas of clothing sales, natural product sales, shoe and jewelry sales, etc. Her family is made up of her, her partner and three children of whom two still live with them. She tells us her favorite activity is eating, so she enjoys every mealtime. 

Georgina is very excited to receive her Second loan with Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loan and taken another step for the growth of her business. She has had her business for around 15 years and began by selling pieces of gold jewelry. Georgina is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of 15 units of perfume and ten pairs of shoes. She is going to use her earnings to build a new room in her living quarters and to contribute to the household income. Her dream is to be able to travel to various countries and buy merchandise abroad. She sees her dream as very easy to fulfill if she is dedicated and continues developing her business through the loans. 

This associate of Esperanza obtained a loan with us because she had the desire to do better and continue injecting capital into her business. Her story is being used to represent the other members of the group and the clients of Esperanza, both Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haití, some of them recently) and the Dominicans, who in general live in very poor communities. This area, like many other areas of scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, is lacK. in safe drinK. water and dependable electrical service. This group is located in the low-resource area of Samana, a developing tourist destination bordered by the coast of the Atlantic Ocean with beautiful beaches and rich in natural resources.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and shoes

loans.name: Chean

texts.en:
Chean R. has been in the farming business for many years. She plants various crops to earn a living and normally generates an income of 2.5 USD per day. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her.

Most of her family’s income comes from her child who sells groceries next to her village. She hopes to encourage her child’s business by expanding the amount of necessary groceries to sell, but she has no cash to make that possible. To solve the problem, Chean R. is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries for her daughter to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her daughter to sell

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FE EN DIOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es L. Sr. Aurelio; él es conviviente y tiene 3 Hijos; El socio se dedica a trabajar en una empresa D. seguridad como jefe D. operaciones llamada Metro Segurity, el trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, su esposa se dedica a trabajar en un restaurant y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere tener una tienda D. abarrotes El socio solicita el préstamo para L. mantención D. su casa, para comprar alimentos como leche, azúcar y arroz.

Los otros socios  se dedican a L. venta D. artesanía, venta D. pinturas, venta D. ropa, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. casacas.
 
L. socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Fe en Dios” (Faith in God) Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Aurelio is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  He works in a security company, Metro Segurity, as chief of operations.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  His wife works in a restaurant, and together they get their children ahead.

He wants to have a grocery store.  He is requesting a loan for home maintenance and to buy food like milk, sugar, and rice.

The other members sell handicrafts, sell paintings, sell clothes, sell cosmetics, or sell jackets.

He is grateful to those who make this dream possible, and he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: For home maintenance and to buy food like milk, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with five children, four attend school while one graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a fresh water selling business for over one year and sells from home to her neighbours. Judith faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot summer season, the supply of water becomes low compared to the high demand at the market. She hopes to open a poultry business in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to start a poultry business and  purchase a brood of chicken. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a chickens to start poultry business

loans.name: Susana Wariara

texts.en:
Susana has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 43 years old and married to Samuel W.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She paid her first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Susana hopes to grow her business and start selling all types of clothing under one roof.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, fruit, and coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables, fruit, and coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T.  has three children aged 16, 14 and 3. She is engaged in farming. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. Farming has been her family's source of income for more than a decade now. Lucia does her best to keep the farm productive. She wishes to have an extra source of income to help provide for her family's needs.

Lucia currently needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to buy what she needs for the farm.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene S. is from the village of Turod. He is 21 years old, married and has one small child. To make a living, Eugene provides tricycle transport services to local community members. Eugene has been in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Eugene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Eugene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is 32 years old and has 4 children, including a new 2-week old baby. She is a member of the communal bank "Solidaridad" and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 6 years now. She will be using her loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy children's clothing in Lima to sell in Ayacucho. One day she would like to be able to open a small grocery store in her home. Sandra enjoys working with FINCA because they have a simple loan process and provide savings and education.

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  buying & selling dried fish, operating a sari-sari store and a farming business. Her husband Ernesto, who is 67 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 21 and 37 years old. Rosita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Rosita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam belongs to a small city in Pakistan called Kasur which is famous for its tanneries industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Paka qila for the past ten years. She is a very supportive lady by nature. In order to help her husband financially support the family, she stitches clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. Mariam is the mother of four daughters and two sons. Her sons are involved in the business of recycling scrap while her daughters are getting their education.
 
Her husband’s name is J. and he is involved in a swings business. He particularly offers his swings services to young children. Children enjoy a lot of his swings and they are in high demand in his area. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another swing called a "revolving whirl". This will help him to entertain more children and earn better profits.  He has been operating this business for the past ten years and Mariam is hopeful that an investment will improve the financial condition of his business. 

Mariam is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Mariam.

loans.use: to buy a swing called a "revolving whirl".

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 1, in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. 

Batsaikhan owns a plot of land and small wooden house on it. His wife currently is looking after her baby. Since 2007, Batsaikhan has been running a transportation business. He has a small truck and carries goods between Erdenet and other cities of Mongolia. 

Mr.Batsaikhan is planning to build a proper family brick house next to his old one. He is asking for a loan to buy necessary building materials, such as bricks, concrete mix and wood.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials such as bricks, concrete mix and wood to build a family house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married and has five children.

In 2009 Ahmad opened his own bookstore where he sells stationery items. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to repair the wall of the store and to renovate it from inside. He is aiming to increase his sales so he will be able to expand in the future.

loans.use: To repair the wall of the shop and to renovate it from inside.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo y de joyería femenina.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es perfumes para mujer y hombres, también desea vender ropa y zapatos, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía y así tener más inventario en su negocio e ingreso. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Juan Antonio se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
For over three years, Gabriela has been making a living by selling beauty products and jewelry through a catalog. Currently, her business lacks variety when it comes to items such as perfume for men and women. Gabriela would also like to sell clothing and shoes but does not have the funds necessary to purchase the inventory.

Gabriela is seeking a loan in order to purchase additional merchandise which will permit her to have a wider range of products and to increase her income. To repay the loan, Gabriela will use the earnings from her business, given that her husband, Juan Antonio, will take care of the household expenses with the income he receives from his job.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. is single. She is a hairdresser and a seller of cooking utensils at Amoanda near Elmina.

Ama uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. A loan will serve as an additional capital to purchase varieties of cooking utensils to supply her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to establish a salon.

In this picture Ama is displaying the cooking utensils she sells.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of cooking utensils to supply her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, oil, beef, pork, 3-minute soups, chicken, beans, juices and sodas.

loans.name: Fortuna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTUNA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Tomasa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de diversos productos, venta de CD’s, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de dulces, venta de comida 

La señora Tomasa indica que hace dos años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, en distintos centro. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe que inicio hace treinta años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de ropa de bebe) que lo adquirirá  por mayor de las calle Incachaca, Uyustus y Buenos Aires; para la posteriormente venderla en la feria de la 16 de julio los días domingos y Jueves y los día lunes en el Puente Vela.. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la forma de trabajo en el área de salud.
texts.en:
The village bank "Fortuna" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima Center. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board chaired by Tomasa. The association members have various businesses including selling CDs, selling miscellaneous goods, selling sweets and food sales. 

Tomasa has worked for Pro Mujer for 2 years in different centers. Currently she has a business selling baby clothes that she started 30 years ago, learning from her mother.

The loan that she will take out now is to augment her merchandise (to buy baby clothes) that she gets in bulk on the streets of Incachaca, Uyustus and Buenos Aires. She later sells them at the 16 de Julio bazaar on Sundays and Thursdays, and in Puente Vela on Mondays. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes their work in the health field.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes.

loans.name: Vengie

texts.en: Vengie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Vengie has a shop that sells charcoal, bananas, and coconuts. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional wood and coconut shells for charcoal making. Vengie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Vengie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional woods and coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
Gina nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), tiene 31 años de edad y tiene un hijo. Actualmente,  Gina  vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su hijo.  Gina  y su esposo tienen  un negocio familiar que cosiste en hacer mantenimientos de carros, ella en el taller desempeña la labor administrativa como hacer documentos, licitaciones, cotizaciones, compras y otras cosas más. Su esposo es la persona que se encarga de la administración del negocio. Ya son varios años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad  Gina requiere el préstamo para comprar herramientas y respuestos como por ejemplo llaves, aceites, lubricantes, grasa, tuercas y otras cosas más.

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Allpa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Gina was born in the city of Cusco (Perú).  She is 31 years old and has a son.  Gina currently lives in the same city she was born in with her son.  Gina and her husband have a family business consisting in providing car maintenance.  She carries out the administrative tasks in the shop like documentation, negotiations, pricing, purchasing and other things.  Her husband runs the business.  

They’ve been in this business for several years now and they do quite well thanks to the effort they put into their work.  On this occasion, Gina wants the loan to buy tools and spare parts like: wrenches, oil, lubricant, grease, nuts and other things.


She is a responsible, hard working person who was invited by her fellow members to join Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Alllpa” communal bank because of that.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and has six children. Evangeline is married and four of her children are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evangeline has been farming rice for 13 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Sreytoch is 26 years old and she and her husband, Kimhong, live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four daughters--two are in school and other two are still young. 

Sreytoch is a tailor who specializes in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. Her husband sells car seat covers. She is asking for a loan of $700 to help with her husband’s business by purchasing additional car seat covers for sale.

Photo: Sreytoch and her husband.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s business by purchasing additional car seat covers for sale.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила – вдова. Она живет в небольшом городе, где имеет свой бизнес – торгует на рынке подростковой обувью и одеждой. Людмила занимается этим бизнесом уже 19 лет. Ей нравится обслуживать клиентов, помогать им выбирать подходящую обувь и одежду. Людмила выбирает качественный товар, который будет долго носиться и радовать покупателей.

Людмила просит выдать кредит в сумме 12,000 гривен на приобретение товара к осеннему школьному сезону. Она надеется увеличить продажи, а полученную прибыль потратить на благоустройство своего жилья.
texts.en: Ludmila is a widow. She lives in a small town, where for the last nineteen years she has sold teen clothing and shoes on the market. She enjoys assisting customers; helping them pick out clothing that fits. She acquires high-quality goods that wear long and are a joy to buyers. Ludmila is asking for a loan in order to purchase goods for the upcoming school season. She hopes to increase her sales and fix up her home with the profits.

loans.use: to buy additional sales goods for the school season.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from the village of Zuygaghbyur in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She has a university degree and has been engaged in farming for the past twenty years.  With her honesty and hard work, she hopes to continue growing her business.  

Tamara is looking for a loan to purchase fuel to harvest hay.  She prefers microfinance institutions because of their products and customer friendly attitude.  With this investment she expects her income to increase by twenty percent.  This loan will increase her total investment in the business by twenty five percent.  Tamara enjoys the nature of Zuygaghbyur and lives close to her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to harvest hay

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, one boy and one girl. One of her children attends school while the other one is still young for school. They live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a bar business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Lydia faces a major challenge of competition from other bar operators in the area. She dreams of owning a house for her family in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase crates of beer and establish a wines and spirits shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer and establish a wines and spirits shop.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Milagros buys and sells fruits, vegetables & charcoal per kilogram.  She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits & vegetables to sell.

Milagros is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Milagros hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits & vegetables for sell

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Chanda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Chanda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Groundnut Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Groundnut” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 3,600,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Salamatu, 36. She was born in the town of Kamakwe in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a soldier and the couple has four children: three in primary school and one in secondary school.  Salamatu is a petty businesswoman who has been selling groundnuts for the past eight years. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy bags of groundnuts to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts to add to her business

loans.name: Chawkat

texts.en: Chawkat is a 26-year-old married man and father of one child. Since 2003, he has worked fixing car bodies. His business is improving because he is working hard at it for his family’s benefit. He makes sure they have a main source of income. Chawkat is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary machines and tools that will help a lot in improving his business. These items will help him do the requested work in a very professional way and in a short period of time. Chawkat hopes to open a big car maintenance company that provides a wide variety of services for cars.

loans.use: To buy necessary machines and tools for his business

loans.name: Miriam Natalia

texts.es:
La Señorita. Miriam es socia del banco comunal Patys FLC, vive por la parroquia Tarqui en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, sus grandes llanuras le hacen un lugar propicio para la cría de ganado y mas animales, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita. Miriam tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá  se dedican a la ganadería y su mamá atiende una tienda que tiene en su casa. La casa en la que habitan es de propiedad de sus padres.
 
Ella es profesional en la rama de la belleza y labora en un gabinete que es de su propiedad, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y esta pidiendo otro prestamo para invertir en màs productos para su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  tintes de pelo, champú, esmaltes de uñas, tratamientos para el cabello, etc. que necesita en su gabinete.
 
Su meta es tener un Spa.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Patys FLC community bank in Cuenca.  The great plains around the city are ideal for raising cattle and other livestock. The climate here is cold, but the people are warm and friendly.  Cultural traditions are important and local people work hard to maintain them.

Miriam, 20, is single and lives with her parents.  Her father raises cattle and her mother has her own store.  The house where they live is owned by her parents.  

Miriam has a beauty salon, a business that she operates in a small space at the house.  She works Mondays to Saturdays, from 8:00 in the morning to 7:00 in the evening.  

She has been a member of her community bank for a year.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy beauty products that she will resell to her customers.  She wants to buy hair dyes, shampoo, nail polish and other similar products.

Her goal for the future is to own her own spa.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, con deseos de procesar, es conviviente con Orlando, vive en compañía de su pareja, sus dos hijos de 24 y 15 años, y su madre, a la que cuida por su avanzada edad, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Norma es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, en una bodega que abrió en su propia casa, con un capital inicial que le dio su pareja, ya hace dos meses comprando en pequeñas cantidades. Gracias a la acogida que tuvo logró vender todo lo que compró, animándola a volver a comprar más mercaderías, así fue dándole mayor rotación a  sus productos, contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la atención a los clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es la atención a los clientes, ya que así se socializa con la gente y puede intercambiar ideas, además del ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces con el ingreso del negocio de venta de madera que tiene su pareja no les alcanzaba. Tiene planes de ampliarlo y surtir mayor variedad de productos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y  agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para surtir su bodega, considera que así tendrá mayor preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma, 40, is a hardworking, dynamic woman who wants to make progress.  She lives comfortably in her own house with her spouse, Orlando, and her two children who are 24 and 15 years old and her mother who she cares for because of her advanced age.

Norma’s activity is selling basic staple groceries in a store she opened in her house with start-up capital her spouse gave her two months ago; she’s been buying in small amounts.

Thanks to the welcome she’s gotten she managed to sell out everything she bought and this encouraged her to buy more merchandise turning over her merchandise more.  Her son helps her tend to customers so she can socialize with them and exchange ideas.  Besides, the income helps her help her spouse with household expenses because what he earns in his lumber selling business often isn’t enough.  She plans to expand and stock it with a wider variety of products.

This will be her MFP loan #4.  She feels happy and grateful for the financial support she’s been receiving and wants to continue to count on it and this is why she commits to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.

She will use the requested amount to buy larger amounts and more variety of products to stock her store; she believes that this will lead to greater preference by her customers.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Urejesho Group

texts.en:
Protus is the facilitator of the Urejesho group. Protus and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Protus takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Protus had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Protus was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Protus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Protus will educate his child and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Urejesho group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Protus is pictured with his group members. The field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Abut

texts.en:
Abut is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. Two of them are in school. She has a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Abut requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Vicenta Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vicenta, ella tiene  63  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene ocho hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive  una hija la misma que ya es casada y vive junto a su familia, nuestra amiga está pasando por momentos muy tristes pues hace pocos días falleció su mamá quien también vivía en su casa. Su esposo es capitán de un barco pesquero.

Ella tiene un bus de transporte el cual es conducido por un chofer a quien le paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo. Además en su casa ella tiene un negocio de venta de bidones de agua, vende en su casa y también entrega a domicilio para lo cual también tiene una persona que es la encargada de realizar esta labor y a quien también le paga un sueldo mensual. Lleva cinco años con este negocio y más de 15 años con el bus de transporte.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar bidones de agua y ciertos repuestos para el bus. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 18 años ya que estaba en otro grupo y lleva 10 años  este banco. 

Su sueño es tener salud para ellos y los suyos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here most of the people are very hard workers working in maritime pursuits.

In this place we meet Vicenta. She is 63 years old, married and has 8 children. Her husband is the captain of a fishing boat. All of her children are older and independent. Her daughter is married and she and her family live with Vicenta. Our friend is passing some very sad moments because a few days ago her mother, who was also living in her home, died. 

She has a bus for transportation which is driven by a driver and she pays him a weekly salary for his work. Also in her house she has a business selling large containers of water; she sells at home and also offers home deliveries and she pays a person who is charge of this work a monthly salary. She has been in this business for 5 years and in the bus transport business for more than 15 years.

She is going to use the money from this loan to buy containers of water and some spare parts for the bus. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 18 years, at first a member of a different group, but has been with this communal bank for more than 10 years.

Her dream is for her and her family to stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the bus and large containers of water

loans.name: Eralboi

texts.ru: Эрали  48 лет, он женат  имеет 3 детей, двое из них в России.  Он разводит скот в течении 20 лет. Этому ремеслу он научился у  отца. В их кишлаке  работу найти трудно, многие  мужчины и женщины уехали на заработки в другие страны. Поэтому скотоводство и выращивание сельхозкультуры является их основным источником доходом. Ее сыновья присылают деньги, но когда сыновья приезжают к ним  домой, тогда  и выручает продажа  коров или коз на рынке. Для поддержания бизнеса ему необходимы деньги, что бы он мог купить коров, тем более в зимний период скот дешевле, чем летом.
texts.en: Erali is 48 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in Russia.  He has been breeding livestock for 20 years.  He learned this business from his father.  It is difficult to find work in their village, and many men and women left to work in other countries.  This is why animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops is their primary source of income.  Erali's sons send money home, but when the sons return home, then selling cattle and goats at a market helps them out.  Erali needs money to support his business, in order to purchase cattle, especially because livestock in cheaper in the winter than in the summer.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rossimer Amparo

texts.es:
Rossimer tiene 36 años de edad y le encanta vender es por ello que después de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta e productos para el hogar como ollas, sartenes, entre otros. Rossimer ofrece sus productos de casa en casa, ella transita por las calles de su ciudad, la cual es la calurosa y cálida ciudad de Pucallpa. Rossimer logro estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas y gracias a ello es muy organizada en su negocio, sobre todo Rossimer le pone mucho empeño ya que ella esta saliendo adelante debido a su esfuerzo y sobre todo su gran motivación, la cual son sus 2 hijos de 15 y 9 años a los que quiere muchísimo y por los cuales daría la vida.

Rossimer está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales como maderas, calaminas, clavos, entre otros para realizar arreglos en el techo de su vivienda ya que debido a las lluvias en ocasiones hay inundaciones en las viviendas y con el arreglo que va a realizar evitaría que esto pase; de esta  manera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Rossimer is 36 years old and she loves to sell, that is why after a lot of effort and saving she is able to start her own business selling household items like pots, pans, among others. Rossimer offers her products traveling from house to house through the streets of her city, which is the hot and enthusiastic city of Pucallpa. Rossimer was able to study Business Administration and thanks to it she is well organized in her business. Rossimer puts a lot of effort in her business, which is flourishing thanks to her work and her main source of motivation, her 2 sons of 15 and 9 years old, whom she loves dearly and would give her life for.  

Rossimer es very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the aid she has received she will be able to purchase materials like wood, corrugated iron, nails and more to repair the roof of her home. It is because of the rains that on occasion there is flooding in the housing and the repair will prevent this from happening. Thus she will be able to give a better quality of life and keep fighting to achieve her biggest dream: "To give a good education to her son and have a big restaurant".

loans.use: to purchase materials like corrugated iron, nails, wood, among others.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Cristina, es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales ambos están bajo su cargo y 2 de ellos estan en edad escolar, labora en el área de atención la cliente en una de las panaderías de la ciudad de León, se dedica a esta labor desde hace 4 años, inicia sus labores de 08:30 am y finalizándolas a las 07:00 pm de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario, el realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar y de sus pequeños hijos.

Doña Isabel, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo para la solventación de gastos escolares los cuales consisten en la compra de uniformes y útiles escolares de sus hijos los cuales son empleados en la educación escolar de sus pequeños, esto le permitirá en un futuro llegar a a ser unos profesionales de bien y el orgullo de doña Isabel.

loans.use: Compra de uniformes y útiles escolares

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has a workshop where he makes beds and bedroom furniture. He has been in this type of business for about ten years. He learned the ins and outs of the trade when he was an assistant for his uncle. While he was an assistant, he saved up enough money to buy second hand machinery. His business now consists of making the beds and frames for most furniture. He sends his product to a furniture retailer who adds the color and finishing touches to his product. He makes about 12 complete bedroom sets a month with the help of his 3 employees.

Edison needs the loan because he wants to invest in wood before the rainy season. During the next couple of months wood will become much more expensive and it will be an added expense to his business. He wants to prepare buy purchasing enough wood to keep in stock until the prices fall again.

Edison is 28 years old and he is single. He lives right next to his mother in a home made out of bamboo like wood. His goal is to improve his mother’s home and to continue improving his business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Edison needs the loan because he wants to invest in wood before the rainy season.

loans.name: Paul Suh

texts.en:
Paul is thirty-nine years old, husband to one woman and father of four children. After being unemployed for a while, he completed an apprenticeship as an electrician and did jobs for people, but the majority refused to pay. In desperation he decided to till the soil.

He has acquired farming techniques from training workshops organized by GHAPE and sister organizations. Coupled with his experience, he has a piece of land on which he grows crops to feed his community.

With a loan of $600, he plans to buy fertilizer, a truck (2-wheeler), a water pump, 2 spades, hoes, cutlasses, and seedlings. This will definitely allow him to increase his farm out-put. The products of his labor will keep his growing community from hunger. He plans to repay his loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Cultivating food crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beatrice would like to buy banana seedlings, planting seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run R. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She is a housewife and a mother of 3 children. To cover the family’s expenses, her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and typically earns around US$5 a day. Run R. and her husband would like to make more income by breeding pigs and growing various vegetables in the small plot of land that they own. They are therefore requesting a loan of US$600 and are thanking all the lenders for their trust and support.

The picture features two of Run R.'s children.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and seeds for farming

loans.name: Clotilde Mercedes

texts.es:
Clotilde is the mother of four. She has endeavored in many ways to provide for her family but found that she has a real gift for knitting so she has decided to dedicate more time to it and to perfect her craft. For a long time she only made sweaters and caps for special order but she has now expanded her product line and offers a full range of woolen garments to the public. Her products have been very well received and Clotilde has decided to open a small workshop where customers can come and see the work and place orders. Her dream is to buy another knitting machine and expand her shop, growing it in a short time into a small factory. She is asking for a loan of $350 and promises to repay the sum in 6 months. Clotilde and her family await your generous help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Clotilde, es madre de 4 hijos su deseo de realizar alguna actividad para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la llevó por muchos senderos; pero cuando reconoce la habilidad que tenía para la confección de prendas a base de lana decide explotarla y dedicarle mayor tiempo a esta actividad; para perfeccionar sus técnicas. Durante mucho tiempo sólo fabricaba chompas, chullos y gorras a solicitud de sus clientes ahora realiza prendas de todo tipo que ofrece al público en general. La acogida ha sido muy buena y agradable y a consecuencia de este hecho a decidido implementar su pequeño taller para que las personas al visitarla puedan observar las cosas que hace y elaboren sus listas de pedidos. .Ahora el anhelo de Clotilde es adquirir una máquina para tejer más y mejores prendas a fin de que la demanda de sus clientes se incremente y ella pueda ampliar el espacio del taller para convertirlo en poco tiempo en una fábrica. Para este propósito ella solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses.Clotilde y su familia aguardan tu generosa ayuda.

loans.use: To buy a new knitting machine.

loans.name: Romualda De

texts.es:
Romualda is a married woman. Her family is composed of her husband and daughter who is 22 years old. Romualda makes her living selling brand new clothes. She works during the weekends as a street vendor. Because of the 10 years of experience on this business, Romualda has steady clients in the area and in some other places where she takes her clothes, so this way she diminishes the high level competition. She is planning to start a lodge or restaurant at her place so she will take advantage of the construction of, “Estadio de Minero” a place that will bring all kind of clients.

Romualda has been working for long time with “Agrocapital” This is the 10th loan that she has requested. During all this time of relation with the Institution, she has demonstrated to be a responsible client and has paid it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Romualda es una señora casada, su familia está compuesta por su esposo e hija de 22 años de edad. Se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva, saliendo los fines de semana y ofreciendo como ambulante. Debido a los 10 años de experiencia con los que cuenta en este rubro, Romualda cuenta con clientela fija en el campo y en otros lugares donde lleva la ropa, haciendo frente de esta manera a la elevada comprtencia que existe en este negocio. Tiene planificado implementar una pensión o restaurante en su domicilio, a fin de aprovechar que cerca del mismo se está construyendo el Estadio de Minero, lugar que tendrá bastante afluencia de clientes de todo tipo. Romualda trabaja bastante tiempo en Agrocapital, esta solicitud es la secuencia número 10 de microcrédito que utiliza, en todo ese tiempo de relación con la Institución, ella demostró ser una cliente responsable y puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: START A LODGE

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. is a 35-year-old entrepreneur and mother of six school-aged children. She lives in Rongo, Kenya. She began her current business of selling second-hand clothes ten years ago. She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, casual clothes, and bed sheets. She periodically travels to Nairobi, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale price.

The prime location of her business on a busy street, her ten years of experience, and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good customer base. Ruth plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia Sanchez is a hard-working person who, for 15 years, has earned a living selling shoes at the Israel Lewites market in Managua. She's a widow with a son who still depends on her. Since the death of her husband, she's had to be both father and mother to her son, as well as the sole income earner for the household. Despite her difficult situation, she's been able to forge ahead and improve her business.

The shop where she started her business was, at first, in poor condition, but little by little she's invested in it, even buying racks where she displays the shoes she sells. It's important to note that, 3 years ago, Ligia benefited from Ceprodel loans that she immediately invested in the expansion of her business and that also allowed her small son to continue at school. Her greatest dream is that her son goes on to college.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Ligia S. es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos en el mercado Israel Lewites en Managua. Es viuda y madre de un hijo al que tiene que mantener. Desde la partida de su esposo, asumió la responsabilidad de realizar el papel de padre y madre a la vez por lo que es el único sustento de su hogar sin embargo, a pesar de su difícil situación ha podido salir adelante y ha mejorado su negocio.

Su negocio lo inició con un local en mal estado por lo que poco a poco ha venido invirtiendo en su negocio hasta comprar estantes donde colocar los calzados. Es necesario destacar que desde hace 3 años atrás, la señora S. ha sido beneficiada con créditos en Ceprodel los que los ha invertido directamente en la ampliación de su negocio y a la vez para poder darle los estudios a su pequeño hijo. Su mayor sueño es que su hijo llegue a coronar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Buy footware for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is an enterprising, married mother of two. She sells women's products, such as silver jewelry, undergarments, and cosmetics, among other beauty products. She has been involved in this field for over 6 years, and she now has a steady clientele who make special orders every week.

She tells us that thanks to this job, she can help her husband cover the household expenses, as well as her children’s educational expenses.

With this loan, she wishes to purchase silver jewelry such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, etc. as well as cosmetics and perfume. Her sales increased during the month of December, so she has been left practically without stock. She already has many orders for the month of February because people would like to offer her products as St. Valentine’s Day gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen, es una señora emprendedora, casada y madre de 2 niños. Carmen se dedica a la venta de artículos para damas como ser joyas de plata, ropas interior femenina, cosméticos, entre otros productos de belleza; esta actividad la lleva a cabo hace mas de 6 años y ya posee clientela fija que semanalmente le solicitan algún pedido especial.

Ella nos cuenta que gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su marido a cubrir los gastos de la familia y de la casa, como también los gastos de estudio de sus hijos.

Con el préstamos que solicita, ella desea comprar joyas como collares, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc. de plata además de cosménticos y perfumes ya que durante los meses de diciembre y enero tubo muy buenas ventas y se ha quedado prácticamente sin stock. Este mes de febrero ya tiene muchos pedidos para regalo por día de San Valentín.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry, perfume, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru:
Sadullo Nasirovich T. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 51 years old, married with six children. He has secondary education. He works as a driver at Builder, LLP. He has been working as a driver for 32 years. He plans to use the loan to repair his house. It will help improve the living conditions for his family because his small salary does not allow him to make the repairs. Sadullo plans to pay off the loan within 14 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тоиров Садулло Насирович проживает в городе Душанбе.Возраст 51 год, женат имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее . Работает в ПОО «Строитель» водителем. Работает водителем уже 32 года. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы сделать ремонт в своем доме. Это поможет ему улучшить условия жизни для своей семьи, так как без кредита его заработная плата не позволит сделать ремонт.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 14 месяцев.

loans.use: To repair house

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama F. is married and has, for three years, been a member of the village bank of Diaobé in Kolda. Her business involves buying sacks of onions and baskets of smoked fish and selling them in the Diaobé marketplace. She would like to build up her business that she is mastering, having practiced it for years. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariama F., marié est membre du banc villageois de Diaobé à Kolda depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des sacs d’oignons et des paniers de poissons fumés et revendre sur le marché de Diaobé. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité qu’elle maîtrise bien du fait de l’avoir pratiquée depuis des années. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in smoked fish and onions

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio M. is a gentleman from the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. He works in the agricultural business in order to support his wife and three children, whom he must provide for and offer an education to because he is the sole provider. He arduously dedicates himself to his business with the aim of improving his family’s financial status.

One problem that Mr. Eligio faces is that there is no electricity in his neighborhood because he lives in a zone that is far away from the urban area. For this reason, he has requested the installation of a solar panel. Upon having obtained the panel, his obligation is to pay off his debt. For this reason, he seeks the help of Ceprodel to get a loan, improving his living conditions by counting on this invaluable service: electricity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
