El caballero Eligio M. originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos los que tiene el deber de alimentarles y brindarles las posibilidades de estudio por ser el único ingreso del hogar. Se dedica muy esforzadamente a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar la situación económica de su hogar.

Una problemática que atraviesa el señor Eligio es que en su sector de habitación no poseen energía eléctrica por ser una zona muy alejada de la zona urbana, para ello ha solicitado la instalación de un panel solar para resolver esta situación. Al haber adquirido el panel su obligación es cancelar esta deuda y es por ello que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la cancelación de esta deuda y así iniciar con el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su hogar contando con este valiosísimo servicio como lo es la energía eléctrica.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace M. runs a shop where she sells pepper soup, drinks and various prepared foods. She studied this business with a friend for two years before opening her shop in 1997. Grace is 35 years old and married with three children. She has been a client at LAPO Microfinance for the past four years. Grace needs a loan  of $850 to buy more drinks and food items to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Claudia Simona

texts.es:
Claudia is a humble mother of seven children, who she worked extremely hard to raise. Now she only supports for the youngest two, one of whom helps her on her farm. The youngest is still in school. Claudia hopes to be able to provide her children with an education, and for this she sacrifices hours and hours working on her land. Claudia grows citrus fruits, plantains, and coffee. These products earn her the income to invest in her children's education. For Claudia this work isn't very tiring, but it is expensive, due to the cost of fertilizer and maintaining the land. More than anything, plants and seeds are expensive, but necessary to increase her production. Claudia is asking for a loan to buy these plants and seeds, in hopes that you can help her and she can ensure that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una humilde madre de 7 hijos a quienes cría con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Ahora sólo está al cuidado de los dos últimos, uno de ellos le ayuda en su trabajo dentro de la chacra y el último es aún escolar. Doña Claudia desea poder darle a sus dos hijos una carrera y por eso se sacrifica horas de horas en su trabajo en sus tierras, produciendo frutas cítricas, plátanos y café. Esto le sirve para obtener ingresos e invertirlos en la educación de sus hijos. Para ella este trabajo no es muy cansado, pero sí, muy costoso, por los abonos y por el mantenimiento que tiene que dar a sus terrenos, sobre todo en la compra de plantas y semillas para aumentar su producción. Para esto que se solicita este préstamo, en espera que usted pueda ayudarla y así conseguir que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and seeds for her crops, in order to earn enough to pay university tuition for her two youngest children.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with grown kids. She lives in Kahovka and runs her business located in the city market. Tatyana became an entrepreneur as a result of a desperate need to provide for her family's basic needs. Without money or savings she bravely started her small venture selling children's clothing. Tatyana has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $2400. Her monthly income is over $300. 

Tatyana is planning to use the loan of 4000 Grivnas to increase her seasonal stock. She is always ready to venture to realize her personal and financial goals. We believe the client has the determination to make her business expand following the route of success in providing a supplemental income to her household.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose U. is 50 years old and married to Mr. U. and they have five children.  She and her family live in Egbeda, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and rice, both wholesale and retail; she has been in this business for the past ten years. Rose needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more drinks and bags of rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy more rice and drinks for sale

loans.name: Nail

texts.en: Nail is 41 years old, is married, and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region Kayidish village. He started a general goods business five years ago. Nail would like a loan of $1200 to buy more goods to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon S., 46, is widowed and earns around $2.5 as a nurse in the Kbal Spean Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. Yon lives with her two children, one of whom stays home and studying, another one is a motorcycle taxi driver. Her income is not regular depending on customers’ need, S. her son decided to work driving motorcycle taxi to help support family’s expenses. Because of her son's old motorcycle, and income is declined, Yon asks for a loan of $400 for her son business to purchase a new motorcycle to change the old.

loans.use: for her son business to purchase a new motorcycle to change the old

loans.name: Seung

texts.en:
Mrs. Seung S. is 34 years old, married and lives with her two children in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She operates a grocery store, earning an income of about US$3 each day. Her husband is a taxi-driver and earns US$10 each day. 
Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. 
Seung S. is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase additional grocery items for resale. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery items for resale

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Hiến năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003.  Trước đây gia đình chị chuyên kinh doanh ga nhưng từ năm 2006 đến nay gia đình  chị đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh buôn bán và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình chị Hiến trong thời gian qua. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng  gia đình chị Hiến đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị Hiến mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi H. is 29 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2003. Her family had been selling chickens until 2006 when she decided to invest in running a grocery store instead. Currently, both her husband and she are involved in this business, which provides the main source of income. With her income at the rate of 4,000,000 VND per month, Mrs. Hoang has more opportunity and means to improve her living standard. She would like to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in her store to meet the needs of the local consumers for the incoming New Year celebration.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Josephin Epifania

texts.es: La señora Josephin es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian educación primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que le ayuda asumir los gastos del hogar, está solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio de pulperia para aumentar su inventario y asi brindar mejor atención a sus cliente y obtener mayores ganancia con las cuales mejorará las condiciones del hogar.   Josephin es una mujerer emprendedora, responsable, honesta que ha demostrado buena conducta y moral crediticia, es una señora que ha constribuido al desarrollo de su comunidad, adicionalmente labora en el cafetin de la univercidad URACCAN donde obtiene otros ingresos que le permiten asumir sus compromisos crediticios.
texts.en:
Josephin is the mother of 3 young children, all in elementary school. She has the support of her husband who helps with household expenses. She's applying for a third AFODENIC loan, money that she will invest in her small grocery business. She will use the funds to increase her inventory so that she can better service her customers and increase her earnings, something that will allow her to make improvements to her house. Josephin is an enterprising woman, responsible and honest. She has shown herself to be of good character, someone who has contributed to the development of her community. Among other things, she works in the URACAAN university canteen where her income helps her to repay her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Yoin

texts.en:
Miss Yoin K. (pictured with her mother), 37, is single and lives with her parents in a small village along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has five brothers and two sisters. Three of her brothers are married and live outside the family home; two sisters are garment factory workers and another one is a farmer.

Yoin has been a garment factory worker for six years; the main income in the family comes from her and her brothers' and sisters' salaries and from the farming business. Her mother also raises pigs at home. Yoin is requesting her second loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a boat motor, to buy piglets for raising, and to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor, to buy piglets for raising, and to use for growing rice

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Бохтурова Тахмина проживает в городе Вахдат. Возрвчт 24 года , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Для того, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью она работает частной портнихой. Шьет базарные сумки для продажи. Продает на центральном рынке. Бизнес приносит доход ,но условия в которых она работает не очень ее устраивают. Поэтому она решила получить кредит для того, чтобы купить более современную швейную машинку. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tahmina B. lives in Vakhdat. She is 24 years old and is married with two children. In order to provide for her family, Tahmina works as a private tailor. She makes shopping bags which she sells at the central market. The business is profitable but the working conditions are not so good. Therefore Tahmina is applying for a loan. She would like to use it for a new sewing machine. Tahmina plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a universal sewing machine

loans.name: Moraima

texts.es: La señora Moraima tiene 46 años D. edad, es madre soltera y vive con su única hija quien la apoya mucho. A causa D. su separación conyugal, y para sostener las necesidades D. su hija, emprendió el negocio D. la venta D. comida, y hasta el momento todo le ha ido muy bien. Una D. las causas D. su éxito es que no tiene que alquilar ningún local, porque ha convertido su casa en una pensión, donD. brinda el menú diario a un grupo D. trabajadores D. una línea aérea, ya que su casa se encuentra muy cerca al aeropuerto. Y para incrementar sus ingresos, por las noches venD. salchipollos (platillo a base D. pollo con papas fritas). Con este negocio lleva un periodo D. 10 años y le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se siente útil y sobre todo se relaciona constantemente con muchas personas. En el futuro desea tener un restaurante muy bien implementado donD. pueda acoger a muchos comensales. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, hace dos años que conoció D. esta institución y D. la metodología D. los bancos comunales, y en su experiencia le gusta el trabajo con su grupo porque son activos y demuestran compañerismo unos con otros. Invertirá el dinero que está solicitando en la compra D. utensilios D. cocina como; ollas, platos, tazas, etc., haciendo un gasto D. 800 soles, el resto lo invertirá en mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Moraima is 46 years old, a single mother, and lives with her only daughter who supports her a lot. Due to her marital separation and in order to support the needs of her daughter, she launched a business selling food, and it has been going well so far. One of the reasons for her success is that she does not need to rent a location because she has converted her house into a pension, where she offers a daily menu to a group of airline workers since her house is close to the airport. To add to her income, she sells salchipollos (a dish with chicken and fries) at night. She has had this business for 10 years and has enjoyed it a lot because she feels useful and above all, she constantly interacts with many people. In the future, she hopes to have a very nice restaurant where she can welcome many dinner guests. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP and it has been two years since she found out about the institution and of the communal bank methodology. In her experience she likes to work with the group because they are active and demonstrate friendship with one another. She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of kitchen utensils such as pots, plates, cups, etc. that cost 800 soles. The rest she will invest in tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of kitchen utensils, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Afde No 19 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 19 ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Grand Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de poissons et la restauration.  Elles ont appris à cuisinier depuis elles étaient jeunes, donc elles sont bien expérimentées et très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance l’IMCEC.  Elles ont déjà reçu un prêt de groupement auprès de l’IMCEC, et elles l’ont bien remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour reconstituer leur stock de poissons et de renforcer son activité de restauration, au comptant au marché Grand Thiès.  Les poissons font partie essentiel de la cuisine sénégalaise, donc il y a toujours beaucoup de demande.  Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000CFA ($60) au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
“Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 19” is composed of five women who average 50 years of age and who live in large traditional extended families in the Grand Thiès district in the city of Thiès, located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. These women know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they do almost the same work, fish selling and food catering. They learned how to cook when they were young, so they are very experienced and in high demand in this business.

With regard to improving the quality of their services and expanding their businesses, the members of this reliance group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. They received a group loan before from IMCEC that they indeed repaid.

The group members plan to use this loan to replenish their stock of fish and to bolster their restaurant business, accepting cash at the Grand Thiès marketplace. Fish is an essential part of Senegalese cuisine, so there is always a lot of demand.

The group members hope to realize an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for family needs, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and to strengthen their catering business

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.
Flor es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Flor junto a su esposo viajan a las ferias D. la región en donD. compra ganado y luego los comercializa en la feria D. San Juan, también benéfica los animales y venD. la carne en un puesto del mercado D. Carmen Alto.
Flor necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. oveja.
Los sueños D. Flor son tener una bodega en su casa, comprar una cortadora D. carne y educar a su ultimo hijo.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the communal bank “Renacer.” She is married, 42 years old, and has 4 children. Flor and her husband travel to the region’s fairs to buy cattle and then sell them at San Juan’s fair. They also take care of the animals and sell the meat from a post in the Carmen Alto market. Flor needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will invest in buying sheep. Flor would like to have a store in her house, buy a meat cutter, and give her last son an education.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de oveja.

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
For five years, Matrida has owned a small shop in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. Every day she works at her business for 13 hours. She belongs to the Ngeleli group loan.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Matrida is 30 years old and she has a five-month-old baby and a seven-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more saleable items to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Prodencia

texts.en:
Prodensia S. is married and has six children. Her hometown is Belo, Cameroon where she sells koki beans and palm oil in the Mejang Market. Prodensia purchases these items in bulk and sells them at retail prices. With this loan she plans to purchase koki beans, three tins of palm oil, a bag of groundnuts (peanuts) along with her transport costs.

Prodensia knows her resale business will do well. She knows that "people need koki bean to prepare they things with." Koki beans are commonly used to prepare local dishes in Cameroon. A particular favorite, which is often sold on the street, is a deep-fried, Madeline-shaped finger food. It can be served with Pepe (hot pepper) sauce. The tins of palm oil she plans to purchase are more like large barrels and the palm oil is a deep red-orange color.

Prodencia has faced sickness and death in her family and notes that she "hates stealing." With the profits from this loan Prodensia plans to buy seeds, yams and koki beans for her farm. Most families have a farm in Cameroon. A lot of times, too, the farm is a small or long walk from your compound.

This is Prodensia's second loan from GHAPE since she became a member in early 2008. She takes out GHAPE loans because the loan conditions are preferable.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy koki beans, palm oil, groundnuts (peanuts), and her transport.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia belongs to a poor family. Her parents were farmers and, because of their poor living situation, she was not able to finish her studies. However, despite this, Sonia feels the blessings that God is giving her family. She is married to Bonifacio Jr., but her husband is unable to work because he is already disabled. Because of this, Sonia became the sole provider of their family.

Sonia manages a motorcycle transport business. She lets her relative drive her motorcycle and remit a daily transport fee of PHP 200 to her. Income gained from the motorcycle already has been a big help, said Sonia. She wants the motorcycle to operate daily. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 for the maintenance of their transportation vehicle.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of their motorcycle

loans.name: Narzikul

texts.ru: Умаров Нарзикул проживает в районе Шахринава. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Нарзикул более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота, а также прибыли.
texts.en:
Narzikul U. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 54 years old, married and has 5 children. Narzikul has been involved in sales for over 8 years. He primarily sells food products. He is requesting a loan to increase product turnover and profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is a rice farmer. She is 46 years old and has three children. She would like to grow her business even more but, because she doesn't have enough resources, she intends applying for a loan of Php 6,000. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers for her farm and, for her pigs, two sacks of Lactatex feed and two sacks of Gestatex feed.

Myrna is still joining the CEVI cluster meetings. She enjoys having the CEVI services like credit, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
La señora Mariana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 66 años y 05 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se esta iniciando en esta actividad, poco a poco va aumentado sus productos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de gallinas, pero lo dejo por motivos de salud. Ahora esta establecida en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en kilos, paquetes de galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Mariana, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariana belongs to the Communal Bank “Doradinas en Acción”, which is located in the District of San José de Sisa, Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 66 years old, single, and has 5 adult children.

One of the dreams she desired to fulfill was to establish her own grocery business. She started out gradually, increasing her inventory of products little by little. Prior to this business, she sold chickens but was unable to continue because of health reasons. The grocery is established in Sra. Mariana’s home, which is where she attends to her customers.

She will use her loan of 500 soles to buy kilos of rice and sugar, packets of cookies, packages of noodles and salt, milk, boxes of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products. This new supply of merchandise will enable her to provide better service to her customers.

Mariana is eager to continue working and grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to create opportunities to thrive in their own environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her inventory

loans.name: Albetah Akinyi

texts.en:
Albetah Akinyi is a thirty year old single lady mother of a boy of 10. She has been operating a photocopying business for the last two years. She began the business with some capital she got from her mother, who later introduced her to KADET Ltd since her monther is actually an existing client. 

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She hopes to use the money to purchase more stationery to prepare for the re-opening of school which is a peak season for this type of business.
She aspires to start big bookshop business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase printing paper.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
“Work hard and endure hardships to attain success,” said Angelina A. of Barangay Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now a widow and a mother of three children. All of them were only high school graduates since she could not afford to send them to college. At the moment, her children are working hard in order to support their own families.

Angelina manages a food-vending business. With her dream to improve her business, she is now asking for a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos. This amount is really of great help to make her business grow. She is also planning to save some of her income for her future needs and also to assist her children. She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, her dreams will come into reality.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina U. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Satui Fasitoo 2.  She is married and has eight school-aged children.  To make a living, Sina operates a family member's business selling baked goods in the local community.  Sina has been engaged in this business for over four and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Sina is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST, which also will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by Sina from SPBD.  Sina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Irene Gricelinda

texts.es:
La señora IRENE GRICELINDA tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS 5 ESTRELLAS . Ella   presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y está casada, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta  de  productos naturales que los vende por catalogó y también es coordinadora de grupo obteniendo ganancias también por las personas que ella afilia. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró productos naturales para iniciar su negocio
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará productos naturales que se encuentren en oferta para abastecer su stock y también comprará otros productos que le han pedido.
La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas, seguir afiliando a mas mujeres para que formen parte de sus circulo de ventas y obtener ganancias por las ventas de sus afiliadas.
texts.en:
Irene Gricelinda is 40 years old and lives in the district of Trujillo in the province of Trujillo which is in the region of La Libertad, Peru. Irene is a member of "LAS 5 ESTRELLAS" communal bank. She has studied through the fifth grade of secondary school and is married. She has five children, though only one depends on her financially. Irene buys and sells natural products which she sells from a catalog. She also is the coordinator of a group that makes its profits from her affiliates. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought natural products to start her business. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles she will buy natural products to supply her stock and she will also buy other products that her customers have ordered. Irene dreams of growing her business and continuing to partner with more women who can form part of her sale circle and make more profits from the sales to their affiliates.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural products for her stock and other orders

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es:
Ana  vive en la Calle Gregorio Reynolds zona Villa Calama de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa de sus padres es soltera, egreso de la carrera de Comunicación Social.

Ana trabaja vendiendo productos energéticos, además distribuye ropas por docena a las tiendas y almacenes.


El crédito lo destinara para aumento de capital. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ana lives on Gregorio Reynolds Street in the Villa Calama district in the city of El Alto. She is single and lives with her parents. Ana earned a degree in communications.

She sells energy products and also distributes clothing to a dozen shops and department stores. Her loan will be used to increase her operating capital. This is Ana’s second loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated that she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the operating capital for her businesses

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
At the beginning of 2000, Khem T. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few grocery items to neighbors who live near her house in the village. In addition, she distills white wine for sale. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children. All three children attend high school and university. She is married to Kong Channarith, 43, an electrician. Khem T. and her husband are in the photo.

Recently, Khem T. sold all the items from her stock and she wants to replace her inventory to continue selling. Due to lack of funds, Khem T. has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, to be used to buy a large number of grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy a large number of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ryangusha Nalongo Teddy Group

texts.en: N. Teddy is the president of this group, a hard-working business woman of forty-five years old. She is a widow with five children of whom two are going to school. She has been rearing livestock so far for twenty years. She is using the loan to purchase more animals to add to her livestock. She wants to enlarge and boost her business. She is also looking forward to fencing her farm for security purposes.

loans.use: To purchase more animals to add to her livestock

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro came to the U.S. from Colombia in 2003 with his wife. In the beginning, he was working very long hours, and the pay wasn't enough to justify keeping him away from his family for so long - in fact, he says, it wasn't even enough to support his family. That's when he had the idea to import handmade crafts from his home country and sell them in Miami. Pedro says that the accessories he imports were not well-known in Miami before he started importing them, but he has been successful in selling them. His wife chooses the inventory and gets the best deal possible, and he sells it to responsible distributors in Miami and other metro areas such as NY, LA, Houston, and Atlanta.

Pedro will use this loan to increase his inventory, and he says that clients have requested more products that he does not have at the moment. He says the loan will also help him increase his inventory in preparation for increased demand during the holiday season. In the future, he hopes to start importing items from other countries, such as Peru and Mexico, directly from the local craftsmen and women who make them.

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions like ACCION USA support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Buying and diversifying inventory

loans.name: Jenerous

texts.en:
K. Jenerous is a resident of Kacence Cell, Kakiika, Mbarara district. She is married and is blessed with three children.

Jenerous has owned her plantation for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase and add fertilizer to her banana plantation. She is a promising lady whose dream is to establish another reliable business for more daily income.

loans.use: To purchase and add fertilizer to her banana plantation

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana D. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Ana is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Ana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ana has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Ana is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Santos Andrés

texts.es: Santos Andrés M. L. de 26 años de edad, reside en San Isidro, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Desde hace tres años que él vive solo en su casa propia, la cual fue heredada por su padre y que esta ubicada en la zona rural de San Isidro. Santos posee una granja en la cual se encarga de criar ganado y luego comercializarlo. Gracias a sus excelentes estándares de calidad, Santos cuenta con muchos clientes, esto ha pesar de que cuenta con poco tiempo de dedicarse a este trabajo como propietario de su negocio, aunque posee mucha experiencia debido a que se ha dedicado toda su vida a este oficio junto a su padre. Santos solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de alimentos para su ganado, y así mismo comprar más ganado. A pesar que vive solo, el desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que espera poder mejorar su negocio y de esta manera sus ganancias. Santos es un joven muy visionario y emprendedor, quien desea tener una mejor vida tanto para el presente como para su futuro.
texts.en:
Santos Andrés M. L., 26 years old, lives in San Isidro, located in the the department of Morazán. For three years he has lived in his own home, which was inherited from his father and is located in the rural area of San Isidro. Santos owns a farm where he raises and sells livestock. Thanks to his excellent quality standards, Santos has many customers in spite of having little time to dedicate to this. He has a lot of experience due spending his entire life in this business together with his father. Santos is requesting loan in order to purchase a larger quantity of feed for his livestock and thus purchase more livestock. In spite of living alone he wants to improve his standard of living and that's why he hopes to be able to improve his business and income. Santos is a very visionary and entrepreneurial young man that wants to have a better life in the present as well as in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Mariamou

texts.fr: K. Mariamou est née le 28 Août 1962 à Natitingou au Nord du Bénin. Mariée à BABOCCO Gousséyo, Mariamou est mère de sept enfants. Mariamou a un autre enfant à charge. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, depuis 15 ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Mariamou a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis un vingtaine d’année, Mariamou vend des bassines et des bols en séries au marché de Allada. De façon seondaire, Mariamou vend des chaussures et des sacs. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Mariamou s’approvisionne. Mariamou a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle, Mariamou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Mariamou ambitionne plus tard acquérir une parcelle et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mariamou K. was born on 28th August 1962 in Natitingou in the north of Bénin. Married to Gousséyo BABOCCO, Mariamou is mother to seven children. She also has another child in her care. Only some of the children are at school. The family has lived in Allada in the "département" (admnistrative division) of Atlantique for around 15 years. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. Mariamou left school at secondary level. For around 20 years she has sold basins and sets of bowls on the market in Allada. As a secondary activity, she sells shoes and bags. Mariamou gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She has already had two loans from ALIDé both of which she repaid without incident. In order to meet increasing customer demand, Mariamou is applying for a third loan from ALIDé. This will allow her to strengthen her business and satisfy customer demand more readily. Mariamou's longer term ambition is to acquire a piece of land and build a house.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one carton of bowl sets and two dozen basins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up his café

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun S., age 37, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector, farming, fishing, and raising animals at home, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who always helps his wife in the current businesses, earning the same amount of income. 

Their standard of living has improved since S. and her husband have had these businesses. S. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to buy pigs to raise. With the remainder, she wants to repair the roof of her house before the rainy season arrives. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy pigs and repair the roof of the house

loans.name: Asylkan's Group

texts.en:
A person without goals is like a ship without a sail. Many people these days are refrained by daily routine and daily needs and do not have high objectives toward which they would aspire. This is not the case with the heroes of our story. They represent the middle–income or even lower middle–income class and do not seem to be distinguished from other people except that they all have high objectives and the determination to achieve them.

Asylkan Y. is the group leader. She is a widow and lives with her son (16 years), grandson and daughter-in-law. Asylkan works as an accountant and also raises cattle. Two and half years ago, she bought a cow and since then she has been trying to increase the population of her livestock.

Now her accountant's salary is a little over 80 USD a month. She would like to have income from selling milk and trading in cattle during weekends at a cattle market. She has decided to apply for a loan to buy two lambs, pay a shepherd for grazing, and buy forage for them. In the future she hopes to buy a car for her son and furniture for her home.

Gulzaira T., 49, is a widow. Her son works in a resort and earns a salary of 185 USD. Gulzaira does odd jobs in some factory. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy a big carpet and some clothes.

Anarkul A., 41, is single. She keeps some cattle at her parent’s and works as a laborer in “PAT” factory. With her loan she hopes to help her sister prepare the dowry of her daughter.

Apal C., 48, is a widow. Her son works as a baker and has a salary of 95 USD. Apal is a laborer in a “PAT” company and earns a salary of around 85 USD. She will use her loan to buy a cow for feeding and resale.

======================================

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment).

It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two lambs, pay a shepherd for grazing and buy forage.

loans.name: Mrs. Lay Seang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of nine people, all of whom all live in Peam Sala village in Kandal province. They will use their loans for different business purposes. The members have elected Mrs. Lay S. to be their village bank president. 

Mrs. Lay S. is a fish vendor who sells the fish that her husband, Mr. Soth Yeun, catches in the lake and the river near their house. She presently faces a problem due to the fact that their fishing supplies are too old to use, but they do not have enough money to buy new ones. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies, and she plans to use the rest of the loan to install sewers for use in her home. 

She is the mother of seven children. One is a laborer, five are attending the local public school, and the youngest is three years old.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en:
Yasmine is a 24-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. She is married and has three young children. Yasmine has been working in bee keeping and honey production for the past nine years. This is a family business that she learned from a young age.
Yasmine has been a microcredit client for two years, and has repaid her loans on time. Today, she is requesting a loan to purchase bee hives and bees. She decided on starting her business because of her experience, as well as the fact that beekeeping has been in her family for so long and she didn’t want to break the tradition. In the future, Yasmine plans to keep on increasing her networking and number of customers because her business supplements her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase bee hives and bees

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es el transporte público, hace mas de 2 años adquirió dos vehículos,   y desde entonces recorren las rutas locales, en tanto su esposo es uno de los conductores, quien trabaja arduamente brindando este servicio.  Zenaida considera que esta actividad le es más rentable que la agricultura, ya que era el anterior trabajo que ejercía; aunque no tenga descanso ahora, pero la recompensa al esfuerzo se ve en las ganancias, es por esta razón que desea dar mantenimiento a sus movilidades. Su mayor anhelo es comprar otro vehículo y para ello está ahorrando. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y asegura ser cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas y por tal agradece  a aquellas personas que son gestoras del préstamo, ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de su movilidad.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 46 and lives with her husband and children in their own home. She works in public transportation. Two years ago she acquired two vehicles, and since then she travels local routes (her husband is one of the drivers), and they work hard to offer this service. Zenaida believes that this activity is more profitable than farming, which was her previous occupation. She never takes a break, but the reward of her work is evident in her earnings, and for this reason she wants to properly maintain her vehicles. Her greatest wish is to buy another vehicle, and she is saving up for it. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she will be punctual with repayments. She is grateful to those who support her loan, and knows it will be very useful in the growth of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of replacement parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with seven children, all of them in school, and also looks after her granddaughter. She sells charcoal in Kyebando Nsooba Kawempe division from her home. She has been in this business for six years. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Her business is wholesale only. Sarah buys charcoal from Masindi and sells to local people and her neighbors. She works seven days a week and also owns a poultry farm. Sarah’s main business challenges are transportation and the rainy season which makes village roads impassable. Her future aspiration is to develop her self in all aspects of life like educating her children up to university level and owning a delivery van. Sarah's greatest monthly expense is food and medication. She lives in, and owns, a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ynocencio

texts.es:
Ynocencio tiene 51 años es casado y tiene tres hijos, él vive en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc donde los mayoría de los pobladores son agricultores y ganaderos. Ynocencio tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en llevar, distribuir y vender verduras a las vendedoras del  mercado San Pedro de la Ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ynocencio requiere el préstamo para construir su casa. 

(En la fotografía el Sr. Ynocencio está acompañado de su hijo Daniel que tiene 7 años de edad).
texts.en:
Ynocencio is 51-years-old, married, and has three beautiful children. He lives in the community of Rayanniyoc where the majority of the residents are farmers and ranchers. Ynocencio has a small family business that carries, distributes, and sells vegetables to the vendors in the San Pedro de la Ciudad de Cusco market (Saint Peter of the City of Cusco). Now he has worked in this business for 15 years and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Ynocencio needs this loan to build his house. (In the photo, Ynocencio is accompanied by his son Daniel who is seven-years-old.)

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ynocencio needs the loan to build his house.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JIGUISEME II  est composé  de  10 femmes mariées du village de Kampogosso Kafonon, de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, au moins 5 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
Ester D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Jiguiseme II is composed of ten married women from the village of Kampogosso Kafonon, in San prefecture, Segou region (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They live in traditional families and average 34 years of age and at least five children.  The group members grow peanuts.  Concerned with making their crops profitable, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago.  After having properly repaid the two previous loans, they are now on their third farm loan. Ester D. plans on using her loan for buying a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, sundry equipment, and some supplies at the big market of Kimparana and at surrounding markets.  After the winter, the harvests are stored for a while, so that they acquire some value.  They are then sold retail (often in bulk) for cash to a customer base generally from the big cities.  After selling their produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 25,000 to 55,000 francs CFA. The profits will be used for repaying the loan interest and for covering common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies, seeds, and equipment

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de san Martín de la ciudad de la Paz, no tiene hijos, es propietaria de un micro que le rinde ingresos diarios para su subsistencia, fue cliente de Kiva en dos oportunidades, y de  Impro con 4 créditos, los cuales pago puntualmente. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de llantas para su micro de transporte de pasajeros.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Gisela is single and lives in her parents' house in the San Martín zone of the city of La Paz. She has no children and is the proprietor of a micro-enterprise that renders income daily for her subsistence. Gisela has been a client of Kiva on 2 previous occasions, and of Impro for 4 loans, all of which were repaid punctually. This loan will be utilized to buy tires for her micro-van that transports passengers. Given her social character, she is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TIRES FOR HER MICRO-VAN THAT TRANSPORTS PASSENGERS

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dinora Elizabeth H. D. M. D. 43 años D. edad resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, junto a su compañero D. vida, el cual a pesar que es pensionado, trabaja como motorista D. su propio vehiculo, en el cual se encarga D. hacer viajes a diferentes personas, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 11 y 8 años D. edad. Debido a que el sueldo D. su esposo es muy poco, ella decidió hace ocho años iniciar su propio negocio, el cual le permitiera contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Es por lo cual que Dinora invirtió sus ahorros en una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual nació con la iniciativa D. tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Dinora solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando productos como embutidos, detergentes, pan y otros productos más, esto lo espera lograr  por medio D. dicho préstamo, ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años D. poseer la tienda no ha contado con el dinero necesario para invertir más en ella debido a que la mayoría D. las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Dinora Elizabeth H. D. M., 43, lives in the town of Soyapango with her life partner, who despite being retired uses his own vehicle to work as a driver, giving rides to different people. She also lives with their two children, ages 11 and 8. Since her husband's salary is very low, Dinora decided eight years ago to open her own business, which allows her to contribute to all the household expenses along with her husband. This is why she invested her savings in a perishable goods store, which was born from her initiative to have more economic stability. Dinora is asking for a loan so she can invest more in her store, buying products like sausages, detergents, bread and other products. She hopes to do this with the loan, since although she has had the shop for several years she has not had the money to invest in it because most of her earnings go toward household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products to stock store

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita S. is from the village of Barangay 1, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Expedita is separated from her spouse and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Expedita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Expedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Expedita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Expedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
Narcisa de 50 años,  tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales.

Por la falta de oportunidades ella invirtió sus ahorros en víveres para vender ya que tenia que mantener a sus hijos porque es madre soltera, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, vende arroz por libra, azúcar, aceites, verduras etc.  

Para seguir con su negocio y poderlo surtirlo mas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 50, has a small grocery store in the front part of her house. She lives in El Fortín, Guayaquil, an area noted for its unpaved streets and informal merchants. Due to the lack of employment opportunities she used her savings to buy foodstuffs to sell because she had to support her children since she’s a single mother. Since then and to this date she works every day from 8am until 9pm. She sells rice by the pound, sugar, cooking oils, vegetables, etc. To continue with her business and stock it better she needs to use the loan to buy rice, cooking oils and sugar. In the future she’d like to finish building her house and stock her store better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, cooking oils and sugar.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier tiene 36 años, su actividad económica es el destace de cerdos. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que es un hombre muy emprendedor por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de salir adelante. El inicio este negocio como una alternativa de trabajo por la escasez existente de empleos para mejorar sus ingresos y así mantener a su familia, su hijo de 10 años  estudia en una escuela pública pero el hace muchos sacrificios para mantenerlo. Es por eso el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos pues tiene cierta demanda de parte de sus clientes. Sueña con establecer un negocio de comida en su vivienda, pero quiere salir adelante con su negocio actual.
texts.en: Francisco Javier is 36 years old. His economic activity is butchering pigs. He has had this business for more than 12 years. That is why this man is very enterprising and has always looked for a way to get ahead. He started this business as a work alternative due to a scarcity of existing jobs. With it, he improves his income and thus supports his family. His 10 year old son goes to a public school but he sacrifices a lot to support him. That is why the reason for the loan is to buy pigs because he has a certain level of demand from his customers. He dreams os starting a restaurant in his home, but he wants to get ahead with his present business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Geraldina

texts.en:
Geraldina B. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Geraldina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Geraldina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and cassava cakes in the local community. Geraldina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Geraldina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Geraldina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Geraldina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: La Sra. Lucía M. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa nueva y artículos para el hogar donde tiene 23 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado seis créditos para dicho negocio. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de pantalones, ropa interior, blusas, zapatos y artículos del hogar con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Lucía M. is from the city of El Sauce, Nicaragua. Her business is the sale of new clothing and items for the home. She has 23 years of experience in this business. She has been working with Ceprodel for four years. They have granted her six loans for her business. She has asked for this loan to buy pants, underwear, shirts, shoes and items for the home. It is her objective to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase pants, underwear, capris, shirts, shoes, and items for the home.

loans.name: Adjélé Mawuégna

texts.fr: Adjélé a 32 ans et est mariée à un médecin.  Elle a un enfant. Elle est née à Lomé et habite vakpossito. Elle a remboursé beaucoup de crédits.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait le commerce de charbons de bois et compte dans cette activité 3 ans déjà. Elle achète à Kpalimé et revend à Lomé près de L’EPP makafui à vesomé. Le prêt demandé lui permettra d’acheter 28 sacs de charbons pour satisfaire  plus de clients.
texts.en: Adjélé is 32 years old and married to a doctor. She has one child. She is born in Lomé and lives in Vakpossito. She has repaid many prior loans. In order to help with household expenses, she sells charcoal and has three years of experience in this business. She stocks up in Kpalimé and resells in Lomé, near to the EPP Makafui building in Vesomé. The requested loan will allow her to buy 28 bags of charcoal to be able to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Irene Wanjiku

texts.en:
Irene Wanjiku K. is 39 years old and single. Her residential place is in Lodwar-Kenya. She sells cereals and has been in this business for the past eight years with a monthly profit of Kshs. 23,000.

Irene learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer. She is applying for her second loan of Ksh. 50,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy two bags of rice, three bags of green grams, and one bag of beans. With the anticipated profits, she plans to purchase her own piece of land.

In the future, Irene wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, green grams, and beans.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn G. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Arlyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Arlyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria S. E., tiene 37 años de edad. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Ana Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y hacer una casa.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en: Ana Maria S. E. is 37 and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 6 children. The  V.R.C. SAN JACINTO is located in the Campo Alegre area, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn and rice. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Ana Maria works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She purchases his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house. She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Juster

texts.en:
Juster, 76, is a widowed mother of 11 grown children. She is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 40 years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries and coffee through a local society.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter to chop hay. She says that this will help save time and reduce the wastage of fodder thus saving money. She hopes to increase her milk production from the current 20 to 50 litres in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila B. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 33 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. Mila has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Mila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos.  María no pudo estudiar.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con éste dinero compró ovejas para seguir operando con su negocio, tiene como actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado ovino, además se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y la agricultura, debido a que su esposo viene radicando buen tiempo en la ciudad de Arica – Chile.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará un torito de raza Bronzuis.
Su sueño es comprarse un auto. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad de los préstamo y compartir la alegría con las demás socias.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” communal bank located in Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 55 years old, married and has 7 children.  She was unable to go to school.

She has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy sheep to continue in business; her business is sheep raising.  She also raises cattle and farms because her husband has been living in Arica, Chile for some time now.

She will use this 3000 new sol loan to buy a Brown Swiss bullock.  

Her dream is to buy a car.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of loans and to share joy with the other members.

loans.use: She will buy a Brown Swiss bullock.

loans.name: Jerry's Group

texts.en:
Jerry T. is from the village of San Bonifacio. He is 36 years old. Jerry is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jerry T..

Jerry is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry raises livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Jerry has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jerry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Jerry is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Jerry from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar S. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 69 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Oscar runs a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Oscar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This loan will be Oscar's second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn grits

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married and has two children. His primary business is selling clothes.  He has been in this business for 4 years, earning an income of Kshs 10,000. His business is located along the market and thus he has customers every day.

Patrick was introduced to KADET by existing clients.  He is servicing his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more second-hand clothes to stock  his business. 

Patrick plans to re-invest the anticipated profits that he earns.  He hopes to be financially stable. Patrick describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry produce for resale

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 62-year-old widow with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a ready-to-wear clothing/shoes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Rosalina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy products and stocks of clothing to sell.

 In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is a fish monger at Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is divorced and has five dependents. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Alberto; el tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es propietario de un carro que hace servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a su familia, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi e imn0lementar su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor para su casa.                                   
                      
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Jorge Alberto is 25 years old and lives with his partner.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  He owns a car which he uses to provide a taxi service.  Jorge Alberto works from 6.00am to 10.00pm and, through this work, he gets his family ahead in life.  Jorge Alberto would like to improve his taxi service and equip his home.  He is requesting this loan to buy a television set for his home.

Jorge Alberto is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television set for his home

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 4 years. She is married and has 3 school-aged children.

Catherine is requesting a loan of Php 20,000 to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and other basic commodities to sell. Each month, she earns about Php 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Catherine hopes that her business will improve to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: buy canned goods, soft drinks and other commodities to sell

loans.name: Diorenda
