texts.en: Diorenda is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. Diorenda has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Diorenda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 33 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo diarios, Maria tiene 3 hijos de 12,6 y2 años ella se hace cargo de ellos, por lo que se preocupa por brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, juegos, pan y sopas. Sueña con incrementar su inventario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is 33 years old and manages a store. She has been in business for more than four years and offers all types of daily consumer products. Maria has three children (ages 12, 6, and 2) for whom she is responsible. She is concerned about providing them the opportunity to study.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital for purchasing basic grains, detergents, candy, juices, bread, and soups. Her dream is to increase the inventory of her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, candy, juices, bread, and soups.

loans.name: Chausiku

texts.en:
Chausiku is age 28 and has been in farming for three years. She produces maize, beans and eggs, which she sells locally in Kitale, western Kenya. She is single with one child who is seven years old. She runs a salon for additional income.

Chausiku has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow, which she believes will enable her to give basic provisions to her child. She is optimistic the business will grow and she aspires to become a prominent breeder in the future.

However, she laments about the poor prices for dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 40-year-old single mother of four children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for 13 years. She got the original capital from farming. 

Her hardships are seasonal business and theft, and her vision is to own a boutique and to educate her children.

Janet needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Shyr

texts.en:
This is Shyr, 26, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Greg, an Overseas Filipino Worker, and has young children. She is constantly working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Shyr operates a variety store. In the Philippines a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Shyr earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns income through Electronic Cellular Phone Loading Station. She buys electronic cellular phone load in huge amounts and then retails it to customers in smaller amounts. Profit depends on the network's dealership policy. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 393 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Shyr dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. Nancy has a store that sells construction supplies: sacks or loads of sand, gravel, and stones. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy additional sacks or loads of sand, gravel, and stone to sell. Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and stone

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Angélica llega recomendado por sus padres que son clientes D. nuestra institución, ella vive en la casa D. sus padres juntamente con sus dos hijos uno D. ellos en edad escolar y el otro D. tres años, ella es separada,  el papá D. sus hijos le ayuda con víveres. Angélica se dedica a la elaboración D. enaguas y venta D. mantas en pueblos y zonas aledañas D. su casa ella tiene mas pedido cerca a fiestas D. las localidades, en esta oportunidad tiene bastante pedido para una fiesta que se acerca por la zona D. chasquipampa que se llevara acabo en septiembre, ella necesita el crédito para la compra  D. tela en rollos para la confección D. sus enaguas, es una persona joven con ganas D. crecer y D. tener un taller granD. y poder contratar operarios para así mejorar su calidad D. vida D. toda su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Angélica comes recommended by her parents, who are clients of our institution.  She lives in her parents' home, together with her two children; one of whom is school-age, and the other is three years old.  She is separated, and the father of her children helps her with their living expenses.

Angélica works making petticoats and selling blankets in the villages and areas surrounding her home.  She takes many orders around the time of the festivals in the region.  Currently, she has sufficient orders for an approaching festival in the Chasquipampa area, which takes place in September.

She needs the loan for the purchase of rolls of fabric for making her petticoats.

She is a young woman with goals of growing her business and having a large workshop where she can hire workers, and so improve her entire family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and blankets.

loans.name: Gemelita

texts.en:
Gemelita is 42 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City.  She is married with 2 children. 

Gemelita buys and sells dried fish for a living and has been doing so for 3 years.  She has requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase different kinds of dried fish for her retail business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Gemelita hopes to have a store in the market so she can display her dried fish. 

Gemelita is a good mother of her children.  She is a happy member of PMPC because they can help her overcome her financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase different kind of dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) is a farmer. She grows cucumbers and tomatoes. Her husband, Sat, is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives in separate home, one is a garment worker, one sells desserts and another one attends school. 

Srey is requesting another loan of $200 to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: to put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items to stock her food café

loans.name: Yehime Group

texts.fr: YEHIME est un  groupement composé de vingt six personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Lucienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Lucienne est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Théodore. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple se partage ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales, Lucienne vend des poissons fumés de façon ambulante. Lucienne s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Lucienne et les autres membres du groupement YEHIME sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en:
YEHIME Group is made up of 26 persons who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand.

The group's representative, named Lucienne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 38 years old, and married to one Théodore. The couple have four school-attending children they have to support, and cover the various family expenses together.

To provide for her various needs and help with the family expenses, Lucienne sells smoked fish as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies in Benin. For the second time, Lucienne and the other members of the group are seeking a loan from ALIDé in order to bolster their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Maria Helen

texts.en:
Maria Helen is 45 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor.  She has had a live-in partner for eight years and they have been blessed with two children. 

Maria Helen sells clothing to earn a living.  Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase ready-to-wear products.

Maria Helen has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Maria Helen hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear products.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La Sra. Ludith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 35 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos (de 16 y 6 años) en edad escolar.

Se inició con su negocio de venta de frutas a los alrededores de un mercado de la zona, pero ella y sus compañeros de venta fueron desalojados del lugar es así que deciden formar su banquito comunal para poder emprender un nuevo negocio, con un capital de S/. 200.00 más sus ahorros pudo dar el adelanto para adquirir un mototaxi, el cual alquila diariamente. Una vez terminado de pagar el vehículo, en adelante todo es ganancia y esto le sirve para ayudar con la economía de su hogar y junto a su esposo forjar el futuro de sus hijos, así mismo pudieron comprar un terreno para poder construir su casa, que es el anhelo de toda familia.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00, comprará otro vehículo (mototaxi), para poder seguir incrementando sus ganancias.
Ludith es una mujer luchadora,  uno de sus sueños es seguir incrementando su negocio con mas unidades de motocar y la construcción de su casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad de crecer como empresaria.
La foto presenta sombras debido al techo del motocar.
texts.en:
Ludith is a member of the 'Alisson II' community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province and department.  Ludith is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are 16 and 6 years old.  They are both in school.

Ludith started out with a business selling fruit tp neighboring areas through a regional market.  However, she and her fellow saleswomen were relocated from their sales location and so they decided to form a community bank so that they could take on new businesses.  With capital of 200 soles plus her savings, Ludith was able to start a business by purchasing a motorcycle taxi which she rents out on a daily basis.  Once she finished paying for her vehicle, from there on in everything was profits.  This has enabled her to help towards her household finances and, together with her husband, she is forging a future for her children.  They have been able to buy a plot of land and build their own home which is their whole family's wish.

With this loan for 3,000 soles, Ludith will buy another vehicle (a motorcycle taxi) with which she will continue increasing her profits.

Ludith is a tenacious woman.  One of her dreams is to continue increasing her business with more motorcycle taxi vehicles and to build her house.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her with the opportunity to grow as a businesswoman.  The photo is showing shade owing to the roof of her motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.ru: Исомиддин женатый 29 - летний мужчина. У него двое детей. Он занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области четыре года. Он берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Isomiddin is a married 29 year old man. He has two children. He is in animal husbandry. He raises cattle for future sale. He has been in this line of work for four years. He is requesting a loan to purchase a few steers.

loans.use: purchase a few steers.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 37 years old, married and has 10 children, four of whom are in school.  

Marissa is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and has been in business for seven years.  Marissa has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Ms. Thua is 37 years old with four children who are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice, vegetables and is raising some pigs for meat. She joined SEDA’s credit program in 2007, and has used loans effectively toimprove the productivity of her agricultural production process. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivating.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivating

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin lives with her husband and daughters. She is engaged in agriculture. Besides agriculture, Angin runs a little bakery, where she makes and sells bread. 

Angin has applied for a loan to cultivate her land and develop her bakery. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase seeds and flour. This loan will help Angin to develop her farming, as well as increase the production in the bakery. 

Angin hopes she will develop the bakery and create jobs for members of the community in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and flour.

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Finesse est un regroupement de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne 35  ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à HEREMAKONO NORD, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures avec  SALIMATA , de la fabrication et vente de savons traditionnels et des légumes.
SALIMATA, en T-shirt bleu,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux colis de chaussures en plastiques. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable journalièrement ou hebdomadairement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Finesse is a group composed of 4 women who, in average, are 35, have 6 children, and live in nuclear families in HEREMAKONO NORD, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).
This is the first time they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women is into shoes with SALIMATA, vegetables, and making and selling traditional soap.
With this loan, SALIMATA, wearing a blue T-shirt, plans on buying 2 loads of plastic shoes. She buys these items at the big market of Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. She sells them retail at the market in Bougouni as well as door-to-door to a customer base composed mainly of women, who pay cash or on credit, daily or weekly.
She plans on making an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband pay for their daily expenses. The other part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children, ages 7, 4 and 1. He recently opened his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to people in the community of Chikola, which is located in the mining town of Chingola, Zambia. 

Kelvin is requesting a Kiva loan to help him purchase a Zoona-brand trading booth. This will help Kelvin to save the rental costs he currently pays at a shop location. It will also improve his business's branding image which will help bring in more customers.  

This is Kelvin’s first Kiva loan. He is grateful for this opportunity and explains that getting a bank loan in Zambia is very difficult. He looks forward to getting another Kiva loan so he can continue to scale up his business.

Kelvin’s biggest dream is to provide all his children with a college education so they can have the opportunity to do whatever they desire. He is hopeful that the success of his business will help make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona-brand trading  booth

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells cosmetics, clothes and jewelry. She has been in this line of work for about 8 years. Prior to this, she had a small stand where she sold fruits and vegetables, but she had to close down after she became ill. After she got better, she decided to start a business that was more flexible. She sells all types of women’s items to her friends and neighbors. Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

Carmen has three children, two of which are already working. Her youngest child, a nine year old boy, has a mental disability. It is very rough for her to raise him because she has limited access to psychological and medical services, but her son receives all the love and care her family can offer.

loans.use: Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

loans.name: Yokunda

texts.en: Yokunda resides at Mtakuja in the Ilala District of  Dar es Salaam. She is married and has five children. One is in primary school,three are in secondary school and the others are in kindergarten. Yokunda owns a retail shop selling various consumable items. She has operated the shop for more than six years now. She recently realized that her profit margin has been declining due to the increased number of competitors in the area. In a plan to improve her profit margin, Yokunda has decided to add some items in her shop that her competitors do not have. She also plans to open another shop on the next street. These new strategies require additional capital. From her own savings, Yokunda cannot finance her business plan. She is in need of an additional USD 1000 to implement her plan. She expects that this strategy will enable her to earn more income to meet her family requirements and pay for school fees for her children. She has a dream of becoming a big wholeseller in her area.

loans.use: to add stock to her shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells foods such as beans, rice, and flour outside her house in Manyatta, Kisumu. Grace is married with 2 children. She has repaid her first loan of 25 USD and wishes to receive a loan of 150 USD to pay for an annual license and to diversify the range of products she sells.

loans.use: To purchase a business license and expand my business

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu T. is 45 years old and married with five children.  He sells second-hand clothes in the open air market in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With his previous loan from SMT, T. was able to increase his stock. He would now like a second loan of $175 so that he can include children’s clothes.  His hope is that his business profits will allow him to see that his children succeed with their education.

loans.use: Diversify his stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
"I still need to build a security fence for the side of my house that will give more security to my family, because there have been lots of robberies in the neighborhood where we live. Also, I would like to buy some blocks to make a little room in the back part of my home." I am requesting $500 to put up a fence and buy blocks to make a little room."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Me hace falta levantar la barda que esta al lado de mi casa para darle más seguridad a mi familia, ya que han robado mucho en ese fraccionamiento en donde vivimos, también me gustaría comprar algunos blocks para hacer un cuarto pequeño en la parte de atras”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner una barda y comprar blocks para hacer un cuarto.

loans.use: Build a fence for security and buy construction blocks.

loans.name: Cristina De

texts.es:
Cristina is a 42 year old woman that makes her living selling food in a stand that is located at Tres esquina avenue Rodolfo Palenque in the city of El Alto.. She lives in the house that she owns from Monday to Saturday , which is located in the Lucio Perez Velasco street in the zone of General Pando (Senkata Sector). She lives there with her two sons. One of them is in college and the other one goes to school

Her husband works some works at a lodge. Cristina works making meals. Even though there is a big competition in this market, her long trajectory allows her to have fixed clients, since it is characterized being very hygienic and to have an excellent treatment to her clients. She always ends up selling the food that prepares for the day. All the meals that she makes have different prices that are different by the amount and variety.

The present request is for the acquisition of construction material, since they will make improvements and extensions to his house. Cristina does not have negative antecedents in the financial system

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina, de 42 años de edad es una señora que se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto que se encuentra ubicado en la Calle Tres esquina Av. Rodolfo Palenque de la ciudad de El Alto de lunes a sábado. La cliente vive en su domicilio propio, que se encuentra ubicado en la calle Lucio Perez Velasco en la zona de General Pando (Sector Senkata), en el mismo vive con sus dos hijos uno se encuenta en la universidad y el otro sigue asistiendo al colegio, su esposo trabaja de formal eventual en un alojamiento. Cristina trabaja como comerciante de comida desde hace seis años, si bien existe competencia en este mercado, su larga trayectoria le permite tener clientes fijos, ya que se caracteriza por ser muy higiénica y tener un excelente trato a los comensales, siempre termina de vender la comida que elabora para el día. Todos los platos que elabora tiene diferentes precios que se diferencian por la cantidad y variedad, además también influye la demanda que tengasn los mismos. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de material de construcción, ya que efectuarán mejoras y ampliaciones a su vivienda. Cristina no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Dilafruz A. has been selling women's clothing since 2003. Despite her young age she has been successful in her business. Her business's development is illustrated by the growth of her revenues which shows that she has been good at using her working capital. Dilafruz uses her loans to increase her product assortment, in order to not lose customers and to attract new ones. She always tries to get new products and to be competitive.

Dilafruz recently married and her husband helps her to transport her products. He has his own business and together they plan to save money to purchase an apartment. (In the photo you can see Dilafruz on the right, pictured on the left is her sister). When Dilafruz found out about KIVA she asked for an additional loan to purchase new products. Since she has been successfully paying back her current loan from MicroInvest, the committee has approved her for posting on the KIVA site.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva volunteer.

Дилафруз Артикова занимается продажей женской одежды с 2003 года. Несмотря на то, что она молодая, она достаточно умело ведет бизнес. О развитии её бизнеса можно наблюдать по росту её активов, что свидетельствует о хорошем обороте денежного капитала. Полученные займы от нашей организации она полностью вкладывает в расширение ассортимента, чтобы не потерять клиентов и привлечь новых. Она всегда старается обновлять свой ассортимент и быть конкурентоспособной. Она недавно вышла замуж, и её муж помогает ей с транспортировкой товара. У него отдельная торговая точка и они вместе планируют накопить деньги на будущую квартиру.(На фото она с права, со своей сестрой) Она узнав о сушесвовании такой программы как КИВА,попросила дополнительный займ на закупки нового ассортимента товара,Так как она успешно погашает свой текущий займ c Микроинвеста, на комитете этот клиент была утвержденна на размешение на сайт КИВА.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en: Mercy has a poultry farm. She intends to use the extra profits to construct another brooder (chicken house) to expand the business.

loans.use: To build a chicken house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana C. is currently separated from her from her husband, and has a 4-year-old daughter: her pride and joy.

Ana owns a bookstore located in front of a school. Thanks to this optimum location, her sales are good. She sells all kinds of school supplies, fashion jewelry, and ice cream, among other items.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise and start the school year offering students a greater variety of accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana C. actualmente esta separada de su esposo tiene una hija de 4 años, quien es su mayor alegría.

Ana posee una librería que esta ubicada frente a un colegio, gracias a esto las ventas son bastante buenas. Ella vende todo tipo de útiles escolares, bijouterie, helados, entre otras cosas.

Ella solicita el crédito de tal forma que pueda comprar mas mercaderías para empezar este año con la mayor variedad de accesorios para los estudiantes.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies such as: notebooks, backpacks, pencils, erasers, paintbrushes, etc.

loans.name: Seke's Msanga 1 Group

texts.en:
Seke is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 8 and 21/2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 25 and 17 years old. Seke sells spare parts. She started in 1990. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business.

In the past, Seke has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who sells cloth.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Club De Madres Enmanuel Group

texts.en:
Wilma is a 31 year-old woman from the community of Imbert, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, where she lives as a single parent with her 12 year-old daughter, a student at a nearby local school . Wilma is currently attending University and hopes to one day be a professional and move to the United States. She received her first loan from Esperanza six months ago, and is now taking out a second. She sells used clothing that she imports from the US, and her business has grown significantly since she first started working with Esperanza. We asked her to tell us a few facts about herself, and she told us that her favorite foods are salami and bananas and that she loves using the Internet in her free time.

Five women in this community have already taken out one loan with Esperanza and five women are new clients. They are all looking forward to this opportunity, and are committed to their families, businesses, and each other! Oh behalf of Esperanza, and all of the women in this group, thank you for your generosity and support. God Bless!

loans.use: To increase imports of used clothing from the U.S.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa S. Q. is a member of the Communal Bank “VISION 2000.” She lives in the San Martín region of Picota province in San Hilarión state. Her business is located on Marginal avenue at Fernando Belaunde Terri highway, where she sells groceries, candy, and other consumable products.

She studied in the university to be a teacher but did not finish her degree due to lack of money for tuition.

With the loan for S/1500, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy a variety of packaged noodles, crates of preserved fish, sacks of rice and sugar, liters of oil, and stock up on soda pop and candy as well as home and personal care products.

Rosa has two children, her husband helps her with everything, and together they dream of have a bigger business and ensure the well-being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa S. Q., es socia del Banco Comunal ,“VISIÒN 2000” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión su negocio está ubicado en la avenida Marginal , carretera Fernando Belaunde Terri, vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario.

Tiene estudio superiores no concluidos de profesora, que los dejo por falta de medios económicos para continuar estudiando.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, además de surtir con bebidas gasificadas y golosinas y productos de aseo para el hogar y personal.

Rosa tiene doshijos, su esposo la apoya en todo, juntos sueñan con tener un negocio más grande y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana M. is a 22-year-old woman who has bred sheep in the Bilasuvar region since 2003. She raises and sells the sheep to local bazaar traders and local people. A meal of mutton is especially popular at summer wedding parties. She lives with her husband and daughter, and her husband's parents. All the members of her family are unemployed and it is very hard to cover their basic needs. Tarana has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase ten sheep ($60 each) and fodder ($200). She believes that during the wedding season she could sell many sheep, the sales of which will enable her to purchase more sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a woman who is, without a doubt, an excellent farmer and mother. She works arduously day after day so her products are the best at the market where she sells them. For this, she makes sacrifices to adequately care for and fertilize her lands. Above all, she pays the highest respect for keeping them clean so that her fields can bear high-quality products.

One of Florencia's dreams is to increase the size of her fields, but that is, doubtlessly, an investment she cannot make solely on her own. For this, she is requesting economic support, money that will help in the purchase of lands and crops. She hopes that you will heed her call and will be forever grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Florencia es una mujer que sin duda es buena madre y excelente agricultora, ella se esfuerza día a día para que sus productos sean los mejores del mercado donde los vende. Por ello, se sacrifica cuidando y abonando adecuadamente sus tierras, y sobre todo dándole los respectivos mantenimientos de limpieza para que sus plantaciones puedan dar productos de buena calidad. Uno de sus deseos es poder aumentar la proporción de sus cultivos, sin duda esto es una gran inversión que sola no puede afrontar. Por ello pide su apoyo económicoa, dinero que le ayudaría en la compra de plantaciones y de su vivero . Florencia espera que usted pueda atender a su solicitud. Se mantendrá agradecida toda su vida por su apoyo.

loans.use: Increase crop production and purchase new fields / Ampliar la producción de sus cultivos y compra de nuevas plantaciones.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 40-year-old divorced mother of four. Two of her children have completed senior high school. She sells baby clothes, diapers, baby powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles and the like through hawking, balancing her stock on her head and walking miles to her customers' doors.

She is seeking a loan to increase her stock and thus expand her business, making her better able to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of a community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group members provide guarantees for one another and assist one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of baby care supplies

loans.name: Siti's Tuwe Na Moyo Group

texts.en:
Siti is 36 years. She is married with two children aged seven and two years old. She has been a perfumes and clothes seller since 2003. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Siti now hopes for a loan to buy more perfumes and clothes to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Amina.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes and clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Osman Guillermo

texts.es: Don Osaman M., tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, le tiene tres hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 15 años. 12 años y 8 años, cursando la mayor el tercer año de bachillerato. su otro hijo cursa el segundo año de secundaria y su tercer hijo el segundo grado de primaria, su esposa se desempeña como profesora. Don Osman tiene dos años de haber dando inicio a este pequeño proyecto siendo este una pequeña pulperia como producto del desempleo y una manera de aportar a los gastos del hogar. Su mayor sueño es poder llegar a tener una misecelana donde ofertar todos lo productos del hogar asi como cosmeticos, Con los creditos pretende ir creceindo poco a poco y con las ganancias poder ir mejorando sus condicones de vida y economicas de igual manera ir ampliando su negocio hasta logara su sueño, su deseo en la vida es poder dejarle a sus hijos una carrera como profesionales y un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Osman is 34 years old and married with three kids, ages 15, 12 and 8. The oldest is in his third year of high school, the middle is in his second year of middle school, and the youngest is in second grade. His wife makes a living as a teacher. Osman is two years removed from having started his small convenience store when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell household products as well as cosmetics. With the loan he expects to keep growing little by little and with the earnings he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal. His wish in life is to see his children as professionals with prosperous businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase supplies

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji, the wife of M. W., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 15 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Sugran baji’s husband has a motor workshop. Sugran baji herself is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy tools for her husband’s motor workshop. 

She is joined in her loan group by two other members. Hayat baji wants a loan to buy more groceries for her grocery shop. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy a molding machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools to repair vehicles for their motor workshop

loans.name: Hadiaratou Yalcoue

texts.fr:
Madame  H. Yalcoué a 40 ans, vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et ses sept (7) enfants (4 garçons et 3 filles), à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir tenté plusieurs d’activités sans succès, elle  opta de s’initiée à  l’activité d’achat et de vente des  pagnes Wax(tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest),  de tissus brodés,  de draps de lit et de tasses “Super” depuis  maintenant huit (8) ans. Elle mène son activité au marché de son quartier à Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clienèle grâce à la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a cinq (5) ans.  Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Banconi), elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel  et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt: 10 pièces de pagne wax, 10 complets  de tissus brodé, 10 complets de drap et 10 complets de tasse “Super”. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso au Burkina Faso auprès des grossistes sur commandes.
Elle vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Parallèlement à cette activité principale le commerce, elle fait la prestation de service à savoir la couture. Elle coud les habits de ses voisins du quartiers et de ses clientes ce qui lui apporte des recettes couvrant l’essentielles de ses dépenses. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. H. Yalcoué, age 40, lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wives, and seven children (four boys and three girls) in Banconi, one of the outlying districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having tried several kinds of work without success, she opted to become initiated eight years ago in the commerce of 'Wax' pagnes (highly prized cloth in West Africa), embroidered fabrics, bedsheets, and 'Super' basins. She works at the marketplace of her district in Sikasso where she is in high demand by her customers, thanks to the quality of her goods. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After five solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association of her district (Association Benkadi de Banconi), she is now on her fourth individual loan. All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She intends to use this loan to buy: 10 lengths of 'Wax' pagnes, 10 sets of embroidered fabrics, 10 sets of sheets, and 10 sets of 'Super' basins. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso from wholesalers by special order. She sells her goods, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed essentially of women. Concurrent to this principal commerce, she works in the service sector, specifically dressmaking. She sews clothing for her neighbors and customers, who provide her with revenues that cover her main expenses. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA, which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 'Wax' pagnes, embroidered fabrics, bedsheets, and 'Super' basins

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim L., 29, is a grocery seller who lives in Prongel Commune in Pursat Province. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, plastic goods, canned foods, soft drinks, beers, and cakes. She began her business in 2000, and receives a profit of approximately $4 per day. 

She is married and cares for one young child who is attending school. Her husband, Phat Chay, is a 35-year-old rice farmer, who also raises pigs in their home to help meet the family's expenses. Mrs. L. hopes to expand her business, so she would like to request a loan to purchase a range of groceries items to store and resell.

loans.use: To purchase groceries items

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
A causa de la despedida de su esposo en su trabajo ella tuvo que salir en busca de un trabajo. Como no pudo ser contratada por ninguna empresa, ella decidió abrir un pequeño puesto ambulante en un mercado cerca a su casa. Ella dedica todo el día a su venta de frutas desde hace diez años. Siempre con el objetivo de mantener a toda su familia. 
Andrea, en un inicio todas las ganancias de su negocio las dedicaba a su hogar, sin embargo poco a poco ha aprendido que debe reinvertir en su negocio si quiere mantenerlo. Con mucho esfuerzo y responsabilidad ella ha logrado mucho y aún espera progresar más para poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Because her husband's dismissal from work, Andrea had to search for a job. As she could not receive an employment offer from any company, Andrea decided to open a small stand in a market near her home. For the past 10 years, she has her days selling fruit, always focused on providing for her entire family.
In the beginning, Andrea spent all her profits on her household, however, she gradually learned that she must reinvest in her business if she wants to keep it running. With much effort and responsibility, Andrea has achieved quite a bit, and still hopes to progress more in efforts to complete the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase/improve her fruit stand

loans.name: Alikul

texts.en:
Alikul M. is married and the father of five children. He works as a farmer every day. Educated up to secondary school, he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to attend high school. Alikul, with a good work ethic, has whole-heartedly committed himself to agriculture.

Thanks to his hard work, he has today become a man known for his determination and serves as an example and reference for other farmers. He has been growing potatoes and wheat for the past 10 years. He is now seeking a loan of 600 USD to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants for his crops in the hopes of being well-prepared for the upcoming season and to produce a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his work conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina E. is 44 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and food. She loves this business. Valentina hopes for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more food and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and food

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mme Adjo L. est née en 1969 à Kpalimé. Elle est mariée avec six (06) personnes en charge. Très dévoué et dynamique, elle initia la culture du champignon. C'est un produit alimentaire naturel utilisé dans l'art culinaire pour substituer au poisson ou à la viande dans la préparation des sauces. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l'offre  mais elle n'a les moyens suffisants pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour acheter les outils de travail et tous les éléments qui entrent dans cette culture. Les bénéfices tirés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo L. was born in 1969 in Kpalimé. She is married and has six people to look after. She is very dedicated and energetic, and has started growing mushrooms. This is a natural food product used in cooking as a substitute for fish or meat when preparing sauces. Demand now exceeds supply, but she does not have the means to meet customer requirements. This is why she is requesting financing so that she can buy the tools of her trade and all the elements involved in mushroom growing. The profit will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing and selling mushrooms

loans.name: Mayombe Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Annet, age 28, has been in business for over 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase items for her retail shop: specifically maize flour, wheat flour, millet flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, soap, tea leaves, etc. She is married with 5 kids age 8, 6, 3, 2, and 1 years old. She has been living up to her challenges and can now purchase stock in large quantities. Mrs. Annet is an active woman taking care of her home and paying her kids' school fees.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura de verduras en sus tierras de Compañía, sus productos los vende en el M. de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Elizabeth junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Elizabeth sueña con tener un puesto en el M. de abastos, comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the community bank "Solution". She is married with three children. Elizabeth's job is to grow vegetables from the land. She sells her products in the food market in the city of Ayacucho. Moreover, Elizabeth works together with her husband to make handcrafted bricks. Elizabeth needs a loan of 900 sols to invest in the purchase of land. Her dream is to have her own stand in the food market, buy an estate, and build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Quế Hoàng THị (1432040715) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has five infant children.

TQuế owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Quế joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

Quế is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra P. tiene ya mas de tres años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, está es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Está solicitando un préstamo para liquidar el pago de un pedido que realizo ya que  los clientes que le encargaron el producto ya no le quisieron pagar, y ella tiene que solventar el pago si no le cancelan el crédito. Para la señora Alejandro es importante conservar su contrato con la compañía de belleza solo con ese ingreso cuenta para salir a delante con su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandra P. has been working for more than three years selling beauty products from catalogs. This is her family's source of income. She is requesting a loan to pay off an order that she placed, because the customers who requested the products refused to pay her. She needs to pay for the order to avoid having her credit canceled. It is important to Alejandra to maintain her contract with the beauty products company, because that income is the only way for her and her family to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment to supplier

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth T. is fifty-four years old and married with four children, both school age and adult age. She lives in Navalan Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has operated her business of picture wood lamination for five years and generates a monthly income of about $85.  She joined Paglaum MPC last year with a loan of 9,000 PHP.  Now in her fourth loan cycle, Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use as capital for her business. The profit she generates will be used for family expenses and for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Capital for wood lamination

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Farida O. from Mwanza. She is divorced, with three children between the ages of 14 and 19 years old.

Farida has been running a soda business since 2007. It is said that Pepsi is one of the most recognized symbols in the world, and it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of shop selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing - a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture.

Farida works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more soda to sell to her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Farida thanks you for your support!


About SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more soda to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S., 34, has been working as a vegetable-seller since 2000 in her village in Battambong province. S. works so hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for her family.

S. is married and lives with her husband who is involved in the business with her, too. They both can earn collectively a typical income of US$15 per day. She has four children: three of her children are attending a local primary school, and the other one is employed as a building contractor.

S. wants to take a loan of US$1,200 as her first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to expand her inventory by purchasing more vegetables of various kinds.

loans.use: To purchasing more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 22 años, es una muchacha muy consciente y madura, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Caminando por la calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, Rufina realiza su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lo hace yendo casa por casa, en espera de que la gente le compre alguno de sus productos. Rufina es una vendedora muy  convincente es por eso que ya tiene varios clientes ganados, los cuales siempre compran sus cosméticos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y ver como su mercadería poco a poco se termina, lleva un año en esta actividad y considera que lo que menos le gusta es caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. Para un futuro espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza con mayor tranquilidad. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rufina con MFP y quiere pagarlo a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos productos de belleza para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Rufina, 22, is a very conscientious and mature girl. She lives with her parents. What she wants most is to give them a peaceful old age. Rufina does her work walking the streets of the city of Juliaca. She sells beauty products, which sends her door to door in the hope that people will buy some of her products. Rufina is a very convincing sales person. That is why she already has won various customers who always buy her cosmetics. What she likes best about her work is selling and seeing how her merchandise, little by little, goes. She has been doing this for one year. What she likes the least is walking all day beneath the inclement sun. Even so, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell her beauty products with more tranquility. This is Rufina’s fourth loan with MFP. She wants to pay it on time because she would like to have access to another loan later. She is a very active member of her community bank. She is always thinking of the well being of her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to buy new beauty products to offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Dassan's Group

texts.en:
M. Dassan is the leader of a lending group in Kirinya, Bweyogerere. He is a married man with four children as he cares for two dependants under one roof.

He buys plots of land and houses and rents to people at a fee. He is well known and gets along with them and wins more customers. He also sells construction sand for housing and has a brick laying business. He employs two men. He needs a loan to buy another piece of land where he can get more sand for sale and for laying more bricks. This will help him get more money for his children’s education and for their well being.

loans.use: Buy a piece of land for brick laying and for sand for sale.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Teodosia C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 60 years old. Teodosia is married and has two adult children.To make a living, Teodosia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teodosia has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (about $32) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Teodosia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodosia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Teodosia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Teodosia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kelvin Odir

texts.es: Kelvin Odir G. Q. de 30 años de edad, reside el departamento de Cuscatlán. Kelvin vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 9 y 5 años de edad. Kelvin tiene su propio negocio el cual ofrece servicios de rótulos para publicidad o anuncios varios, el negocio de Kelvin tiene ocho años de experiencia al servicio de sus clientes, ofreciendo calidad y la mejor atención, el crédito que solicita Kelvin es para invertir en productos que utiliza para la producción de rótulos, ya que afortunadamente su negocio ha ido tomando fuerza y teniendo una gran demanda

loans.use: materiales para la impresion de rotulos

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es:
El microempresario Alfredo Antonio Gómez B. tiene 65 años de edad, es casado con  5 hijos todos adultos, tiene desde hace 30 años una pulpería en la cual vende granos básicos, productos cárnicos, carbón entre otros.

Con este negocio el señor Gómez ha podido darle los estudios a sus hijos como un ingreso extra, ya que también es de profesión músico tocando la trompeta, actividad que también le genera ciertos ingresos. Sin embargo esta última actividad  (música) no tiene contratos fijos por lo que no puede depender solamente de esta y por tal razón su pequeña pulpería, mas el apoyo de dos de sus hijos le permite poderse mantener junto a su esposa y dos nietos.

El microempresario Gómez B. anteriormente había sido cliente de ADEPHCA en varias ocasiones y sus pagos siempre fueron en tiempo y forma, actualmente requiere se le apoye con el financiamiento para comprar los siguientes productos:

2 Quintales de Arroz americano compra  US$ 50 cada quintal, 1 bidón de aceite el cual obtiene por US$ 30 cada bidón, 1 quintal de frijoles lo compra  US$ 45 cada quintal, 3 bolsones de  papel higiénico  a US$ 5 cada bolsón, 3 cajas de jabón marfil a US$ 10 cada caja y 2 quintales de  azúcar a US$ 40 el quintal.
texts.en:
Microentrepreneur Alfredo Antonio Gómez B. is 65 years old, married, and father of 5 adult children. For over 30 years he has run a general store where he sells basic grains, meat products, coal, among other items. With this business Mr. Gómez has been able to provide his children with an education. As an additional source of income, being a musician, he earns extra income playing the trumpet. However, this musical activity isn't based on set contracts so he can't count on it as a sole source of income therefore profits from his small grocery store, added to a modest financial help from two of his sons, permits him to support himself, his wife and two grandchildren. He has been a ADEPHCA client in the past and has always been meticulous with his payments. He currently requires financing to buy the following products: 2 Quintales (a unit of mass equivalent to approximately 100 pounds) of American rice (50 dollars US each), 1 bidón (a unit of volume that can be 18.5 or 20 liters) of oil (30 dollars US each), 1 quintal of beans (45 dollars US each), 3 bolsones (large bags) of toilet paper (5 dollars US each), 3 boxes of ivory soap at 10 dollars US each, and 2 quintales of sugar at 40 dollars US each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy American rice, oil, beans, toilet paper, ivory soap and sugar.

loans.name: Santos Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora SANTOS EMILIANA, tiene  53 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Santos, tiene estudios hasta 6º de primaria, tiene 4 hijos y todos son independientes. La Señora Santos se dedica a la venta de comida, por las noches vende tallarines con papa guisada y migadito (plato típico de la zona), así como también tamales, cabrito, pato, pavita. Por las mañanas también se dedica a la venta de menús para algunos conocidos.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que piensa utilizarlo para comprar sus mesas y sillas donde poder atender a sus clientes. 
Santos, sueña con tener restaurante en su casa, poder habilitarla y hacer su  sueño realidad, de la mano con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
SANTOS EMILIANA, 53, lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II communal bank. Santos finished 6th grade. She has 4 children, all of whom are independent. She sells prepared meals. At night she sells pasta with fried potatoes, migadito (a dish typical of the area), as well as tamales, goat, duck, turkey. During the mornings she also sells prepared meals for her regular customers. This is her first loan. She needs 300 soles to buy tables and chairs where she can serve her customers. Santos dreams with having a well-equipped restaurant in her home and to make her dream come true hand-in-hand with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ruyonza Ii Tukore Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Irene B. is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 39 years old and married with children who attend school. Irene is a hardworking lady in the business of selling produce at the Ruyonza trading centre. Irene sells produce from both her own farm and from various farmers in her locality, depending on the quality. Since she started taking out loans, she has been able to earn 300,000 in monthly profits thanks to the loyalty of her customers. Her goal is to expand her business and to have a happy and healthy family. She needs a loan to help add more stock to her business to avoid shortages.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 40 years old and married with a child. Her only child is ten years old. Eunice is a friendly and hardworking woman. She sells building materials at retail prices to her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high education. Efua sells cooked rice with tomatoes sauce at Teterem near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase raw rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to use it to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase raw rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is the thirty-five-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Sabina is a trader, trading in printed textiles. She hawks to sell in her community (goes door-to-door) and also treks to nearby towns to sell. She procures bales of printed cloth from Accra. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway T. is a native of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is a 72-year-old widow surviving on her own. At her age, Liwayway is seen as a strong, old woman determined to raise her standard of living.

In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI [micro-finance institution] and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She has utilized the loans in her farming business. Since she became a member of ASHI, she has been able to maintain a very good performance. She is now requesting a loan for 30,000 Philippine pesos to use as additional capital for her business.

She still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and save for her future because she is getting older now.

loans.use: Additional capital for farming business

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina Z. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in a hotel (restaurant) and is requesting a loan to stock sodas, beer and water to sell. Rina is 40 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock sodas, beer and water to sell

loans.name: Tamuyu Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Tamuyu' group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come together to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in order to expand their businesses. 

The leader of the group is Fatmata K.. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, and they have 3 children – 1 in primary school and 2 who are not of school-going age. For 5 years now, Fatmata has been a businesswoman; she sells clothes, shoes, and bras. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items wholesale and retail them in Magburaka town. 

(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer, Abdul Karim C., handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes and bras for resale

loans.name: Violetas X Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama violetas por que las clientas se identifican con esta flor por bonitas, está ubicado en la comunidad de casa blanca en el estado de puebla pué, en México, el grupo está conformado por 11 mujeres, es la segunda vez que solicitan crédito.

La presidenta del grupo se llama Victoria M. Z., tiene 41 años, estudió hasta la secundaria se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, tiene una hija que depende de ella de 5 años, su esposo es mecánico desde hace 6 años.
Sus clientas opinan que doña Vicky es una mujer que le gusta salir a delante y que es una mujer emprendedora e independiente por buscar una mejor vida para su familia, su meta en la vida es poder darle una buena educación a su hija para que no sufra de las carencias que ella ha pasado.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar un lote de zapatos  y así surtir los pedidos que tiene hechos.
La Señora Flora C. M. tiene 21 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos de dos y tres años, su esposo se dedica a la construcción y ella estudio solo hasta la primaria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales caseros desde hace 3 años. Ella aprendió a hacer los tamales por receta de su abuela poniendo el sazón familiar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un triciclo que le permita trasladarse con su tamalera y así llegar a ofrecer su producto más lejos, sus clientas la conocen como una mujer joven y emprendedora al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta por la confianza que le brindaron sus compañeras de grupo a pesar de ser tan joven.

El éxito para ella significa darles una mejor educación a sus hijos para que no sufran las carencias que ella tuvo de niña.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

JUANA FLORES V. T. - VENDE COSMETICOS
BEATRIZ DIANA G. S. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
ANA MIRIAM G. A. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
ROSAURA H. G. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
MARIA ANTONIETA J. M. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
MARIA DEL CARMEN L. J. - VENTA DE ANTOJITOS MEJICANOS
SUYAPA M. O. - VENTA DE PLATA
JOSEFINA R. QUIZAMON - VENTA DE ZAPATO
MARTINA N. C. - VENTA DE ZAPATO
texts.en:
This group is called “Violetas” (Violets) because the members identify with these beautiful flowers. It is located in the Casa Blanca community, Puebla, México. It is composed of 11 women and this is their second loan request. Victoria M. Z., 41, is the group president. She finished middle school and is in catalogue shoe sales. She has a 5-year-old daughter that depends on her and her husband has been a mechanic for 6 years. Her customers are of the opinion that Vicky is a woman who likes to get ahead; she is an independent, enterprising woman who seeks a better life for her family; her goal in life is to provide a good education for her daughter so that she won’t suffer through the needs she, herself, has endured in the past. She is requesting funds to buy a block of shoes to fill her pending orders. Flora C. M., 21, is married and has two children, who are 2 and 3 years old. Her husband is a construction worker. She only finished elementary school and has been making home-made tamales to sell for the last 3 years. She learned how to make tamales following her grandmother’s recipe so they have a homey flavor. She wants funds to buy a tricycle (three-wheel delivery cart) that will make it possible for her to transport her product from where she makes the tamales to sales locations that are farther away. Her customers know her as being a young, enterprising woman who, at the moment of asking for this loan, is happy about the trust that was placed on her by her fellow group members despite her youth. Success, for her, is providing a better education for her children so that they won’t suffer through the same needs she did as a child. The other group members are: JUANA FLORES V. T. – Sells cosmetics BEATRIZ DIANA G. S. – Sells cosmetics ANA MIRIAM G. A. - Sells cosmetics ROSAURA H. G. - Sells cosmetics MARIA ANTONIETA J. M. - Sells cosmetics MARIA DEL CARMEN L. J. – Sells typical Mexican fast-food SUYAPA M. O. – Sells silver JOSEFINA R. QUIZAMON – Shoe sales MARTINA N. C. - Shoe sales

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tricycle  (three-wheel delivery cart)

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Lydia is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates business raising pigs for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Begaim's Group

texts.ru:
Каждый день Бегаим Алиева встаёт рано утром, чтобы собрать яйца и сдать их на рынок. Это занятие приносит ей около семьсот сомов ($15) в месяц. Она – лидер данной группы. Всю свою сознательную жизнь Бегаим прожила в сельской местности и занималась сельским хозяйством. После замужества, родители ей оставили две коровы, чтобы было с чего начинать своё хозяйство. С тех пор уже прошло двадцать семь лет. Бегаим сама стала мамой и причём пятерых детей. Две дочери уже вышли замуж и живут отдельно. Сын (ему двадцать четыре), также занялся сельским хозяйством и активно помогает Бегаим ухаживать за скотом. Ещё один сын (ему пятнадцать лет), учится в восьмом классе, а самый младший сын – во втором классе. Муж Бегаим, неизменно, бок о бок, с Бегаим занимается домашним хозяйством и помогает жене воспитывать детей и вместе с сыном пытаются постоянно увеличивать поголовье скота. Их доход помимо продажи яиц, также приходит от продажи молока и доходит до двух тысяч сомов ($40) в месяц. Повседневные хлопоты совсем не утомляют Бегаим. Напротив она с радостью готова содержать больше скота и тем самым увеличить доход семьи. Да и жизнь дорожает с каждым днём и надо принимать твёрдые решения и идти дальше. Бегаим решила обратиться за этим кредитом, так как он позволил бы ей приобрести корову для откорма и продажи молока, и несколько баранов для продажи осенью. 

Канатбеку Абдырахманову сорок шесть лет. Жена Канатбека не работает и находится дома с младшим сынишкой, а детей у Канатбека четверо. Чтобы прокормить семью Канатбек занимается разведением скота и зарабатывает около трёх тысяч сомов в месяц. Он надеется получить этот кредит и купить одну корову и четырёх баранов на откорм. 

Майрамкул Саданбековой сорок восемь лет. Майрамкул продаёт молоко по семь – восемь литров в день и это ей приносит около четырёх тысяч сомов в месяц. За тридцать лет замужества Майрамкул вырастила шестерых детей. Майрамкул хочет получить этот кредит для того, чтобы купить несколько овец на откорм. 

Анарбубу Барановой пятьдесят два года. Она -  мать пятерых детей. Старший сын работает коммерсантом в г. Токмок, ещё один сын работает на стройке. А два других сына помогают отцу ухаживать за скотом. Анарбубу нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить несколько баранов для дальнейшей перепродажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Every day, Begaim A. wakes early in the morning in order to gather eggs and take them to the market. This business yields her about seven hundred som ($15) per month. She is the leader of this group. Begaim spent most of her life living in a rural area and involved in agriculture. After her marriage, her parents left her two cows to start her own household. Twenty-seven years have passed since then. Begaim became a mother herself and had five children. Two daughters already got married and live separately. The son (he is twenty-four) also became involved in agriculture and actively helps Begaim take care of livestock. One other son (he is fifteen years old) is in eighth grade, and the youngest son is in second grade. Begaim’s husband always takes care of the household side-by-side with Begaim and helps his wife raise the children, and, together with his son, tries to constantly increase livestock headcount. Their income does not only come from the sale of eggs, but also from sale of milk and reaches up to two thousand som ($40) per month. Daily duties do not tire Begaim at all.
