On the contrary, she is eager to keep more livestock and increase her family income. And life gets more expensive every day and makes it necessary to make some hard decisions and push forward. Begaim decided to request this loan because it will let her buy a cow for fattening and milk sales, and several sheep for resale in the autumn. Kanatbek A. is forty-six years old. His wife does not work and stays home with the youngest son. Kanatbek has four children. In order to support the family, he is involved in breeding livestock and earns about three thousand som per month. He hopes to obtain this loan and buy one cow and four sheep for fattening. Mayramkul S. is forty-eight. She sells seven to eight liters of milk per day and earns about four thousand som per month. Throughout the thirty years of marriage, she raised six children. Mayramkul wants to obtain this loan in order to buy several sheep for fattening. Anarbubu B. is fifty-two years old. She is a mother of five children. The oldest son works as a businessman in the city of Tokmok, and one other son works at a construction site. And two other sons help their father take care of livestock. Anarbubu needs a loan in order to buy several sheep for future resale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 46-year-old married lady.  She practices farming to earn a living. She raises dairy cattle and grows vegetables, which are her major source of income.  She started the business in the year 2003. She says that she has many customers in her rural area who buy vegetables and milk directly from her farm and she distributes her products in her hometown.  She has joined a group in Faulu Kenya called Muninga Victory where she saves her money on a weekly basis. Salome is a hardworking lady who is really determined to improve her living conditions now that she can access loans. This is her first loan. She has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

The photo has been taken away from her farm in town.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo vive en casa propia con su mama en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una movilidad con la cual trabaja en transporte público.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de mantenimiento de su taxi ya que es su herramienta de trabajo y única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives in his own home with his mother in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz; he has a car which he uses to work in public transportation. He is seeking a loan to pay for the maintenance of his taxi since it is his primary work equipment and his only source of income. He has been an Impro customer and always pays on time which qualifies him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of taxi

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrellitas está integrado por tres feminas trabajadoras una de ella es Lorena Gutiérrez Lara, coordinadora del grupo quien desde 2007  vende ropa usada, frijoles y frutas en sus casa. Lara tiene cuatro hijos de edades 14, 11, 9, 5 y 3 años los cuales estudian y le ayudan en el negocio.

 Sus compañeras de grupo son  Ileana Z. Chavarría es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cinco años y  Ruth C. C. tiene una pequeña venta y comercializa calzado.
texts.en:
The Estrellitas (Stars) group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Lorena Gutiérrez Lara, the group coordinator. Lorena has been selling secondhand clothing, beans, and fruit from her house since 2007. Her children are aged 14, 11, 9, 5, and 3. They are students and also help her with the business. The other members of the group are Ileana Z. Chavarría who has run a small general store for five years, and Ruth C. C. who has a stall selling shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, beans, vegetables

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda I. is from the village of Northern Pob. Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. Rosenda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Rosenda has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC  which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en: Anabella L. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 44 years old. Anabella is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Anabella operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Anabella has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Anabella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Anabella from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hodidja

texts.en:
Hodidja is 26 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old. Hodidja is commonly known in the business of selling shoes and this is her 6th successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Hodidja is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a in order to expand her business through adding many shoes for sale. With these additional sizes of shoes, she will hopefully earn more profits. These profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and enable her to start saving for the future of her children.

loans.use: To add different sizes of shoes for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia vive en la zona de Achumani, de la ciudad de La Paz.
Esta separada de su esposo  y tiene un hijo de 18 años que esta en la Universidad.
Se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza, hace 5 años.El crédito será utilizado en la compra de productos AVON y tambien ropa de mujer, para continuar son su negocio de venta al por menor.
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Julia lives in the Achumani neighborhood of the town of La Paz. She is separated from husband and has a 18 year-old son attending University. She has been engaging in buying and selling beauty products for 5 years. The loan will be used to buy AVON products as well as women’s’ clothes to keep on with her retail activity. This is the firth time she has requested a loan to Impro, and the third time she has asked Kiva for support, proving herself to be responsible with the repayments of her dues.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and women’s’ clothes.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita R. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old, single and has 1 school-aged child. Cristita owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables such as "kamunggay" and "kangkong" for sale. Cristita is just starting this business and has already earned 2,500 PHP.

In 2008, Cristita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda T.'s main source of income comes from planting and selling vegetables in her community. She is 54 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Lucban. Rosalinda has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be her 11th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: La Parota Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "La Parota" esta ubicado en Jantetelco, en el estado de Morelos, México y esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinas. La Señora Tita Gloria A. M. es integrante del grupo "La Parota" tiene 44 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria obteniendo su certificado, tiene 5 hijos, Bonifacio tiene 21 años y trabaja, Juan tiene 19 años ya se caso y trabaja, Antonio tiene 13 años estudia la secundaria, Gloria tiene 10 años estudia la primaria, Ana tiene 8 años estudia la primaria. Ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilos y cierres para tener material para su taller industrial ya que ella maquila le mandan de Tétela del volcán los uniformes ya cortados y ella los cose y les da el terminado ya que los tiene listos de Tétela del volcán viene a recogerlos a su casa de quince a veinte días les entrega los uniformes ya terminados los van a entregar a San Luis Potosí y México. Ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años inicio cosiendo en maquina de pedal ya después se compra sus maquinas industriales pago el 50% al contado y la otra mitad las fue pagando con los créditos que le han proporcionado, ella confecciona uniformes de escuela, uniformes de policía, chalecos antibala, antimotín, y sus clientes de Jantetelco les confecciona sus vestidos de bailables para la escuela. Las ganancias del negocio las utilizan en la comida de sus hijos, para pagar los prestamos, para invertir en hilos y cierres.
Las integrantes del grupo son la señora **Tita Gloria A. M. va a comprar con su préstamo hilos, cierres, telas, etc. para sus costuras y dar mejor servicio a sus clientes, **la señora Amelia E. Jayesi va a comprar juegos de mesa para poner su juegos de video, **la señora Maria Geomara E. Aragón va a comprar conejos, alfalfa para criarlos y venderlos, **la Señora Jhanet Gutiérrez V. va a comprar verdura, pan, carne para hamburguesas, teleras etc., para su negocio de antojitos Mexicanos, **La señora Martina H. P. va a comprar ropa interior para vender se dedica a la venta por catalogo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Que nos aumente el monto que nos prestan y nos bajen el interés para que nos ayuden a que crezcan los negocios”. A la señora Tita le ayudan a coser su hermana y su cuñado y le gustaría comprar otras 4 maquinas de cocer diferentes para realizar un trabajo con mejor terminado, el negocio es importante porque de ahí comemos y para mantener a sus hijos, su parte favorita de trabajar en el negocio es coser los uniformes y cuando le pagan, ella desea hacer un local mas grande para las maquina, sus sueños son ver a sus hijos grandes y que tengan su carrera. El pueblo de Jantetelco es un pueblo tranquilo, no hay problemas, elaboran dulce cristalizado, fruta de horno son galletitas tipo repostería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group, called La Parota, is located in Jantetelco, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It has 5 members who know each other and are neighbours. Miss Tita A. M. is a member of the La Parota group. She is 44 and studied up to high school, obtaining her certificate. She has 5 children: Bonifacio is 21 and works; Juan is 19, married and works; Antonio is 13 and in high school; Gloria is 10 and is in elementary school; and Ana is 8 and is in elementary school. Tita requested this loan for the purchase of thread and clasps to have material for her industrial workshop. She manufactures orders from Tétela del Volcán and takes pre-cut uniforms which she stitches and finishes up. Once they are ready, customers come from Tétela del Volcán to pick them up at her house. In 15 to 20 days she has finished uniforms for San Luis Potosí and México. She started her business 4 years ago, sewing on a pedal machine, and later she bought her industrial machines, paying 50% in cash. She has been paying the other half with loans that she has received. She makes school uniforms, police uniforms, bulletproof vests, and riot police uniforms. She makes clothing for school dances for her customers in Jantetelco. She uses her earnings for this business to feed her children, repay her loans, and invest in thread and clasps. The group members are Tita Gloria A. M., who will buy thread, clasps, fabric etc with her loan for her clothing, to provide better service; Amelia E. Jayesi, who will buy board games to put with her video games; Maria Geomara E. Aragón who will buy rabbits and alfalfa to raise and sell them; Jhanet Gutiérrez V., who will buy vegetables, bread, meat for hamburgers and teleras for her Mexican delicacy business; and Martina H. P., who will purchase underwear to sell through catalogues. The group m embers want to tell Kiva and Fundacion Realidad "to increase the amount you lend to us and lower our interest in order to help us expand our businesses". Tita's sister and brother-in-law help her to sew, and she would like to buy 4 other different machines to make better products. The business is important because this is how they eat and maintain their children. Her favourite part of working in this business is sewing the uniforms and getting paid. She wants to open a larger store for the machines. Her dreams are to see her children grown with careers. The village of Jantetelco is a peaceful village. There are no problems. They make crystallized candy and baked fruit which are small baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of thread, clasps, and fabrics for her clothes-making

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad;  La socia tiene  18 años de edad;  ella es soltera y tiene su pequeño negocio en Calca, La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella vende frutas en el mercado modelo de Calca desde hace 1 año y le va muy bien en esta ocasión le gustaría adquirir mayor porcentaje de frutas para tener mejores ganancias, ella es una joven muy emprendedora y pese a que no tuvo el apoyo de sus padres en cuanto a apoyarla a que estudie una profesión ella no renuncia a ese sueño. La socia ahora necesita el capital de trabajo para comprar mercadería de los proveedores de frutas.  

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Soledad, 18, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and has a small business in Calca.  She has been a fruit retailer in Calca’s Modelo Market for the last year.  She does very well and would like to acquire a larger amount of fruit in order to have better profits.

She is a very young entrepreneur and despite not having any support from her parents for her to study a profession she does not give up on that dream.

She is asking for funds to buy merchandise from fruit suppliers.

She is grateful for and appreciates the loan granted and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise from the fruit suppliers.

loans.name: Abasse

texts.en: Abasse is a 31-year-old father with two children. He sells clothes in Tyre. Since he can’t rely on this job the entire year, Abasse would like to start a new job selling phone lines for additional income. He needs a small loan from AlMajmoua. He taken a previous loan from AlMajmoua and has a good reputation.

loans.use: To start a new job selling phone lines

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración ladrillos de adobe y tejas. Inicio el oficio por su padre y estableció su propio taller hace ocho años. Luis tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, pues ha sido difícil ya que las ventas han bajado, pero esto no lo desanima a seguir luchando. Con este crédito que Luis solicita comprar lo necesario para invertir más en materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, el es un hombre muy responsable y está orgulloso de tener este negocio.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto’s business is making and selling adobe bricks and roof-tiles. He started this work because of his father and opened his own shop eight years ago. Luis provides for a young son, but it has been difficult because his sales have decreased. This does not discourage him from continuing to work hard.

Luis Alberto has worked with Fundación Leon for a long time, therefore this is not the first time he requests a loan. He will use this loan to buy raw materials to make the bricks and tiles. Luis Alberto is a responsible man and is very proud of his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a resident of Litein Town in Rift Valley, Kenya and has been doing mixed farming and selling her produce of tea and milk locally. She employs a farmhand and has seven children. 

She has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to improve her dairy production. She previously acquired a loan of 40,000 KES and paid it back. She hopes to generate better income to take good care of her family. She has no challenges in her business except for finances.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 49, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  N. weaves Cambodian traditional silk and sells fruit, earning an income of about $2.50 per day.  Her husband raises fish and grows rice, earning an income of $2 per day. 

N. has to spend $20 on food, $5 on electricity and water and $60 on other necessary expenses every month.  

N. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Some people tend to migrates to different places even abroad to seek for a greener pasture. There are people who earned a big amount and has an investment but there are some who are not successful and later they only found out the fortune that they looked for is in their own place. That’s what happened to Jocelyn M., one of the active members of ASHI Antique North Branch. She is from Caridad, Culasi, Antique Philippines, she is already 41 years old and a single businesswoman. She is living with her elder brother Johny M., a fisherman.

Before her life in ASHI, she was experienced work in another country. She doesn’t have any comment for her employer because they treat her as their family. Her salary was only enough for the needs of the family until she decided to go back here in Philippines without any savings. She decided to join ASHI last 2002.

At very start, she has been wise in utilizing her capital for her business, with her first loan in ASHI amounted to Php.5,000.00, she started to put a small variety store in their community. Little by little her business is improving and she earned it. Her income from this business really helps her to sustain her basic needs and to invest in some equipment like refrigerator and television.

As her loan increases, her project is also improving. Her variety store is expanding and she almost sell grocery items in there. She also put up small refreshment near her store. 

As of now she wanted to repair the store so that it is convenient and more comfortable to the costumers and she is now proposing Php.25,000.00 for her next loan to realize these dream. 

She is aspiring that someday, she will become financially stable so that she could also help her nephews and relatives.

loans.use: Refreshment and Variety Store

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Ciudad de Remancito Chaco. 
El comité se  encuentra en el primer ciclo y se encuentran trabajando de forma muy organizada y están con mucha responsabilidad. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Norma quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una zona muy humilde, y muy alejada de la zona urbana por lo que elije días para salir y recorrer para ofrecer sus productos. 
Comenta que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y que desea seguir creciendo. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos como shampoo, maquillajes, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women's Committee of the City of Remancito Chaco.

This committee is in its first loan cycle and its members are working together very responsibly and in a very organized way.  One of the group's members is Norma who sells cosmetics.  She lives in a very poor area which is located a long way from the urban area.  For this reason, she chooses days to go out and travel around offering her products for sale.  She comments that she works very hard and would like to continue growing her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics such as shampoo, make up, perfume, etc.

loans.use: To buy perfume, make up, etc.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley S. lives in the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old, married, has five school-aged children and makes a living by operating a small retail store where people buy items they need daily, such as shampoo, soap, food and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than 12 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaird three previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 9,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods and detergent, to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 37 years old and married. She supports her family by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (variety) store and fruit vending. She lives in Vallehermoso, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and fruit-vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 32 años es madre soltera, natural del distrito de Ayna San Francisco; es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada junto a sus 02 queridos hijos Marisol de 17 años y Liner de 14 años de edad. Lo que más desea en la vida es poder brindarles la mejor educación a sus hijos. El lugar más conocido y concurrido para comprar variedad de ropa es en un pequeño centro comercial llamado “Gamarrita”, es aquí donde Rayda tiene un puesto de venta. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes visitan continuamente su puesto, debido a los novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente de la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco. Lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que abre a las 08 de la mañana y trabaja hasta aproximadamente las 09 de la noche. Con el transcurso del tiempo, desea poner un negocio más grande, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy alegre y siempre esta poniendo las cuotas acordadas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de prendas de vestir es la que  tiene mayor demanda en la zona selvática de nuestro querido Perú.
texts.en:
Rayda, 32, is a single mother from Ayna San Francisco district; she’s an unassuming, hard working woman living in a rented house with her two beloved children, Marisol, 17, and Liner, 14.  What she most wants in life is to be able to provide her children a better education.

The best known and most popular place to buy assorted clothing is a small shopping center called “Gamarrita” which is where Rayda has a sales stand.  She tends to all her customers who visit her stand here kindly and courteously thanks to the novel items she brings personally from the city of Lima.

What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers on which items look best on them because she entertains herself a bit doing so.  She’s been in this line of work for four years and considers having to remain in her sales stand all day as the most difficult aspect of it because she opens at 8am and stays open until about 9pm.  In time she’d like to set up a larger business where she can provide better customer service.

This is her third loan with MFP and she knows that she must repay on time if she wants to be able to access future loans and is willing to do so.  She is a very cheerful member of her communal bank who always contributes the agreed upon contributions.

She will use the requested three thousand new soles to buy more clothes in the city of Lima, preferably summer clothes, since this is the type of clothing most in demand in the jungle area of our beloved Peru

loans.use: To buy summer clothes.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en:
Edna C. is from the village of Santo Domingo. She is 51 years old and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edna C..

Edna is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $138 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Edna is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase feed and medicine for the pigs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 04 Mars 1975 à Loutana Préfecture de Sikasso, Mariam T. est mariée et mère de 7 enfants et réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, cette femme s’est initiée depuis plus de dix années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment l’achat et la vente d’habillements (pagnes wax, sacs à main, tissus brodé, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre à sa place au marché de leur localité où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année.  Elle a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qui fut correctement remboursé. Ainsi, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 20 pièces de pagne wax, 15 complets de tissus brodé, 12 sacs à main, etc. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born March 4, 1975 in the Loutan Prefecture of Sikasso, Mariam T. is married with seven children and resides with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, an outlying district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After several unsuccessful activities, she started a small retail business some ten years ago buying and selling apparel (wax fabrics, handbags, embroidered fabrics, etc..). She buys her goods in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso) before reselling them at her emplacement in the local market, where her goods are in high demand by her customers.

Wanting to better serve her ever-increasing number of customers, she decided over a year ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. She was granted a first loan that was properly reimbursed. Now she is requesting a second loan to expand her business and purchase 20 pieces of pagne wax cloth (colourful West-African fabric), 15 complete sets of embroidered fabric, 12 handbags, etc…

She intends to achieve with this loan a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA which will be used mainly to increase her business, pay the interest on her loan and invest the rest in her activity.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Rodis Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Rodis” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mary C. is the leader of this group. Mary is a 37-seven-year-old, married with two children – one in primary school and one in secondary school. Mary sells palm oil, rice, peppers, onions, cooking oil, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing this business for 20 years now.  With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, peppers, onions, cooking oil, Maggi, etc. in large quantity.

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en: Ni Nengah T., 41, became chairman of the group Jaya Usaha Baluk, which has 10 members. She got a loan of 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) to buy four piglets. This type of pig is used for roasting and the price is 250,000 IDR per piglet. The pigs are fed for three months and ready to sell for 400,000 IDR. She chose this type of pig because they do not require special food and that can reduce costs. She has a dream to renovate her house with the profits gained from this business.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

loans.name: Comfort Araba

texts.en: Comfort Araba D. cooks food to sell in the community of Amoanda near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is a widow who takes care of three children and is responsible for the well-being of her family and home. Her loan will serve as additional capital to buy food items to cook for sale.  She hopes to invest the new profit into her children’s education. At the time of this visit, she had finished selling the food made for the day.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Deyre Rosana

texts.es:
Deyre de 30 años,  vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Su esposo trabaja como estibador y tienen un hijo de 4 años. Su actividad comercial es la lavandería y vende productos de bellezas.

Empezó vendiendo Avon (cosméticos por catálogos)  por medio de una hermana que la inscribió por medio de una necesidad que tenia lo realizo y le gusto también lava ropa a diferente personas como servicios y así tener ingresos para su familia. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere terminar de construir si vivienda comprando materiales de construcción tales como cemento arena bloque y baldosas. En un futuro quiere comprar otro solar y construir viviendas para alquilar y poner una mini tienda.
texts.en:
Deyre is 30 years old. She lives in an area in the outskirts of the city. Her husband works as a stevedore and they have a 4 year old son. Her business activity is doing laundry and selling beauty products.  

She started selling Avon (catalogue cosmetics) through her sister who signed her up because she needed work. She did it and she liked it. She also washes clothes for different people as a service, and she gets income for her family that way. With the help of the loan, she wants to finish building her home by buying comstruction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, and tiles. In the future, she wants to buy another house and build houses to rent, as well as open a little store.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home, such as cement, tile and sand.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a responsible mother who is 33 years old. She has a general store where she sells groceries like noodles, canned goods, snack foods and other products used daily. Mary Jane has operated this business for almost six years. 

Mary Jane is asking for a loan of 23,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional grocery items like frozen foods, canned goods and soft drinks. She usually earns about PHP 8,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Mary Jane hopes to strengthen the business she manages by increasing her product offering in order to earn a higher income to support the education of their children and to give them a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items like frozen foods, canned goods and soft drinks.

location.town: Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Sameiha

texts.en:
Sameiha is a 38-year-old wife and mother of two daughters and two sons. Sameiha's husband and oldest son, who appears in the picture instead of his conservative mother, work in the grocery store the family owns.

Sameiha took out a loan from FATEN to prepare the other half of the store to be used for more goods and grocery items for sale.

Sameiha's daughters and sons are school students.

loans.use: to expand the space of the store to display more goods.

loans.name: José Ronaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. José Ronaldo es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un señor luchador que trabaja en conjunto con su esposa e hijos en su negocio el cual consiste en adquirir cerdos en pie para luego comercializar la carne, elaborar frito, chicharrones, cabe señalar que esta actividad la realiza en su casa de habitación contando su propio medio para salir en busca de cerdos en las diferentes comarcas aledañas al municipio.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, construir su propia vivienda y adquirir sus bienes, también ha procurado satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes vendiendo un buen producto. Una de las necesidades que tiene este señor es contar con más capital para adquirir más cerdos para comercializarlos y así ganar más clientes, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de tales clientes.
texts.en:
José Ronaldo comes from the town of El Sauce.  He is a hard-working man who works together with his wife and children in his business which consists of acquiring live pigs, selling their meat and making fried food and 'chicharrones' (fried pork rinds).  José carries out this business from his home and travels to neighboring regions to find pigs to buy.

José has been in this business for many years and it has enabled him to get his family ahead in life, build his own home and acquire goods.  He has also tried to satisfy his customers' demands by selling a good product.  One of the needs that he has is to have more capital available so that he can acquire more pigs to sell and thereby gain more customers.  For this reason, he decided to request his third loan from Ceprodel with the aim of meeting his customer demand.

loans.use: to buy four pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, aged 42, is a widower who has two children aged 19 and 13 years old. He does farming and has been doing this for 10 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 21,200.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD and he has a good credit history. He will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production. He intends to use the anticipated profits to plant nappier grass on his farm.  He hopes to educate his children and be a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milk production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married with 4 children living in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. For 2 years, he has been dealing in crop farming. He started with 1 acre, but now he farms on 4 acres of land and his dream is to farm on at least 50 acres of land. His major challenge is high operational costs and his vision is to shift to mechanized farming after he acquires enough land. Joseph intends to use the loan facility to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase land for extensive farming

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Miguel es cliente nuevo que vive en la zona de chasquipampa a una cuadra y media de la institución, vive con su esposa y su hijo que se encuentra estudiando, el Sr. Miguel se dedica desde hace bastante tiempo en elaboración de juegos y experimentos educativos, con su trabajo a participado también en ideas emprendedoras en Bolivia, también tiene su pagina web llamada ciencia fácil, por lo que se hace conocer y tiene pedidos del exterior y se promociona en colegios y universidades para la elaboración de sus productos tiene robots que el creo  y experimentos de todo tipo los cuales pudimos ver, sus experimentos los acompaña con material reciclable utiliza motores, censores de luz y otro tipo de materiales experimentales por otro lado su esposa trabaja como agente de seguros. El préstamo lo requiere para la compra de accesorios ya que tiene un pedido por mayor razón por el cual se solicita el financiamiento Kiva.
texts.en: Miguel is a new client who lives in the Chasquipampa neighborhood, a block and a half away from the institution.  He lives with his wife and their child, who is in school.  For quite some time, Miguel has been making educational games and experiments.  With his work he has also participated in entrepreneurial efforts in Bolivia. He has his own website called "Easy Science," where people can find out about his business and where he can take orders from outside the country.  He is promoting his products at schools and universities.  In order to make his products, he has robots that he creates, and we could see that he has all types of experiments.  His experiments come with recyclable materials and they use motors, light censors and other types of experimental materials.  Also, his wife works as an insurance agent.  He needs a loan to buy accessories, since he has an order which is the main reason why he is requesting this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy accessories and materials for an experiment

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar is 45 years old and married. He has two children. 

He is a small entrepreneur who sells a variety of items like soap, shampoo, tooth paste, shaving cream, washing powder and many others items. Etibar's family is actively involved in helping with the business. 

Etibar currently has about 1,000 AZN in inventory, and his monthly net profit is about $180 USD.  

Etibar is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to become a successful entrepreneur. 

Etibar's main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they'll become successful entrepreneurs themselves.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Alan Oswaldo

texts.es:
Alan Oswaldo es un joven estudiante de 31 años, de la carrera de Administración Bancaria soltero natural de Lima, para poder sustentar sus estudios trabaja en una fabrica de tubos pvc en la área de asesoria de ventas, una de sus metas es trabajar en su propia empresa.
Alan Oswaldo nos cuenta que las personas que le inspiran es su madre y hermana ellas han logrado desenvolverse en la vida trabajando en sus propios negocios.
Muchas veces ha tenido que estudiar hasta altas horas de la noche, para poder terminar los trabajos y estudiar para obtener becas en el instituto, con la finalidad de disminuir la pensión del mismo y ser uno de los mejores alumnos.
Con el préstamo otorgado se encuentra muy agradecido, ya que es una gran ayuda para que pueda terminar sus estudios. en el futuro tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Alan is a 31-year-old student majoring in Banking Administration.  He’s single and from Lima.  To afford to pay for his studies he works in the sales department of a PVC tube factory.  One of his goals is to have his own company, to finish his studies and graduate from the university.

Alan tells us that the people who inspire him are his mother and sister because without having formal education they’ve managed to develop in life working in their own businesses.

“Often times I’ve had to study until very late at night to finish my assignments and to study in order to win scholarships in the institute to reduce tuition costs and be one of my classroom’s best students.”

Alan is very grateful for the granted loan because it’s of great help for him to be able to complete his studies.

loans.use: to pay fourth cycle tuition.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosa has a food shop or "carenderia" that sells viands like chicken & pork "adobo" & "halang-halang". She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands to sell.

Rosa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands to sell.

loans.name: Immamverdi

texts.en:
Immamverdi is a married father of three children. He lives with his family the village of Agsu, where he runs a small downtown store where he sells home products. Immamverdi 's store is well-known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many of his customers go shopping after they are done with their work. Immamverdi has been in this business for eight years and has good client history. 

Immamverdi is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase merchandise to increase the variety of his products. He has had some struggles as his business was growing and becoming sustainable, but he has handled these challenges well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en: Wallace is a married man and is 34 years old. He describes himself as a focused businessman. He has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. He faces a major challenge of competition, but he has retained his customers because of his good reputation. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Shawqi

texts.en:
Shawqi is a young man, 18 years old. He has a studio for a sound system. He wants to improve his work and purchase new sound system items such as speakers, etc., but he doesn't have enough money to pay. He needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Shawqi gets his loan, he will be able to purchase new sound system items that will help him to improve the quality of his work and increase customer demand. He will increase his income and have better living conditions. 

Shawqi is in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase new sound system items.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
An industrious farmer, Alfredo is a father of three children. All of them are now adults and have their own families. Right now, he is cultivating his corn farm to improve their poor living. At his age, he also feels pain in his body when he works a lot but seeing his family depending on him gives him more strength to work harder. 

Now, Alfredo is asking for the loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn (bio-seed), fertilizers and pay for the laborers that help him plant corn in his farm. He would like to monitor carefully his crops in order to get a higher net income for the coming harvesting time. He hopes for the success of his farming in order to have a comfortable lifestyle as well as to help lift his family from the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy corn (bio-seed), fertilizers and pay for laborers that help him plant corn.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula, tiene 55 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo soltero de 30 años de edad, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
La actividad económica de Doña Paula es la elaboración de pan de coco el cual es elaborado a base de la leche del cocotero. El pan de coco es un producto tradicional propio de la cultura garífuna y es la base alimenticia de dicha etnia.
Ella comenzó su negocio a través de un grupo de mujeres que elaboraban pan para generación de ingresos, posteriormente el grupo se desintegro y ella decidió continuar con la producción y venta del producto en vista de que las ganancias que obtenía eran atractivas. 
Actualmente ella ha logrado la contratación de dos personas empleadas que le apoyan en la distribución del pan.
Dona Paula ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de una estufa con horno grande e insumos como: cocos, harina, azúcar, margarina, además utensilios de cocina que le facilitaran la elaboración del producto. 
A futuro ella planea utilizar sus ganancias para ampliar su negocio y hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Paula, 55, lives in a common law relationship with her husband.  She has a 30-year-old, single son.  She lives in a community in the Municipality of Tela, Atlántida.

Paula’s economic activity is baking ‘pan de coco’ bread which is made based on coconut milk.  The ‘pan de coco’ is a traditional product typical of the Garífuna culture and is this ethnic group’s main food staple.

She started this business through a group of women who baked bread to generate income.  Later, the group disbanded and she decided to continue producing and selling the product because the profits she obtained were attractive.  At present, she hires two people to help her distribute the bread.

Paula has requested a loan to buy a stove with a large oven and to buy supplies like coconuts, flour, sugar and margarine as well as kitchen utensils that will facilitate production.  In the future, she plans to use profits to expand the business and do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy a stove, supplies and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jitahidi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jitahidi Group in Western Kenya! Frida is the facilitator of the Jitahidi group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Frida  takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Frida had a very good maize yield, harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Frida was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Frida  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Frida will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jitahidi group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Frida and her group with the field officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a thirty-four-year-old enterprising business lady.  She is married to Joseph who is a farmer.  They are blessed with two children aged seven and five years old.  She has been running a green grocer business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Ann will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits and add more stock to her green grocery business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will rent a house to conduct her business. 

She hopes to open a retail shop which will improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more green vegetables and fruits to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn and dye to weave.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera, 42, is the mother of six sons and three daughters. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary.
 
Sameera has a sewing workshop and wants to improve the quality of her work by purchasing a new sewing kit. Since the income she gets from her workshop is low and is not enough to cover the purchase of a new sewing kit, Sameera needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Sameera gets the loan, she will be able to cover the amount of purchasing a new sewing kit and that will help her to improve the quality of her work positively. This will lead to an increase in her sales and her income, so she will create better living conditions for her family. 

Sameera and her son Qassam are photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing kit.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married to Leonard and they have four children. She has been selling fish for the last 15 years, earning her a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET Ltd. of 30,000 KES which she intends to use to purchase more fish for sale. She plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profits from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a first-time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd., having been inspired by a repeat client. She is married and a mother of three children. Jane is a tailor and a resident of Bweyogerere. She has applied for for a loan of 500,000 UGX to boost her business. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her.

loans.use: to add in business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Many people in Siongiroi are poor and most of them find an opportunity in farming to make a living and progress through practicing mixed farming. Such is the case of Richard who, at the age of 35, has gone through many adversities but has always put on a brave face. 
For the past ten years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. 

Richard passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and buy another quality breed of dairy cow. The dairy unit will assist Richard in managing his cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions. Richard also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and through this loan she will be making more money. 

For Richard, nothing is impossible. He wants to continue working to fulfill his dream of becoming the lead supplier of milk in his village.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit and buy another cow

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmita has been selling cosmetics for more than 8 years. She began doing this when a neighbor became a distributor and provided goods for the local community to sell. Her husband gave her $100 in capital in order to get her started. Her business is doing quite well as she already has over 50 clients that purchase regularly. She needs the loan so she may be able to invest in a larger quantity of cosmetics at wholesale prices.

Carmita is 29 years old and has 5 children. It has been difficult for her and her husband to provide the basic necessities for the kids. Thanks to this business, she has been able to make it through some very hard times. Her goal is to make a section of her home into shop for her products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan so she may be able to invest in a larger quantity of cosmetics at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Claudia Verónica

texts.en:
Claudia is 42 years old, has two children of which the eldest is married and the youngest is still in school. Her husband's income is small, which is why she started selling tacos three years ago, hoping for a better quality of life and a good education for her son. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 for the purchase of ingredients needed for making her products.

Claudia is confident that she will soon be able to expand her business and help support her family, and extends her thanks for your generosity and your human compassion to reach out to support those that need it most.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Claudia tiene 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de los cuales la mayor es casada y el menor continua estudiando. Los ingresos que recibe su esposo son muy bajos, por lo que ella comenzó a vender tacos de vapor hace tres años, en busca de un mejor nivel de vida y una buena educación para su hijo. Ella solicita un crédito por la cantidad de $250 dólares para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de su comida.

Claudia confía en que pronto lograra hacer crecer su negocio y apoyar a su familia, y agradece tu generosidad y calidez humana para apoyar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Zuleya Amoit

texts.en: Zuleya is an active member of PEMCI. She has successfully finished her first loan.  Her first loan enabled her to increase and expand her retail shop. She has also started another business of selling cereals.  All her businesses are located at the community’s trading centre. She is a member of the local mosque’s women's group, which deals with enlightening women on their rights. She has been in business since 1988, thus she has gained quite an experience. With another loan from PEMCI, Zuleya wishes to increase her businesses’ stock further in order to meet her customers' demand. Through her business, she has been able to support her husband who is also a businessman, and meet their family’s needs. She has also been able to bring services closer to the community and also contribute fully to her community’s women group. She has been an inspiration to other women in the community.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina A., second from right, wants to open a barber shop in Bayaguana.  Josefina is pictured here with the four other members of her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. Josefina will use her portion of the loan to buy materials to start up her barber shop.  Her business will help her support her four-year-old daughter Jaqui.

loans.use: To open a barber shop

loans.name: Fonofaavae

texts.en:
Fonofaavae F. is a woman of forty-six years of age. She’s married with six kids and all of them depend on her for survival. In order to earn her living, Fonofaavae owns a small business of “elei printing.” She’s being doing this for years and she says she is able to earn enough money so that she and her family can depend on it.

Fonofaavae delivers her products to various shops in town and within her own area. She appreciates the help of S.P.B.D, lending her the money so that she can develop her business in order to gain more income from it. She is also thankful for her husband's and kids' support since they help out with her production during their free time.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for textile printing

loans.name: Abdukohir

texts.ru:
Abdukohir K. is 26 years old, he is single and has a secondary education. He has been selling food for 3 years. Since childhood he has helped his mother in her business in order to support the family’s standard of living. Later, he used local illegal creditors to get loans at high interest rates, which did not help in increasing his inventory.

Abdukohir became a client of MicroInvest in 2006 and borrowed $600. Gradual borrowing and reliability allowed him to increase his inventory, to purchase products for cash and to save for study at the University. In the future, Abdukohir plans to transition to wholesaling.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каландаров Абдукохир- 26 лет .Холост, образование среднее. Вот уже три года занимается продажей продуктами питания. С детства помогал маме в торговле для поддержания уровня жизни. Позже становясь совершеннолетним начал кредитоваться у местных нелегальных кредиторов под большие проценты, что не способствовало увеличить товарооборот. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест в 2006 –ом году с активами на 600 долларов. Шаговое кредитование и ответственность перед программой МЗФ позволило ему увеличить товарооборот, приобретать товар за наличные и накопить на учебу в Университете. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: to transition to wholesaling and save up for study in University

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 47-year-old widow and a mother of 5, who lives in the Shibiri area in Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1997, she has had a business selling building materials, such as gravel and sand.

She requests a loan of $450 to buy more gravel and sand to sell.

loans.use: Buy sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov has a general retail business selling small items and souvenirs from a little stand at a market near the train station in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has much experience as an entrepreneur having been in business for over twelve years. Previously, Lubov served in the military and is now retired. In addition to her business activities, she is also on the town council in Melitopol. Lubov is divorced and has one son whom she is helping obtain a college education.

Lubov has requested an eight month loan of $1000 to increase her available business capital. She hopes to continue developing and growing her business so that it will be able to meet her financial needs in the future.

loans.use: Increase business capital for her souvenir stand

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro lives in a house he owns on Inca Roca street in the area of Tacagua in the city of La Paz. He is 77 years old and has been a client of ours since 1999. He has used eleven loans with Impro and the business he runs is that of carpentry. He makes furniture by request, which is how he supports his needs since he does not have any other form of income. His preceding record qualifies him as a good client, thus giving him access to a new line of credit. All of his past loans have been paid fully and according to the dates established.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Genaro vive en casa propia en la calle Inca Roca de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 77 años de edad y es cliente nuestro desde el año 1999; lleva once créditos con Impro y la actividad que realiza es la de carpintería: elabora muebles a pedido con lo cual sustenta sus necesidades ya que no tiene otro ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de material (Madera, Clefa, etc). Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Todos los créditos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad y de acuerdo a las fechas establecidas.

loans.use: Purchasing materials (wood and others) for his carpentry business

loans.name: Atinuke

texts.en: Atinuke A. is 48 years old, divorced, and has three children. She comes from Shibiri in Lagos State in Nigeria. She has a shop in which she sells clothing, things for babies, and also drinks. She has been in business since 1985. She needs a loan of $700.00 so that she can buy more stock of clothes, baby things, and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, baby things, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Capital, primarily to stock their businesses

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa works tirelessly out of her own home washing clothes for a living, which allows her to provide the best to her loving family. Her 5 children are all of the motivation she needs to work so arduously. She washes clothes almost the entire day, taking only very short breaks to rest. Her good work and dedication have made her popular, resulting in a greater demand for her work. Rosa is asking for a loan that she will use for two purposes; one of which to be able to buy larger washing tubs and more detergent, and the other to contribute to the expenses to repair tools that her loving husband uses for his job.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa, trabaja incansablemente en su propia casa ofreciendo el servicio de lavado de ropa y a través de el otorgarle lo mejor a su amada familia, sus 5 hijos son toda la motivación necesaria para su ardua tarea. Lava casi todo el día teniendo pausas muy cortas para descansar, su buen trabajo y dedicación le han otorgado popularidad y ahora tiene mayor demanda. Doña Rosa solicita un préstamo con dos fines, el de poder comprar tinas más grandes y detergente en mayor cantidad y a la vez contribuir con el gasto de reparación de la herramienta de trabajo de su amado esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of washing tubs and detergent.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. lives in the town of Igbelerin, in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells hair products and hair pieces for a living, and also does manicures and pedicures. She spent two years studying this trade before going into business on her own in 2006. Patience is 30 years old, married and has five children. She needs a loan of $1,200 to buy products and hairpieces to sell to her customers, and wishes to extend her thanks to Kiva and to her lenders.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adelia Judith

texts.es:
Adelia belongs to the Valiant Women Communal Bank located on Jr Coronel Portillo 836 in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of six. Her husband is a forrestry engineer, but their income isn't sufficient to support their family. With the first loan Adelia received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business selling beauty products. Currently, she still sells beauty products and gets up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her family, then distributes and collects her products for clients until 4pm. Wit this loan of $600, which she will repay in four months, she will buy perfumes, powders, deodorants, lipsticks, blushes, jewelry, watches, wallets, etc. Adelia is very happy that her business is growing and she is providing for her family. She is very thankful for the immense support that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adelia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 836, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 44 años y es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es Técnico Forestal, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no son suficientes para el sustento familiar, es así que Adelia con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dirige a repartir y cobrar sus productos a sus clientes hasta las 4 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro perfumes, talcos, desodorantes, labiales, sombras, rubores, joyas, relojes, carteras, etc. Adelia se encuentra muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo y esta dando buenos frutos para beneficio D. su familia. Esta muy agradecida por el inmenso apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos

loans.use: To purchase various beauty products.

loans.name: María Ema

texts.es:
María is 33 years old and mother to three beautiful children. They are the reason she works so hard along with her husband Pedro, who has always been her greatest support. María has a small sawmill, where they work with the wood that her husband chops down, making it into parquet and other flooring which they sell in the region, as well as exporting to the capital. They have been doing this for 2 years, due to the fact that her husband gets the wood in its raw state so that Maria can work with it. She only does this for half of the day, as she also has to look after the children, and she loves her work as it is so profitable. Her motivation is supporting her husband, helping him to pay the family bills and pay for the childrens' education. The loan María is requesting is to expand her small sawmill or rent a premises to avoid problems with the neighbours, as her business is currently run from home. In the future, she wants to also raise chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

María, a sus 33 años es madre de tres niños preciosos, quienes son la razón de seguir surgiendo junto a su esposo Pedro, quien siempre la apoya en todo. María tiene un mini aserradero, trabajan con la madera que su esposo trae, convirtiendo el mismo en parque y traslapados que lo venden dentro de la región, sí como también exportan a la capital para su uso debido. Se dedican a esta actividad hace 2 años, a consecuencia de que su esposo es quien brinda la madera rolliza para que María la trabaje. Solo lo hace medio día, para luego atender a sus hijos, y le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le es rentable. Su motivación es apoyar a su esposos con los gastos familiares y la educación de sus niños. El préstamo que solicita María es porque quiere ampliar su mini aserradero o de lo contrario alquilar un local para evitar problemas a sus vecinos, puesto que su negocio funciona en su domicilio, más adelante quiere dedicarse a la crianza de pollos.

loans.use: To create a suitable space for her sawmill, so that she doesn't bother the neighbours.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 59 años, está separada D. su esposo y vive con su hijo Dante D. 25 años.
Se dedica al negocio D. moler cereales en su propio molino, ella convierte en harina; el trigo, la quinua, el chuño, el morón, etc. Lo más difícil es moler el chuño (papa seca) que es muy duro y requiere mucho más esfuerzo, pero a pesar D. las pequeñas dificultades Juana es feliz haciendo su trabajo.Independientemente a su molino tiene una tienda D. comestibles, en la cual también ofrece los productos que muele en el molino.Se ocupa la mayor parte del día en sus dos negocios, a los cuales ya le ha dedicado 17 años D. su vida.
Juana quiere que su hijo Dante, tenga en sus negocios una seguridad y estabilidad económica.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprara más cereales, tubérculos, etc. para moler, así como también productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old; she is separated from her husband and lives with her son, Dante, who is 25. Her business is that of grinding cereals, and does so using her own mill. She converts flour, wheat, 'quinua', 'chuño', 'morón', etc. The hardest to grind is 'chuño' (dried potato), which is very hard and requires more effort. However, despite the small difficulties, Juana is happy doing her job. In addition to her mill, she has a grocery store, where she also offers products that she grinds at her mill. She spends most of her day tending to these two businesses, which she's devoted 17 years of her life to. Juana wants her son, Dante, to maintain job security and financial stability in these businesses. With the loan money, she will purchase more cereals, tubers, etc. to grind in addition to more products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire necessary tubers to convert into flour, in addition to stocking her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. is 32 years old, divorced and the mother of four children, all of whom are currently in school.  Mary is a food vendor and makes a living preparing waakye (a dish made with cooked brown rice and beans, eaten with vegetable sauce) for school children and workers in her neighborhood. She has been selling rice and stew for seven years and needs to buy more bags of rice and vegetables to avoid price hikes for these commodities. She hopes to used the increased income made possible by this loan to save for her children's future. She is a member of the group called Nyame Mma, or God's Chindren. Members agree to guarantee each other's commitment to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, frozen fish and vegetables

loans.name: Thi Quy Nguyen Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Quý, sinh năm 1952 ( Ms 05030019 ), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng bán quà lưu niệm. Cô sống cùng chồng và các con tại Thôn Hội Phụ, Đông Anh, Hà Nội. Hàng ngày chồng và các con cô đi làm có thu nhập giúp gia đình trang trải cuộc sống. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 4.500.000 vnd / tháng. Bản cô là người chịu khó, ngoài bán hàng , những lúc rảnh rỗi, gia đình chị còn có nghề làm chổi tre để bán. Trong nhóm vay vốn, cô là người lớn tuổi nhất và là nhms trưởng nhóm vay vốn. Trong nhóm cô còn có: 
Nguyễn Thị Nhiên, sinh năm 1963 ( Ms 05030016 ), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng.
Phạm Thị Băng, sinh năm 1965 ( Ms 05030014 ), tham gia vay vốn mức: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư mua lá rong về gói bánh trưng để bán. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnd/ tháng.
Phạm Thị Hưng, sinh năm 1968 ( Ms 05030015), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán chổi tre. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ / tháng.
Lý Thị Mai, sinh năm 1977 ( Ms 05030018 ), tham gia vay vốn mức: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ bán chổi tre.
Chử Thị Minh Khánh, sinh năm 1976 ( Ms 05030020 ), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh cửa hàng giải khát. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 3.500.000 vnđ/ tháng.

loans.use: buôn bán nhỏ

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Vivant dans la maison de son défunt époux avec ses enfants (3 garçons et 1 fille), à Mancourani Natien, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) Madame Sali C. est une veuve de 59 ans qui n’a pas fréquenté l’école comme la plupart des femmes de sa génération.
Très tôt elle s’initie aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment l’achat et vente de poissons séchés du Sénégal communement appelé “Yayi Boyi” il y’a maintenant 20 ans.
Le Yayi Boyi est un poisson très prisé qui rentre dans la prépration des plats alimentaires en Afrique de l’Ouest. En plus de l’activité première d’achat et de vente de “Yayi Boyi”, elle mène également l’activité d’achat et de vente de l’encens.
Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée et appréciée grâce à la qualité de ses produits.
