Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle decida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant  seulement cinq  mois et est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce premier prêt:, 4 tonnes de poissons séchés“Yayi Boyi” à Dakar (répulique du Sénégal) auprès des commerçants grossistes sur commande.
Elles effectuent ses ventes au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes (citadines et surtout des foraines) 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sali C. is a 59-year-old widow who, like many women of her generation, did not attend school. She lives in the house of her late husband with their children (three boys and one girl) in Mancourani Natien, a busy neighborhood of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali’s third administrative region). From a very young age she became involved in income-generating businesses, particularly the buying and selling of dried fish from Senegal commonly known as “yayi boyi.” She has been doing this for 20 years now. Yayi boyi is a very prized fish which is used in West African cuisine. In addition to her main business of buying and selling “yayi boyi,” she runs a business buying and selling incense. She operates out of Sikasso’s main market where she is much in demand and appreciated due to the quality of her products. To satisfy her ever-increasing clientele, she decided, just five months ago, to rejoin the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is on her first individual loan. She plans to use this first loan to buy 4 metric tons of "yayi boyi" dried fish in Dakar (Senegal) from wholesalers who sell to order. She makes her own sales for cash or on credit to a clientele made up of women (from the city and especially stall holders). She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 100,000 which will mainly be used to increase her working capital, contribute towards the family expenses and pay the interest on the loan. The remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried fish called “YAYI BOYI”.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang T. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Tuy Mak, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to cultivate rice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Leang T. decided to ask for a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the field. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan.

She is 34 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es: Apolinario tiene 30 años de edad, con una convivencia de 9 años con su pareja, de los cuales tienen 3 hijos y una casa propia en su pueblo, cerca de su chacra. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al labrado de la tierra, con sumo cuidado cultivó sus plantas prestándole los cuidados necesarios para que fructifiquen sus cítricos, ahora se ha propuesto sembrar café en dos cuadras y media. Cuando no hay trabajo que realizar en sus tierras, trabaja en chacras ajenas, por las que le pagan diario 15 soles, dinero que le sirve para la subsistencia de su hogar. Apolinario es un hombre muy activo, no le gusta estar sin trabajo, tiene muchas ganas de progresar y ahora está muy contento porque ya le toca cosechar plátanos de isla, tiene que preparar de 80 a 100 arrobas, que es igual a 12 kilos en el mercado. Pero para que pueda cosechar buenos frutos de este producto requiere mucha inversión de dinero y tiempo, por ello tiene que fumigar cada 20 días a los plantones de plátano, y otro tanto, tiene que ir abonando para que la tierra empobrecida pueda brotar con buenos frutos y bien sazonados como lo cotiza el mercado. Apolinario es uno de los socios que no falla a las reuniones programadas por el analista de crédito, todo este tiempo ha pagado en la fecha indicada su crédito, y esta es la segunda vez que MFP le viene facilitando un préstamo, por lo cual está muy agradecido. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de abonos para su chacra de plátanos, asimismo, adquirirá insecticidas, y considera que quizás le falte algo de dinero para comprar todo lo necesario para su chacra.
texts.en:
Apolinario, 30, lives with his partner of 9 years and their 3 children in a house near his farm. He's worked on farms since he was a young boy, carefully tending his fields so that they would provide a bounty of the citrus fruits that he cultivates. He now wants to grow coffee on two and a half "cuadras". When there's not enough work to keep him busy on his own farm, he does farm work for others at 15 soles--about US$5--a day, money that is needed to pay the family's basic expenses. Apolinario is an active man and he doesn't like to be without work. He very much wants to get ahead and he's happy because he'll next harvest 80 to 100 "arrobas"--a local unit of measure--or roughly 12 kilograms of platanos for sale in the market. Growing platanos, though, requires a large investment of both time and money. The plants have to be sprayed every 20 days and the fields have to be fertilized so that the poor soil might produce the kind of fruit required by the market. Apolinario is among those who never fails to miss a meeting with his credit analyst. This is his second MFP loan and he always paid on the dates required by his past loan. He's very grateful for the loans. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his platanos fields. He will also buy insecticides and other things that he needs for the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide for farming business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Flora M. from Mwanza. She is married. Flora has been running a tailoring business since 2003. Her business is purchasing vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and making them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Flora currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy materials for making clothes. In the future, she plans to purchase another sewing machine. Flora thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Adiara

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle   Adiara    Samaké   est âgé de 19 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant, elle  vit chez son oncle maternelle au quartier Bougoufié de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonné l’école pour faire le commerce auprès d’une de ses tantes qui faisait le commerce entre la république du Togo et la république du Mali, Adiara après des années d’apprentissage fut imprégnée des tenants et aboutissants des activités commerciales. Forte de cette expérience empirique elle évolue seule avec pour créneau la lingerie sous toutes ses formes,  depuis 5 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’une grande réputation dans la capitale du Balanzan Ségou.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, elle décida de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes brodés en république du Togo.
Mademoiselle   Adiara    Samaké vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 FCFA qui servira à renforcer son fonds de commerce et  faire face à ses propres besoins. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Adiara Samaké, age 19, is unmarried and a mother with a child. She lives at her maternal uncle’s place in the Bougoufié district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having abandoned school early on, so as to do commerce with one of her aunts, who used to do commerce between the Republic of Togo and the Republic of Mali, Adiara immersed herself in every aspect of business for a few years as an apprentice. Solid in this empirical experience, she herself developed her business five years ago in the niche domain of lingerie of all types. And she enjoys a large customer base and a great reputation in the capital Balanzan Ségou.

With plans to increase her working capital in order to cope with customer demand, she decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan and plans to use it to buy 30 lengths of embroidered pagnes in the Republic of Togo. She sells to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA for bolstering her capital and for addressing her own needs. Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur réside dans le quartier d’Ablogame, il est marié et père de 01 enfant. Il a pour activité le commerce d’appareils electro ménagers tels que la télévision, les fers à repasser, les frigos. Son stock de marchandises est pratiquement épuisé, aussi il souhaite associé à ce commerce la vente de cartes de recharge. Voulant rehausser son stock afin de réaliser de meilleurs bénéfices et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, monsieur kokou N. sollicite de WAGES un crédit, pour s’approvisionner et commencer le commerce de carte de recharge avec 50 cartes MOOV et 50 cartes TOGOCEL.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who reside in the Ablogame district. He is married and the father of one child. His work involves commerce in household appliances, such as televisions, irons, and refrigerators. His stock of merchandise is practically exhausted, and he would like to include into this business the sale of recharge mobile phone cards. Wanting to replenish his stock, so as to realize better profits and to provide for his family better, he's requesting a loan from WAGES. It will be used to stock up and to begin commerce in recharge phone cards with 50 MOOV cards and 50 TOGOCEL cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household products and mobile phone cards

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
P. Françoise est née le 02/03/1956 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Françoise est mariée à KPATINKPO Eusèbe, un retraité des Chemins de fer. Françoise a cinq (5) enfants tous scolarisés. Françoise est couturière de formation; mais elle n'a exercé ce métier que jusqu'en 1979. Actuellement,
Françoise achète et revend des tissus au grand marché international de Bénin. Françoise vend aussi divers articles de grande consommation: bombons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc. Françoise a eu déjà deux crédits de ALIDé, grâce auxquels elle a pu apporter un changement qualitatif et quantitatif dans son activité. Françoise a pour projet d'augmenter le niveau de son commerce. Françoise compte aussi diversifier son activité à la vente de charbon de bois. C'est pour toutes ces raisons que Françoise sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Françoise P. was born on March 2, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Françoise is married to Eusèbe Kpatinkpo, who is retired from railroad work. Françoise has 5 children, all in school. She is a trained seamstress but she only practiced that trade until 1979. <> Presently, Françoise buys and sells cloth in the big international market of Bénin. Françoise also sells staples such as candy, sweet biscuits, tins of milk, sardines, and tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergents and dish detergents, toilet soap, etc. Françoise has already received two loans from ALIDé, thanks to which she was able to change her little business in qualitative and quantitative ways. Her goal is to raise the level of her business. She also intends to diversify her business by selling charcoal. For all these reasons, Françoise is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language, Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing sacks of maize, sacks of charcoal, and sacks of rice

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Mrs. Angelina H., 44 years old, is married to Celso H.. They are blessed with two children and presently reside at Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. The couple are both members of Paglaum Coop. She is a member under the micro finance program and her husband is a regular member also. She has an existing Sari-sari store but she needs additional capital to have more stock. She requests a loan amounting to PHP 7,000.00 for additional stock. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. She dreams of making an extension to her store and repairing their house. She dreams also that someday her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy more items for her store

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has three children, a son and two daughters. She says all are currently in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband works at the local hospital.

Joyce is a food vendor. She prepares and sells ‘gari’. Gari is a carbohydrate supplement, from cassava dough. The squeezed dough is fried in a hot metal pan over a strong fire. Gari is eaten with cooked beans. It is also eaten raw with roasted groundnut and sugar. She supplies to retailers and food vendors. Joyce has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure cassava in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To buy cassava in bulk

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen S., 39, is from the town of Plaridel. She is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Ellen owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns ~2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ellen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. Ellen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice D. sells clothing and fabrics. She is married and has two dependents. She is responsible for paying school fees and other domestic responsibilities. She has received a primary education.

Rejoice has been selling clothing since 2004. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to yield more profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her vegetable-growing business

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie C.'s dream for her children is for them to finish a degree. She is 29 years old and married to Norberto C., a rice farmer in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. Now, they are renting a 4-hectare farm. Someday, she said, they will be able to buy their own farm to support the growing needs of their family.

Norie would like to ask a loan of Php 5,000. She will use the loan purchase herbicides and fertilizers. By making this move, she thinks she will have better yield now than she did with her previous harvest.

Through CEVI, Norie has been able to sustain her livelihood up to now. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es un hombre de 28 años, vive solo en una habitación alquilada, no tiene hijos y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Endulzando la vida de sus clientes con sus ricos chocolates, Wilfredo pasa sus días. Sentado en una banquita realiza sus ventas diarias, pues tiene un pequeño puesto, en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Ya son 3 años los que lleva con este negocio y siente que ya es hora de crecer. Wilfredo siempre saca unos chocolates de su puesto, para comérselos mientras trabaja, a él le gusta bromear con sus clientes y es muy amable y divertido. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender sin miedo a que llegue la lluvia, ya que la temporada más difícil porque no vende mucho. Este es el segundo préstamo al que Wilfredo tiene la oportunidad de acceder en MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, él es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar más chocolates, así incrementará la cantidad de productos que tiene en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a man of 28 years who lives alone in a rented room, does not have children, and wants above all to move ahead. Sweetening the lives of his clients with his rich chocolates, Wilfredo passes his days. Seated on a bench he undertakes his daily sales; he has a small location in the Santa Barbara market (the most important market of the city of Juliaca). It's now 3 years that he carries on this business and he feels it is time to expand. Wilfredo always takes a few chocolates from his location to eat himself while he works. He likes to joke with his clients and is very friendly and entertaining. For the future he wants to have a sweets store where he can sell without fear of the rain arriving, since that is the most difficult season because he doesn't sell much. This is the second loan which Wilfredo has the opportunity of accessing from MFP and he feels capable of making all his repayments. He is one of the most active members in his community bank for which he is very much loved and respected. The two thousand new sols requested will be invested in the purchase of more chocolates so he can increase the quantity of products he has in his sales location.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise inventory

loans.name: Mwajabu's Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hard working 32 year old lady with a retail shop business that she has owned for seven years.

She is a mother of seven children as she also cares for three dependents. Mwajabu also writes and sells CD's to bring in an extra income. She is a friendly lady and this has helped her win more loyal customers. Mwajabu is able to make a weekly profits of between 100,000 – 200,000. She has hopes of expanding her businesses and would like to increase her stock; like buying more CDs and general merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: Restock her business with more goods for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drugs in bulk

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil viuda tiene 3 hijos, vive en Cuturapi y estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio compra venta de especerías.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar comino. Orégano, pimienta, aji, vinagre, canela, maní, airampo, etc. Todo lo compra en Desaguadero y lo entrega en Puno. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos para engorde, para luego venderlo en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de comino. Orégano, pimienta, aji, vinagre, canela, maní, airampo, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 33 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda de locutorio, dónde realizan todo tipo de llamadas, ella a su ves vende equipos de celulares y el chip, en esta tienda también adecuó un pequeño espacio para vender los productos de herbalife, nuestra socia está metida en todo, para poder reunir dinero suficiente y construir su casita; la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio y comprar lo que le hace falta para poder hacer de su negocio un lugar acogedor y completo.

Nuestra socia  valora y agradece el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maribel is from the city of Cusco, and she is a member of the "Kantu San Jeronimo" communal bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children. Maribel divides her time between her household labors and her retail business. She has a small phone store, where she offers the opportunity to make all types of calls, and she also sells cell phones and phone cards. Inside her store, she has also set up a small space where she sells Herbalife products. She is involved in all this because she is trying to save enough money to build a small house. She needs this loan so that she can invest in her business; she will purchase the necessary supplies to make her store a well-stocked and inviting place. Maribel appreciates and values the loan offered to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her multiple business activities

loans.name: Maria Celinda

texts.en:
Maria Celinda T. Obanda runs a restaurant in the Fortin district of Guayquil. She is married and has 5 children.  Only one of her daughters still lives with her.  Maria Celinda works every day from 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. serving breakfast and lunch to people who work in the area. Her husband helps out in the kitchen when he is needed.

Her restaurant is a popular place to eat and has a lot of regular clients. During the weekdays she has about 30-35 clients daily, while during the holidays/weekends she can have up to 80-90 clients daily. 

Due to high activity, Maria Celinda has hired two employees who help her in the restaurant. Among the dishes served in the restaurant are local dishes of fish, steak and pork.

Maria Celinda requests a loan to buy more products for her restaurant such as rice, olive oil, fish and meat. This will help her scale up her business and serve more customers. 

Maria Celinda dreams of upgrading her house from cane to bricks, and hopefully an increase in sales will help her achieve this.

loans.use: To buy fish, steak and pork

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna S. is a 34-year-old married woman from the town of Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.  She believes that if you love your family, you must do everything for their sake. This is the reason why she works so hard - to help her husband provide for the needs of their six children between ages 1 and 11.  The three oldest already attend school. Her aspirations are to provide a comfortable life for her family and send her children to school to prepare them for a better future.

To help her husband make their dream a reality, she started a general store.  Even with a small income, she knew she was helping her husband, so she continued her efforts and tried to offer more goods to her customers. To further increase her income potential, she started with a door-to-door vending business selling different kinds of root crops, vegetables, and fruits because these were abundant in her locality.

When demand for her goods increased, she realized that she needed additional capital just to be able to maintain enough inventory, so she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002. With the help of successive loans which she was able to pay off quickly, her business improved even further, and she was able to earn a net monthly income of PHP 18,000 on average. She has started to set aside some of her income for the future of her children.

For her 13th cycle loan she borrowed PHP 22,000 which was utilized as additional capital for her general store and door-to-door vending. Her loan was paid on a weekly basis and it was fully paid without any delay. Now she is borrowing for her 14th cycle, the amount of PHP 23,000, as additional capital for her business once again. The income she earns from it will be used to make improvements to her general store structure and as additional capital for her door-to-door vending.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To make improvements to her general store.

loans.name: Geyling De La Concepcion

texts.en:
Geyling was working for a local factory when she lost her job. Her aunt gave her a small amount of money so that she could begin her used clothing sale business. Geyling’s aunt lives in a central location, near one of the markets in the city of Leon, and lets Geyling use her house from which to sell.
 
Geyling has a good credit history with Fundación León 2000, but this is the first loan that she has used to support her business. Geyling is determined to continue with her business and dreams of opening up branches in other parts of the city and in other cities as well. Geyling is 27 years old and is a single mother to her six-year-old son. She says that being a single mother is a great challenge and she wishes that her son had more support.

loans.use: Capital for her used clothing sales business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 35 years old. She is married with four children; two are currently in school. She has been married for some time now. Her husband works very hard to support her. Agnes enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her kids. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. However, she is constrained by low capital to make meaningful progress. She requests this loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her profit. She believes that, with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana sells women's footwear in a small market called “Borodinskyi” in her home town of Zaporozhye. Oksana has been in this business for 7 years. Now, she has about 170,000 Grivnyas of working capital.  

Oksana is requesting a 12,000 Grivnya loan to diversify the assorted merchandise that she offers for sale in her kiosks. She loves working with this type of merchandise and always tries to stock her vending locations with the latest trends in high quality shoes and boots. Oksana has a perfect credit history as a borrower. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Lugo

texts.en:
C., 41, is married with five children between the ages of 13 and 20 years old. All her children go to school. She resides in, and owns, a one-room house where she is staying with four people. C. takes care of additional family members as well. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. 

C. incurs transport costs to and from buying food and charcoal from villages of Mubende district. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people, on retail and wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenge is transportation during the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her. 

C. has been in this business for 20 years and with MCDT for six years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. C. joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas, cassava and potatoes. She aspires to see her business grow and to start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal, as well as bunches of bananas, cassava and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan W. is a 35-year-old married man with three children living with him in Kwirare in Busia District.

Initially, Jonathan was employed as a sales and marketing agent but left the job as it was not well-paying. In 2002, he ventured into a business making and selling bricks to generate enough income to support his family.

Jonathan would like to acquire a loan of Ksh 30,000 which he will use it to boost his brick-making in terms of labor. It will enable him to be in an economically stable position that will guarantee his children a better education and a brighter future. That is his future goal.

loans.use: To expand his business by boosting his brick making

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Palm kernel in Nigeria is used for a lot of things like body cream and local soap. Eunice sells palm kernel to make a living. She is happy in business because of the profits and the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more palm kernel to sell. She is itching for expansion in her business. She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband sells spare motor parts to support their family. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena G. A. de 24 años de edad, reside en Sacacoyo, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es empleado de una empresa privada, y junto a su pequeña hija de 5 meses de vida. Lorena posee su propia panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan y posteriormente comercializar tanto en su casa, lugar en el cual esta ubicada la panadería, como a sus clientes, a los cuales debe ir a repartir el pan. Cuenta con el beneficio de poseer muchos clientes los que hacen pedido en grandes cantidades y que son fieles a su negocio. Lorena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor para poder obtenerla más barata, así como también manteca, azúcar, miel, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son muy importantes para la realización del pan. A pesar que salir adelante con su negocio ha sido bastante difícil, ella ha sabido mantenerse firme con el deseo de crecer como micro empresaria y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Lorena G. A., 24, lives in Sacacoyo, located in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works as an employee for a private company, and with her small daughter who is 5 months old. Lorena has her own bakery, where she is responsible for making the bread and later selling it. She sells some of the bread from her home, where the bakery is located, and she also takes the bread to distribute to some of her customers. She has the advantage of having many customers who put in orders for large quantities, and who are loyal to her business. Lorena requests a loan which she will use to buy flour at wholesale so that she can get it at a lower cost, as well as butter, sugar, honey, yeast and other products that are very important for making bread. Although developing her business has been fairly difficult, she has stood strong with the desire to grow as a small businesswoman and in this way provide a better future for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bread

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. is from the village of P. Gumamela Pob., Sinacaban. She is 34 years old. Teresita is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Teresita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 44-year-old married woman with a one-year-old child. She sells fresh fish in her her neighborhood. She is also an electronic load dealer selling pre-paid cellphone units. Consumption of cellphone loads in her town is growing fast which is why she invested in it. She plans to buy a new cellphone that she could use for loading. She applied for a loan of Php30, 000. She will use it to buy fish and hopefully a cellphone.

loans.use: Fish and a cellular phone

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez. She is 32 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $81 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is 51 years old and was born in Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. He studied until sixth grade in the old educational system from colonial times. He is married and has five children, who range in age from 10 to 23. He is very proud of the fact that all of them go to school. 

Armando has lived in Maputo with his family for his entire life, except for a short period of time where he went to Havana, Cuba, to study to be an electrician, which has been his job ever since. (After the colonial period ended and Mozambique became independent, it was common for many citizens to go to learn a job in Cuba, the former USSR or East Germany.) He has worked at the same company for the last nine years. He works from 7.30 to 17.30 with a one-hour lunch break. He is able to provide for his family but not able to save anything because he needs his entire income to feed his family and continue building a house for them to live in.

Armando is applying for a loan to buy cement, sand, stone and other construction materials for the partially-completed house he lives in with his family. He learned about the possibility of getting a loan from Kiva through his neighbors.

With that help, he dreams of finishing work on his house. Once work is complete, he plans to buy furniture because he does not currently own any.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stones to finish building his house

loans.name: Marc

texts.fr: Né en 1968 à Ifangni dans le département du Plateau au Bénin, D. Marc est marié à DJOSSOU Félicité, une ménagère. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont deux représentent leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Marc vit depuis sept ans environs à Danmin, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Marc a très peu fréquenté l’école, et a appris ensuite le métier de meunier. Marc exerce cette activité depuis onze ans environs. De façon secondaire, Marc fait de l’élevage à son domicile. Marc achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Marc sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, afin de renforcer son activité et d’acquérir deux autres moulins à maïs et à manioc ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Ifangni in the Plateau province of Bénin, D. Marc is married to DJOSSOU Félicité, housewife. The couple is raising four children, of whom two are their biological children. All the children are enrolled in school. Marc has been living for about seven years in Danmin, in the township of Sèmè-Podji, with his wife and children. The couple share in covering the expenses of the family. Marc was not able to attend school for very long and afterwards learned the miller's trade. He has been working in this trade for about eleven years. Secondarily, he raises livestock at their home. He buys his products in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the first time that Marc is requesting from ALIDé a loan intended to bolster his business and acquire two other mills, one for maize and another for manioc. This will allow him to better serve his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a mill for manioc and another for maize

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en: Nazia is wife of A. and lives in Multan, a city of sweetmeats in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. A very talented lady, Nazia operates her embroidered clothes business. She does this work to improve the living standard of her family. She takes orders from her neighbors and relatives and her good embroidery skills keep her customers coming back. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest in her business. With the loan she will buy materials in bulk such as clothes, beads, and threads. She is hopeful that she will be able to bring positive financial change to her family by increasing her business.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun R. is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Soy (they are pictured together), is 33 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1999 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of the children attends school and other two are still young.

Mrs. Savoeun R. has been a silk weaver for twenty years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market and other places. Her husband has been a construction worker for twenty years.

Savoeun is asking for her first loan of $200 to purchase more silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy more silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia O. is 27-years-old. She is single and the mother of one child, aged four. She has a cereal store that she has been running for the last six years on a busy street in Narok Town.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her second loan. She is planning to increase her stock of maize. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. Also this being the season for harvesting maize and wheat, she is hoping to buy more stock to sell later when the price and demand are high.

Her future dream is to be able to build her own store and her own house. Lydia believes she is hard working and only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To buy stocks of maize, wheat and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina del Carmen U. A. de 48 años de edad,  reside en el Barrio San Jacinto, ubicado en la capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo, un señor muy trabajador, y junto a una hija y un hijo ambos de 18 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Marina posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa flores, su puesto está ubicado desde hace 14 años atrás en el mercado de San Jacinto, en donde es muy conocida y buscada por las persona, ya que Marina no solo vende flores de excelente calidad, sino también elabora lindos arreglos florales para toda ocasión como bodas y bautizos. Gracias a este negocio ella ha podido contar con una vida mejor, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo con el deseo de invertir aún más en su venta, comprando mayor cantidad de flores en diferentes estilos, así mismo comprar canastas, listones, tarjetas y toda la materia prima necesaria para realizar los arreglos floreales, lo que más espera Marina es poder atender mayor cantidad de personas y de esta forma poder percibir mayor cantidad de ganancias.
texts.en:
Marina del Carmen U. A. is 48 years old and lives in the San Jacinto Neighborhood, located in the capital. She lives with her husband, a hard-working man, and a daughter and son, both 18 years old, who are in school. Marina has her own business marketing flowers, and for 14 years has had a stand in the San Jacinto market. She is well known there and in demand, since Marina not only sells flowers of high quality, but makes floral arrangements for special occasions, such as weddings and baptisms. Her business has allowed her to enjoy a better life, and for this reason she requests a loan to invest even more in sales, buying larger quantities of flowers of different types, as well as baskets, ribbons, cards, and all the materials needed for floral arrangements. What Marina would like most is to serve more people and thus increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flowers and materials for making floral arrangements

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him K. (pictured in the photo with her loom), 52, is a widow with five daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home and another one attends school. They are living on an island in the MeK. River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Him has been a silk weaver since she was 16 yeas old. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting her first loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana sells men's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol city and has been in this business for thirteen years. She has always tried to offer her clients a large variety of clothing at affordable prices. Tatyana is married with two children and her clothing business is the only source of income for her family. She uses the profit to support her family and also her parents’ family to enable them to survive economically. Tatyana has used Kiva loans before (see here) and found them very helpful for her business. This time, she would like to borrow 20,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory of seasonable clothing.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene la edad de 21 años, es soltero, y vive con su madre. El quiere comprar un cerdo para la crianza y engorde. Ademas, con el dinero que sobra le gustaría terminar de arreglar el chiquero. Se engorde los cerdos para el fin de venderlos. Está el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera de llegar una separación familiar para no depender tanto de lo mismo y con una ayuda extra para vivir mejor.
texts.en: Marcos is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his mother. He wants to buy a pig to raise and fatten up. In addition, with the money that is left over, he would like to finish fixing the pigpen. The pigs are fattened up with the purpose of selling them. This is the first loan that he has received from  FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the ease with which it was offered.  He hopes to be able to live on his own so that he doesn't have to depend so much on his family and with  little extra help, live better.

loans.use: Pigs to raise and fatten up.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria M. is 51 years old, single, and the mother of three grown children. Her business is located in a residential area in Nairobi. For the past year, she has been selling clothes to passers-by and regular customers. She says that this business is profitable and that her major challenge is a lack of finances. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more clothes, which include skirts and trousers, in order to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a boutique. She describes herself as a hardworking and happy lady.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Areli Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Areli Del Carmen tiene 32 años es casada y con su esposo tienen un hijo menor de edad. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, entre lo que sobresale golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, pan y jugos. La señora  tiene 5 años de haber empezado con su negocio, ella inicio en coordinación con su esposo, el cual siempre le preocupo el obtener una fuente de ingreso, poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario hasta llegar a tener el negocio que hoy en día posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento y vende en noviembre o diciembre, sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. Además ella desea diversificar sus mercancías e introducirse a vender otros tipos de artículos. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, con ello pretende invertirle más a su negocio para que sea más rentable y de allí obtener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Areli Del Carmen is 32 years old, is married and has a child with her husband. She has a grocery store where she sells candy, detergents, basic grains, bread and juice. She started her business five years ago together with her husband who was always worried about obtaining a source of income. She gradually acquired her inventory until she was able to get the business she has today. The loan will be invested in the purchase of goods because if she purchases now and sells in November or December her earnings will increase because prices are low now. Additionally, she wants to diversify her merchandise and start selling other types of goods. Her dream has always been to make improvements to her home. With this aim she wants to invest more in her business to make it more profitable and from there obtain the resources to improve her home.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jeans and cosmetics

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn S., 29, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. S. is employed at the factory, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is an electronics repairman, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase electronic spare parts, such as stereos, to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts to expand the business.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
Maria Felix tiene de 40 años de edad, vive en la colonia los Angeles en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea, junto a su esposo que le ayuda en las actividades diarias de la Finca y su hijo Roberto de 18 años de igual forma realiza labores Ganaderas junto a sus padres; siendo esta actividad ganadera la principal fuente de ingresos de la Sra. P. quien posee una finca en  comarca El Almacen de Nueva Guinea, desde hace 10 año, laborando arduamente para crecer cada dia y llegar a obtener mayores ingresos y asi cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago. 

Por lo que solicita su primer crédito para realizar infraestructura de un corral galera y asi mejorar las condiciones que requiere su unidad de producción,  de esta manera obtener un ordeño limpio y saludable, 

Maria Felix sueña que sus animales se mantengan sanos y cada vez le generen mayor peso y por ende mejorar sus ingresos, asi tambien lucha por el bienestar de su Familia.
texts.en:
Maria Felix is 40 years old.  She lives in the Los Angeles residential development in the town of Nueva Guinea together with her husband, who helps her in her daily activities on the farm, and her son, 18 year-old Robert, who also works in livestock farming together with his parents.  Livestock farming is the main source of income for Mrs P. who has owned a farm in the El Almacen region of Nueva Guinea for 10 years.  She works hard every day so that she can grow and make better profits and thereby meet her payment obligations.

Maria Felix is requesting her first loan to build the infrastructure of a cow pen and shed so that she can improve the conditions of her production unit and carry out a clean and healthy milking of her animals.

Maria Felix dreams of her animals remaining healthy and putting on more weight, thereby improving her profits.  She also works hard for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a cow pen and shed on her farm

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora María Guadalupe, tiene 64 años de edad, viuda, tiene tres hijos, habita en la Comarca Llano de Colon, Estelí.
Cuando su esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus hijos, se decidió a sembrar en las tierras que su esposo le había dejado, hace más de 25 años y poco a poco fue ahorrando para poder sembrar y también se dedico a la Compra Venta de Ganado.
Pero también tuvo una pulpería durante 14 años, pero con el tiempo decidió dedicarse a la Siembra y a la  Crianza y Producción de Aves de Corral.
Espera que este crédito le ayude a mejorar un poco sus ingresos y mejorar poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y su humilde casita.
texts.en: Mrs María Guadalupe, age 64, is a widow with three children. She lives in the Llano de Colon region of Esteli. When her husband passed away and she was left alone with her children, she decided to sow the lands that her husband had left her. It has been over 25 years and bit by bit she has been saving to be able to sow. She also buys and sells livestock. She has also had a convenience store for 14 years, but with time she decided to dedicate herself to farming and to raising barnyard birds. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her income a little and improve her living conditions and humble home bit by bit.

loans.use: the purchase of inputs for the sowing of cabbage and onion

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric S. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 24 years old. Eric is single. To make a living, Eric owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Eric has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eric joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eric is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eric from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie I. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Rosemarie is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 45 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de socia Alejandrina es la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes, ella tiene 25 gallinas y unos cuantos cuyes para vender pero en esta oportunidad  desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea el micro crédito para comprar gallinas, cuyes y alimento para los animales. Ya son veinte años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. 

Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 45 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is raising and selling small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has 25 chickens and a few guinea pigs that are available for sale. Alejandrina is taking this opportunity to increase her business capital, so she is requesting a microloan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals. She has been in this business for twenty years and has done very well.

Alejandrina belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past four years, selling wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a freezer for storing fish for sale. She decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation in society.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing fish for sale

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 40years old, single, and has three children.  They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is the sole support for her children and her dream is to see them through university. For four years she has been selling maize and beans and the income generated has helped her to educate her children. Her major challenge is price fluctuation and her dream is to become a wholesale trader. Mabel is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: To purchase maize and beans

loans.name: Kyakuwa Women's Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
Hariet N. is 32 years old. She is a hardworking, enterprising and ambitious businesswoman who has been running a pub business in Kayunga town for the past decade. Hariet is affiliated with the Kyakuwa Women’s Group. The happily married mother of five says it has been a worthwhile business despite the growing competition that makes it hard to keep clients loyal. Hariet began her current business with savings from her first business venture which was farming. Her pub generates a weekly profit of 150,000 UGX. 

Hariet is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and other beverages to sell.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer and other beverages

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
I. Hafiza is the loving mother of her son. She is married and her husband is an accountant in a cannery. She is engaged in animal husbandry and she has been in this business for 22 years. She purchases cattle and feeds them for a certain period then sells them at reasonable prices. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 4500 Somoni. She will use this loan to purchase cattle and expand her business. Let's help her reach her goals! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Faisalabad, which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Mariam abad for the past 10 years. She is married to R. M. and has two children. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. She is a very caring lady who makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.

Her husband is involved in a scrap business. His shop is located in the market and he supplies scrap to different scrap dealers and factories. He is the only earning person in the family. That’s why it is very necessary for him to improve his business conditions. Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will purchase scrap like plastic bottles, used papers etc. Shamim hopes that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and improve the living standard of her family. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she proved herself as a responsible client by paying the installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note:“In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is Mohamed. He is married with three children ages ten, twelve and 28. He has two additional dependents that live with him because they are orphans and he is assisting them. Mohamed owns a general store that he started to become self-reliant. He works seven days a week, twelve hours a day and earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month.

Mohamed is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy additional milk, sugar, margarine, and batteries to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to get a commercial bike. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, margarine and batteries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a porch.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 31years old. He is single and hard working. He owns a hair cutting salon for the past 11 years and that business enabled him open up another business of making chairs out of timber. He is requesting a loan to buy salon cutting equipment in order to expand his business and hence make more profits.

loans.use: To buy hair salon cutting equipment.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane, a 46-year-old woman who lives in the community of Sto. Nino South Cotabato, is married to a farmer with whom she cultivates their small rice farm to support their family. Her average income is Php 19,000 per harvest. With her loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc., Mary Jane will buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 41 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboangs del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-aged children. Marivic is a farmer. She works on the farm everyday to earn a living. Marivic plants and sells flowers like chrysanthymums, asters and anthuriums. She has been running her business for over 11 years with a monthly income of PHP 10,340 from this business. Marivic has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

Marivic has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Marivic hopes to buy land for a flower plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and hospital bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a cosmetic shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. His greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase beauty products, braids and weaves. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 24-year-old man who lives in Nouba village near Hebron, Palestine. He works as an employee in the municipality of Nouba and has a small salary.
Mohammed is getting  married this summer and has some wedding expenses and preparations to complete, but because of his small salary, he cannot cover the urgent expenses therefore he is taking a loan of $3,000.
When Mohammed receives his FATEN loan, he will be able to arrange and deal with the wedding expenses easily as the loan is repaid on a monthly basis.
By getting this loan, Mohammed will feel more comfortable and has high spirits for life. Mohammed is photographed at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to pay for wedding expenses.

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en: Rehab is 50 years old and lives in Madaba, Jordan with her five children. Some time ago, she went into business selling products out of her house, but has since expanded to selling them from a bus owned by her husband. She is applying for a loan for 800 JD to buy more products to sell to her customers. Her goA. is to work with her husband to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Women's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old and believes he is on track to be highly successful with his restaurant in Lugazi. He has strong knowledge of the fundamentals of running a business. He has operated this business for the past ten years. 

Joseph, a father of three, says that the key to his success is his ability to sell foods that his customers enjoy. Many of his customers are partial to foods such as bananas, cassava, beans, rice and green vegetables. With his business firmly established and getting stronger all the time, Joseph says he is intent on owing this business for the long-term. He says being ahead of the pack is what he wants.

He also has a second business: rentals. Weekly, he says the gross sales income from his business is 50,000 UGX. This loan, Joseph says, is to purchase better furniture like chairs and tables.

loans.use: to purchase better chairs and tables

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y tiene 40 años de edad, ella se separó de su pareja con quien tuvo dos hijos. Desde hace 12 años que Josefina vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ya son 11 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.

En esta oportunidad Josefina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa de damas. 
 
El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Josefina was born in the city of Paucartambo.  She is 40 years old and separated from her partner with whom she had two children.  For 12 years, Josefina has lived in the city of Cusco where she carries out her business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for 11 years and it is doing very well.

On this occasion, Josefina needs a loan to buy merchandise (women's clothes).

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is known as being a touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (women's clothes)

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Evangelina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Evangelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evangelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Esther Banchili

texts.en: Esther is a 33 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 2 to 11. She describes herself as hardworking, and has for the last 10 years earned a living by selling various food items, including ground nuts and beans. Her business is in Kakamega town, and her biggest challenge is a shortage of funds. She is applying for a Kiva loan for Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals and groceries to sell to her customers. Her main goal is to begin selling clothing as well as food withing the next five years. She would also like to buy a van, because it will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ololkukua

texts.en:
Ololkukua is a 42-year-old man who is married and a father to five children. He has been farming for the past three years and getting good returns. 

Ololkukua paid his previous loan well and has applied for his third loan with KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy farm supplies. With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children and re-invest the remaining amount in farming.

He dreams to be well-known farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Caroline is 47 and has been in farming for over 10 years. She produces and sells nappier grass, milk and eggs to the local market and grass to dairy farmers in particular. She clarifies that farming is her sole source of income. 

Caroline has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilmo, 40,000 of which will be used to construct a poultry unit, and the remaining 60,000 of which will be used to purchase more poultry and boost her farming income. She says she wants to be an animal breeder and supply the farmers in the area. 

She notes that weather is very unpredictable and poses the greatest challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and construct a poultry unit

loans.name: Dura

texts.en:
Dura is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
 
Dura has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Dura is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with 2 children aged 9 and 11. She has had a sari-sari (convenience) store for 9 years. Elsa sells items like soft drinks, soap and shampoo to the people in her community. Elsa also sells rice cakes, ice candy and other local delicacies.

Elsa has requested a loan to purchase rice and other items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. Elsa hopes to grow her income and be able to save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru:
Юлия начинала брать кредиты давно. Считает, что кредитование - удобный способ развития бизнеса. На этот раз она хочет воспользоваться кредитом для закупки новых сортов семян и удобрений. За счет прошлого кредита Юлия расширила торговое место, арендовала еще одно торговое место напротив своего ларька и теперь выкладывает часть товара туда.

У Юлии в семье и в бизнесе все нормально. В доме нужно делать ремонт, но пока на это нет времени. Сын Юлии закончил учебу и уже работает в милиции. Дочь учится в спортшколе, в этом году заканчивает последний класс и собирается поступать в колледж.
texts.en: Yuliya began taking loans long ago. She finds that credit is a convenient way to grow a business. At this time, she would like to use a loan to purchase a new variety of seeds and fertilizer. With her previous loan, Yuliya was able to expand her shop space by renting an additional space across from her stall and putting some of her goods there. Everything in Yuliya's family and business life is normal. She needs to do some repairs at home, but has not had the time yet. Yuliya's son finished studying and now works with the police. Her daughter studies at  sports school; this year she will finish the final year and plans to go to a college.

loans.use: purchase new seed varieties and fertilizer

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 37 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area, with his parents, his wife and three small children: two sons and a daughter. Artur’s parents are pensioners; his wife stays at home and takes care of their children.

For about five years Artur worked as a tunneller, but now he is engaged in farming. He has been running his farm for 11 years now, which is how he provides for his large family. On his farm Artur rears 4 cows, 4 calves and 20 chickens. Artur sells agricultural produce from his farm to his regular buyers. His wife helps him as far as possible. 

Artur is seeking a loan of 600,000 AMD to buy some sheep and two more calves for his farm. This will allow Artur to develop his farm and thus to increase his family’s income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and two more calves for his farm.

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
El señor Secundino es de la ciudad de Pilar, está casado, es comerciante, tiene una empresa de transporte donde realiza fletes, y también tiene una tienda de venta de artículos de primera necesidad.
Comenta que hace 10 años se dedica a esto, por lo que ya pudo formarse una buen clientela, dice que le va muy bien, y que este trabajo es el medio por el cual ayuda a su familia y puede mantenerlos.
El se define como una persona trabajadora, emprendedora y luchadora, todo lo que hace es por su familia, ya que desea que ellos no pasen por necesidades.
