Quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar y demás insumos con lo cual podrá podrá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Secundino is from the city of Pilar and he is married. He has a transport company that hauls freight, and he is also a trader with a grocery store selling basic items.

He says he started this business 10 years ago, so he has been able to build up a good clientele. It is going very well he says, and it provides him with the means to help and support his family.

He describes himself as a hard-working and determined entrepreneur. Everything he does is for his family, because he doesn't want them to suffer hardship. He wants to keep growing his business, so he is requesting a loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar and other supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar and other supplies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old and married to a businesswoman. He has four children aged between 2 and 13; all are enrolled in school. 

He sells different items such as rice, beans and soaps in the shop that he has been running for the period of seven years. With the loan, he will buy more rice and beans to sell. Emmanuel plans to use the profits for savings, to pay school fees for his children and to provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26 year old married man who has 2 family members from Sahab Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to pay for his home improvements, he would like to buy a furniture.In the future he wants to buy land to build house on.
Since Ahmad is under 30 year old,his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Kuña Aty Joaju” se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el Tercer  ciclo, con diez integrantes.
Agustina es la presidenta, y cuenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos, ovejas y demás, cuenta que es un trabajo muy difícil, pero que lo hace porque le gusta mucho.
Ella sueña con poder tener más animales y de esa forma seguir trabajando y generar más ingresos para su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Aty Joaju" was formed on the initiative of one of its members. Now the group is in its third loan cycle, with 10 members.

Agustina is the president. She raises and sells barnyard animals, such as chickens, pigs, ducks, sheep, and others. She says that it is very difficult work, but that she does it because she likes it a lot.

She dreams of being able to have more animals and in this way continue working and generate more income for her family. She is applying for the loan to buy feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Shan Su Village Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Shan Su Village, named San, Tin, Zaw, Than and Aye. Shan Su Group's previous loan helped to repair the group’s duck farm, which needs to be exchanged every year. The group also used their loans to purchase high-quality feeds, thereby increasing duck egg production and boosting their incomes. Proximity affordable loans' interest rates have enabled village customers to cover monthly expenses without taking on high-interest rate loans from local moneylenders.

As like previous loan, the clients will use their next loan to purchase more ducks and buy high-quality feeds. The entire group members appreciate all the supports that they are getting from Kiva community.

loans.use: to help the Shan Su Village repair the duck farm and purchase high quality feed.

loans.name: Madeleine Djipoya

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by fifteen members of the Mayomba women’s association, led by Madeleine Djipoya S.. The group describes their business as follows:

“This is a project of the women of Hassouka, in the rural community of Mlomp 9 km from the town of Oussouye. The women of our village have long been famous for their skill in agriculture. The women in this region have also benefited from technical training offered by various nonprofit organizations, the best known of these being AJAEDO (Association of Young Farmers and Ranchers of the Department of Oussouye).

Our group has the following objective: to improve the living conditions of our members, to increase the income of the women and to increase our production capacity. The main business activity of our group is gardening; we will use a two-hectare field to plant all kinds of vegetables which will be harvested and sold in the market and to hotels throughout the department of Oussouye.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet. : Ce projet est un projet des femmes de Hassouka dans la communauté rurale de Mlomp distant de 9 Km de Oussouye. Le village est un village dont les femmes sont réputées d’agriculture et cela depuis très longtemps. Les femmes de cette localité on bénéficier de formation avec différent ONG dont la plus connu reste L’A J A E D O Association de Jeunes Eleveurs et Agriculteurs du Département de Oussouye.

Objectifs du Prêt : Le groupement s’est fixé entre autre objectif :

- d’améliorer les conditions de vie des ses membres, d’augmenter le revenu des femmes et de pouvoir augmenter leur capacités de production.

Activités : l’activité principale du groupement est le jardinage ; il s’agit d’exploitation d’un périmètre de 2hectares au maximum planté des légumes de touts genre qui seront vendus après récolte dans le marché et dans les hôtels au niveau de tout le département d’Oussouye. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, gardening equipment, a scale; setting up a storeroom for the produce

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 36 and mother of 3 children. She retails plantains in the satellite market in her community. Plantains can keep for some time and are even worth more when they ripen. Vida is seeking the KIVA assistance to enable her to buy in bulk quantities for retail and wholesale to other retailers in the market. She is a beneficiary of the TEACH sessions provided by KRABAN, which she attended in October 2006.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 50 years old, married and has nine children. She sells craftworks from her home (shawls, jackets, napkins, blouses, tableclothes), which she makes and embroiders herself. She then sells these items in the city of San Cristobal at a site called "Santo Domingo," which is a artesans market, where tourists who visit the city like to shop, as well as the native peoples of the area. She wishes to invest in her business and to increase sales. She belongs to the group Laguna Azul (Blue Lake) 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

PAULINA TIENE 50 AÑOS, CASADA, NUEVE HIJOS, TIENE EN SU CASA PARA VENDER PRODUCTOS DE ARTESANIA (CHALES, MANTAS, SERVILLETAS, BLUSAS, MANTELES ), LAS CUALES ELLA MISMA CONFECCIONA Y BORDA, LUEGO LAS SALE A VENDER A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL EN UN LUGAR LLAMADO "SANTO DOMINGO", QUE ES UN MERCADO DE ARTESANIAS DONDE COMPRAN LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD Y TAMBIEN LA GENTE NATIVA DEL LUGAR, ESPERA INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIO Y ASI AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 1.

loans.use:
"Craftwork Sales."

VENTA DE ARTESANIAS

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia C. D. P. is a 37-year old married woman with 4 children who are 19, 18, 17 and 7 years old, respectively. Her two oldest children are in school at Itaugua, one studying Nursing and the other just finishing at a high school in the city; the two youngest are also still in school and all help their mother who they love and for whom they have a deep admiration.

Her husband is a dental assistant but, because of the expense of the children’s studies, Nimia helps her husband with household expenses. Nimia has been the owner of a canteen at one of the city’s schools for 13 years now; during vacation periods, she works as a street vendor, selling clothes.

Senora Nimia hopes to increase her canteen’s sales and to do so she wants to buy wholesale supplies of candy—caramels, gum, lollipops, etc.—so that she will get good discounts on purchases and increase her earnings margins as those are the products most in demand at the canteen.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Nimia Cáceres D. P. es una mujer casada D. 37 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos D. 19, 18, 17 y 7 años D. edad cada uno. Sus dos hijos mayores se encuentran estudiando en Itaugua, uno sigue la carrera D. Enfermería y el otro está terminando su bachiller en un colegio D. la ciudad; mientras que los dos menores cursan sus estudios primarios todos ayudan a su madre, a quien aman y tienen una profunda admiración.

Su esposo es trabaja como mecánico dental, pero como el estudio D. sus hijos demanda muchos gastos, Nimia ayuda a su marido con los ingresos D. la casa. Nimia es dueña D. una cantina en una escuela pública D. la ciudad hace ya 13 años; durante el tiempo D. vacaciones ella se dedica a la venta ambulante D. ropas.

La señora Nimia desea ampliar las ventas D. su cantina, por lo que desea adquirir golosinas al por mayor tales como caramelos, chicles, chupetines, etc.; D. esta forma obtendrá buenos descuentos en las compras y aumentará el margen D. sus ganancias, puesto que son estos son los productos D. mayor demanda en la cantina.

loans.use: For the purchase of wholesale candies such as caramels, gum, lollipops.

loans.name: Tali

texts.en:
Tali H. is a woman who works hard to support her family's needs. She’s forty years of age with four children. Tali’s husband is during most of the job outside the home, driving the whole day and night, earning money for their family. They both help each other to plan and budget their income from each day for their family needs and also their children's education.

Tali plans to use her loan to buy new tires, for petrol, and for licensing the taxi. She’s thankful to S.P.B.D's programme for making poor woman like her able to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase new tires, petrol, and for licensing

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar G. owns and operates a molding shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 23 years old and has been working in this business for the last three years. Before his current occupation he worked as a vendor at the local bazaar. He is looking for funding in the amount $475 so that he can purchase new equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his molding shop.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es:
Euneci is a young and enterprising mother who has worked hard to open a store in her community, once she noticed that both she and her neighbors needed a place they could count on for the most urgent basic needs. Thanks to her hard work in the fields, she has been able to realize her dream, and now she and her neighbors can meet their needs. Nevertheless, her small eight year old daughter has many daily needs, and to offer her a better future she has decided to open a business with more products in greater quantities. This will give Euneci larger earnings and will increase her savings, which she will use for the education of her daughter. Her store is on the Shintoriato highway, which is a great help as she has plans to later establish a small restaurant in her community. Lets work with this mother who wishes to improve her business and build a future for her beloved daughter.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Euneci, es una joven madre emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo aperturó una bodega en su comunidad, al ver la falta y necesidad de sus vecinos y suyo propio de contar con una bodega que satisfaga sus necesidades más urgentes; gracias a su empeño en sus campos de cultivo pudo concretar sus anhelos y hoy sus vecinos y ella pueden satisfacer sus necesidades.Sin embargo su pequeña hija de ocho años demanda muchísimos gastos día tras día y para ofrecer a su hija un futuro prometedor ha pensado implementar su negocio con nuevos productos de consumo masivo y demás mercadería los cuales proporcionaran a Euneci mayores ganancias e incrementará sus ahorros con los que podrá educar a su pequeña hija.Ella posee su tienda en la carretera de Shintoriato lo cual es de gran ayuda debido a que tiene planes de establecer más adelante un pequeño restaurante en su comunidad..Colaboremos con una madre que desea mejorar su negocio y forjar un futuro a su fruto más querido, su pequeña hija.

loans.use:
Purchase greater quantity and variety of convenience items. 

Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old he has three children, two of them studying in school. His wife has a chronic disease that needs medical treatment. He has an electric supplies shop and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase new electric supplies and goods for the shop, do some advertising, and paint the shop. He wants to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new electric supplies

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Martiza has been a member of the community bank “El Trébol” for one year. She is one of the founding members of her bank. Maritza mentioned that in her community she has learned to be punctual, responsible, how to budget her money effectively, and how to educate her children.

Maritza is 23 years old. She takes care of her two younger brothers who are eight and five years old. Maritza sells beef and pork from a rented stand in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho. She buys live animals at the San Juan market and then butchers them. Maritza works at the market during the weekends and during the week studies elementary education at the local university. During the vacations Maritza works every day.

Maritza needs a loan of 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying meat to sell.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Maritza plans to use her savings to pay for her brother’s education. Her dream is that her younger brothers will finish school and be professionals, to continue to develop her business, to be stable, and to finish her degree.

loans.use: Maritza needs a loan of 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in her business.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
GiseL. is a self-sacrificing mother and recently has also become a worker and an excellent breeder of small animals. Her wish to contribute to the improvement of her family and herself drives her to do this kind of work. The satisfactions have been few, but very good and she is convinced that with an increase in capital she would be able to obtain better yields for her family. Let us make the petition of this working woman possible.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

GiseL., es una abnegada madre y hace poco también una trabajadora y exigente criadora D. animalitos menores, el deseo D. contribuir a mejorar L. situación por L. que atravesaba su familia L. condujo a introducirse en esta labor. Las satisfacciones han sido pocas pero muy buenas y está convencida que con un incremento en su capital D. trabajo podría obtener mejore réditos para su familia.Posibilitemos L. petición D. esta trabajadora madre.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire a larger quantity of animals

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S. is 23 years old and lives in the Me Mut district of Kampong Cham province. She earns $3 a day as a yam farmer. Her husband, Njek Sopheap, adds $4 per day to the family income as a cigarette salesman. If their yam crop yields are high this year, they will be able to set up a stand to sell them along the Vietnamese border and better support their young child. They want to use their loan to invest in more farmland on which to grow yams.

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Doña Luz has perseverance and for that reason after several years of having a store in her small home she has decided to remodel and repair it. During our visit we found her finishing the final details to once again reopen her store with better and a greater number of products compared to what she sold before. She is asking for a loan to finish this great goal and soon fill the display cases with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Luz, es una persona perseverante por esa razón tras varios años D. tener su tienda en su pequeña casa ha decidido refraccionarla y repararla. En nuestra visita la encontramos ultimando los detalles para implementar nuevamente su tienda y reabrirla con mejores y mayores productos que las que antes ofertaba. Solicita un préstamo para culminar con esta gran meta y pronto llenar las vitrinas con novedosos productos.

loans.use: Increase working capital in order to buy a great quantity of items for her store

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid A. is a 56 year old trader who lives and works in the Imishli region of Azerbaijan.  He has seven years of experience in managing his own store.  He works as a teacher at a local school and earns a monthly salary of approximately 40 USD per month. As he is married and has 3 children, it is very hard for him to provide for all of the needs of his family. He applied for a loan of 800 USD to purchase more goods for his store.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Vaiana

texts.en: Vaiana T., 32, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 480 Tala (~200 USD). SPBD loans are Vaiana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Vaiana is running a plantation business. Her husband is unemployed but working together with her in running the business.

loans.use: Purchase purchase pesticides, empty gallon jugs for carrying water.

loans.name: Asnath

texts.en:
Asnath is 24 years old. She is married with a 7 year old child. She began selling maize and bananas in 2001. Every day she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $86 from her sales.

Asnath now hopes for a loan to buy more maize and bananas to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more maize and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sorbeh Group. Its members include Musa S. Bangura, Abu K. and Adamsay Conteh. They are petty-traders in Makump Banna village. This is their eighth loan from SMT. SMT has enabled these entrepreneurs to gain continuous access to loans. This opportunity has enabled them to continue in business, and they are very grateful for this opportunity.

Musa S. Bangura (left) is the leader of this group. Musa was born in Makump village about seven miles from Makeni, some 35 years ago. He is married with four children. Musa's wife sells bowls. Musa sells jeans and women's clothes. He has been doing this for the past seven years. With Musa's previous loans from Kiva through SMT he was able to solve all of his family's problems. He can send his children to school, feed and clothe them all out of the loans he gets from SMT.

Musa will invest this new loan in the same clothing business, as he is used to doing this business and has made a lot of customers over the years.

loans.use: To expand their existing businesses.

loans.name: Feao

texts.en: Feao S., 51, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience in the pancakes, pork cakes, ice cakes, etc., business. She sells to the village and general public 5 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Feao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband helps out with the business

loans.use: To improve business status and also help to improve her home

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a wife of M.. She owns a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan, and has been living in it for the past 15 years. She has one daughter, who is 3 years old. Zubaida baji is a housewife, but she also sews clothes for her neighbors, which provides a good income.

Zubaida baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop, which he has run for the past 5 years.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes four other members. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy wheat and corn to resell. Najma baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils to resell. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy candies to sell in shops. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Shamim Maqbool Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is a wife of M. M. and lives in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Shamim baji’s husband and sons have a wood selling business. Shamim baji herself has a clothes sewing business. She has been sewing clothes for the past 15 years. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her family business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy a juicer machine to sell seasonal fruits juices. Suraiya bano baji wants a loan to buy a photocopier machine. Gulzaran baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea S., 37, has been working as both rice farmer and a fisherman since 1980. He is married to Mrs. Yen Touch, and they have six children who are all in school. He works hard with his wife everyday to support the family. He farms rice two times per year during the rainy and dry season. When he is not farming, he catches fish to sell. His customers always come to buy rice and fish from his house. He would like to request a loan to buy fuel oil for his pump machine and fertilizer for his dry season farming.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials

loans.name: Enrriqueta

texts.es: Enrriqueta tiene 56 años, vive sola con sus 3 hijos mayores en su propia casa. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de alfalfa en un establecimiento que ella misma ha provisto para que sea su centro comercial y abastecedora de alfalfa de su comunidad, ella siempre esta pendiente de las ventas y también del cortado de la alfalfa. Su trabajo consiste en arrendar tierras de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa y luego deja su follaje hasta que llega ser el tiempo apropiado para cortarlo y venderlo, para ello  Enrriqueta  controla adecuadamente los tiempos, de ahí la importancia de sembrar en distintas épocas del año para tener siempre a sus disposición su mercadería de venta, es así que prefiere alquilar tierras de cultivo que tienen a su disposición canales de riego para que sus plantaciones no corran el riesgo de marchitarse y secarse, toda esa experiencia de trabajo Enrriqueta las ha ido adquiriendo con el paso de los años y ahora está en búsqueda de expandir sus horizontes de venta. Es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, además disfruta de trabajar en equipo con su banco comunal y está agradecida porque aprendió a invertir adecuadamente su dinero. La cantidad que solicita es para alquilar más  terrenos de cultivo para que siga sembrando alfalfa y tener reservas, el terreno que alquila está valorizado entre 600 a 800 soles el cuarto de hectárea, Enrriqueta alquilara 5 cuartos de hectárea de terreno.
texts.en:
Enrriqueta is 56 years old and lives alone with her three eldest children in her own home. For three years, she has been dedicated to selling alfalfa from a shop that she herself has provided so that she is the main trader and provider of alfalfa in her community. She is always selling or cutting the alfalfa. Her work consists of leasing farm land where she plants alfalfa and then leaving her crop until the appropriate time arrives to cut and sell it. For this, Enrriqueta adequately controls the time. The importance of planting in different seasons of the year in order to always have merchandise to sell at her disposal is why she prefers to rent farm land that has irrigation canals so that her crops don't run the risk of wilting and drying. Enrriqueta has been acquiring all of this work experience over the years and now she is looking to expand her selling horizons. This is the fifth time that she has received a loan from MFP. In addition to enjoying working in a team with her community bank, she is thankful because she has learned to invest her money adequately. The quantity that she is requesting is to lease more farm land so that she can continue to plant alfalfa and have reserves. The land that she rents is valued at 600-800 soles per quarter hectare. Enrriqueta will rent 5 quarter hectares of land.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent land to plant alfalfa.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Mambo ("Hello") from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Lucia M. from Mwanza. She is married and has 2 children ages 15 and 19 years old. Lucia has been running a grain business since 1995. She sells grain, such as beans and maize, to different customers. She works in her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Lucia currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more grains like beans, rice, and maize flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Lucia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more grains like beans, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Gulsarakhon

texts.en:
M. Gulsarakhon is 49 years old. She is marred with two children. Gulsarakhon has been running her own small business for 20 years. She rents a store in the local market for selling candies and different kinds of sweets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Gulsarakhon is very friendly and polite which brings her clientele. Now she requests $1000 USD. She is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods for selling, thus increasing the variety of the goods and to be able to provide for her children's needs and their school fees. Gulsarakhon promises to repay her loan within 9 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of goods

loans.name: Erving Manuel

texts.es: El señor Erving Manuel A. C. tiene la edad de 23 años habita en el barrio San José los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus padres , el es soltero , los planes hacia su familia es mejoras las tierras introduciendo diversificación de cultivo , para que en futuro logre tener mejor ingreso y apoyar mas a su papá , el desde la edad de doce años trabaja como agricultor , los rubro que le da mantenimiento es el cultivo de piña y el  plátano , los planes hacia un futuro en su negocio es conservar su pequeña finca con obras de conservación de suelo . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para que sus cultivo den una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Erving Manuel A. C. is twenty-three years old, single, and lives with his parents by the river in San Jose, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He plans to improve his family's harvest and further support his father by diversifying the cultivation so that it yields a higher income. He has been working as a farmer since he was twelve years old. The area that he maintains the most is that of pineapple and banana. His future plans are to preserve his small farm with soil conservation methods. The loan will be utilized for the purchase of fertilizers and raw materials in order for his cultivation to produce a good harvest that he may sell at a good market price.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and supplies for a better harvest

loans.name: Afde No 17 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 17 ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Grand Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de denrées alimentaires.  Elles sont bien expérimentées et très sollicitées dans cette activité. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance l’IMCEC.  Elles ont déjà reçu un prêt de groupement auprès de l’IMCEC, et elles l’ont bien remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour reconstituer leur stock de denrées alimentaires qu’elles vont vendre en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40,000 CFA ($80) au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The 5 women of the "Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°17" group have an average age of 45 and live in big extended traditional families in the Grand Thiès district, a town 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. They met because of living in the same neighborhood or being related to each other. They have almost the same businesses selling foodstuffs. They are very experienced and much sought after in this activity.

In the desire to improve the quality of their services and expand the size of their businesses, the members of the trust group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. They have already received one group loan from IMCEC and have correctly reimbursed it.

They intend to use this loan to stock up on foodstuffs which they will sell retail, for cash, in the market of Grand Thiès. They hope to make an average profit of 40,000 F CFA (US$ 80) during this loan cycle, which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover the needs of their families, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Nada Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Nada M. is the group leader of the Nada M. group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his/her business to purchase more materials for their businesses and make a good income for their families in future.

Nada M. wants to take a loan for his general store. He wants to expand and progress his business. Fazylah wants to take a loan for her son’s business of selling fruits and vegetables. Her son wants to make his shop larger. Faryda wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy new a machine for her business. Aqalah wants to take a loan for her husband’s retail food business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

They are confident that with the money they receive they can have a good profit and can run their businesses in a good way. They all are happy about the process of obtaining a loan and want to say that it can support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: To make their businesses larger

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.en:
N. Trịnh Thị (1211081276) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has an infant child. She owns and operates a business raising livestock and selling fish. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2008, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand her business.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to improve her business . The loan will be her 2nd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sultonkul

texts.ru: Султонкул молодой мужчина 29 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. У него среднее специальное образование. Султонкул занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Султонкул кредитуется 1 год. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Султонкул немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Султонкул планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Sultonkul is a young man of 29 years of age. He is married and has three children. Sultonkul has a professional degree but he makes his living by raising and selling cattle and his wife sells cow milk and milk products as well. He has been working with us for a years. When Sultonkul came to us for the first time he had only a few animals. Now he has expanded his herd a little. However, Sultonkul's wife has only one milk cow and he wants to purchase another milk cow with calf using the money from the current loan. Sultonkul is very grateful to be able to borrow money from us.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Đinh Thị

texts.en:
Đinh Thị P. is a 61-year-old woman living in the town of Ninh Giang, Vietnam. She is widowed and has 2 adult children. P. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The business generates revenue primarily, though not exclusively, from raising cattle for sale.  P. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND per month from these activities.


In 2004, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund that she used to expand shelter for her livestock. P. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her 6th loan from the TYM Fund. P. plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Olorunto

texts.en:
B. sells newspapers. She is a young vendor who believes that success is a result of hard work and, with this in mind, she is determined to pull her family out of poverty. She is 24 years old and married with a child. She lives in Lagos.

B. is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more newspapers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more newspapers to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
31-year-old rice-grower, Merlita C., is dreaming of an abundant harvest on her farm. She has four children and a supportive husband, Gerardo C., who helps her manage their small business. Currently, they are tilling a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm, which Merlita acquired from her parents.

Merlita would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000. She intends buying the fertilizers, rice seed and chemicals needed to ensure an abundant harvest. She believes that CEVI could help her achieve that dream so that she will be able to better support the needs of her family.

Now, Merlita joins in the CEVI cluster meetings. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seed and chemicals

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
N. Eva owns a drug shop known as Mwebaza Drug Shop. She is a married business lady, age 25. Her drug shop business is located in Kijjabwemi village in Masaka district. N. began her business in the year 2005. She is using this loan to purchase more medicines for her shop to supply recommended drugs for patients.

Her hope for the future is to expand her business into a big clinic. She wants to buy machines like heart pampers, microscopes and other drugs so that she can meet the demands of her clients. With these, she will be able to increase her profits and her sales.

loans.use: To purchase medicines

loans.name: Francila Abel

texts.pt:
Francilia Abel S. nasceu na capital Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade é viúva e mãe de uma rapariga de 14 anos de idade que freguenta a 8ª classe na escola secundária da Namaacha. Responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Boane enviando lhes mensalmente um valor de 1.000.00MT e pelo seu sobrinho que vive com ela na casa.

Apos seu pai perder emprego, a vida da Francilia fica muito difícil, já não tinha dinheiro de transporte para ir a Escola e tinha assim que percorrer grandes distâncias a pé, quando frequentava a 6ª classe do antigo sistema esta fica doente durante 2 anos internada e sem poder ir a Escola. Anos depois, entra na Cruz vermelha de Moçambique onde trabalhou primeiro como servente e, devido a sua dedicação ganha uma bolsa para tirar um curso na Acção Social. Foi enquadrada em Nampula onde junta se com seu falecido marido. Devido à perda do seu marido ela pede uma transferência e é enquadrada em Namacha como técnica no Serviço Distrital de Saúde Mulher e Acçao Social, onde trabalha a mais de 10 anos das 7:30 as 15:30h excepto nas segundas e quintas-feiras onde tem estado a prestar serviços no Município do mesmo distrito auferindo um valor de 3.324.00MT.

 Para alem de ser técnica na Accao social é também membro da Assembléia Municipal há 8 meses auferindo um valor mensal de 5.314.00MT num contrato de 5 anos.

Por estar cansada de viver na casa da instituição, aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando o primeiro empréstimo para fazer a legalização do seu terreno no valor de 5.000,00MT.

Obteve informações através de amigos e clientes da instituição.
Este é o segundo empréstimo de Francilia na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00MT para compra de material de construção e fazer o lançamento da primeira pedra. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e sem problemas, para poder aceder a mais créditos ate a conclusão da casa e posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Francilia Abel S. was born in the capital Maputo. She is 36 years old and is a widowed mother of a 14 year old girl, who is in the 8th grade at the Namaacha secondary school. She also support her parents, who live in Boane, and to whom she sends 1.000,00MT each month, and her nephew, who lives with her in her home.

After her father lost his job, Francilia's live was very difficult, as she no longer had money for transportation to get to school and had to traverse long distances on foot. When she was attending 6th grade classes in the old system she was sick for 2 years in the hospital and unable to go to school. Years later, she entered the Red Cross of Mozambique where she worked at first as a servant and, because of her dedication, she earned a scholarship to take a course in the Institute of Social Action. She was assigned to Nampula where she married her late husband. Because of her husband's death, she asked to be transferred and she was assigned to Namacha as a technician in the District Service of Women's Health and Social Action, where she has worked for more than 10 years from 7:30 a.m. until 3:30 p.m., except on Mondays and Thursdays when she provides services to the municipality of the same district, earning 3.324,00MT.

Besides being a technician for Social Action, she has also been a member of the Municipal Assembly for the past 8 months, earning a monthly salary of 5.314MT in a 5 year contract.

As she is tired of living in a house of the Institute, she approached Hluvuku and Kiva, looking for her first loan to secure the title to her land for the amount of 5.000,00MT. She heard about the organizations through friends and clients of the Institute.

This is her second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva in the amount of 20.000,00MT for the purchase of construction materials and in order to break ground. She trusts that she will pay back the loan ahead of time and without problems, in order to have access to future loans to help her complete and furnish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana C. is from the village of Saray, Iligan City. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Rosana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 09 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Pusuyo, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor y aves de corral.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar  ganado ovino y lanas para elaboración de artesanías que luego los vende en Ilave.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino, aves de corral y lanas de colores.

loans.name: Caracato Group

texts.es: El Grupo Caracato se encontraba formado por tres integrantes en el año 2005, cuando comenzaron a trabajar con la Institución, posteriormente se quedaron las dos señoras sacando el credito en garantia cruzada, siendo esta su 6ta. Secuencia en esa modalidad. La Sra. Victoria B. Tiene una Tienda de barrio en Alto Obrajes,ella quedo viuda hace dos años, tiene dos Hijas Jovenes que estudian y trabajn para costearse sus gastos de estudio, una de ellas tuvo su bebe hace un año siendo la sra. victoria quien cuida a su nieta mientras su hija trabaja y estudia, al margen de la tienda la señora elabora pan, salteñas (empanadas de carne), queques y galletas los fines de semana, y reparte a los establecimeintos educativos y kioscos de la zona es una mujer muy trabajadora. La otra integrante Sra. valentina C. tiene dos hijos jovenes que estudian en la universidad, ella trabaja mas de 20 años como enpleada domestica en la zona de Obrajes donde vive con sus hijos, ella no tiene esposo ya que hace muchos años se separo del padre de sus hijos; la actividad principal es la de venta de comida, actividad que realiza los fines de semana, donde tambien tiene la colaboracion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Caracato Group was formed by three members in 2005 when they began working with Emprender (Kiva Field Partner). Subsequently, two women remain in the communal bank and this is their sixth loan. Mrs. Victoria B. has a neighborhood store in Alto Obrajes. She became a widow two years ago and has two daughters that study and work to pay for their tuition. One of them had a baby last year and Mrs. Victoria takes care of her granddaughter while her daughter works and studies. Apart from the store, Victoria also makes bread, salteñas (meat empanadas), cakes, and cookies on the weekends and delivers them to schools and nearby kiosks. Victoria is a very hard working woman.

The other member is Mrs. Valentina C.. She has two children that are in college. Valentina has worked for more than 20 years as a domestic worker in the Obrajes area where she lives with her children. She is not married and has been separated from the father of her children for many years. She sells food on the weekends with the help of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia con su pareja y sus tres hijos, los cuales son su adoración y motivo para salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también a la elaboración de ricas “chocotejas” (chocolates), las cuales le resultan muy rentables en época de invierno y primavera, ya que el inclemente frío hace que la gente quiera calentarse comiendo este riquísimo dulce. Pero como ya que estamos próximos al verano, Margarita es conciente que la demanda de sus chocotejas bajará, es por ello que piensa invertir en la compra de más productos de belleza, su otro negocio, el cual le gusta tanto como la elaboración de los chocolates. 
Margarita siempre ha trabajado y le ha puesto muchas ganas a lo que hace, es por ello que al negocio que se dedique le resultará satisfactorio, pues como ella dice: “si uno se dedica bien al trabajo, éste le corresponde”.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP con su nuevo grupo solidario, ya que anteriormente perteneció a otro grupo y ahora espera ser tan puntual como lo fue con sus anteriores créditos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y así logrará buenos ingresos este verano.
texts.en:
Margarita, 42, lives in her own house with her life partner and their three children. She adores them, and they are her motivation to get ahead. For five years she has been selling beauty products and making rich “chocotejas” (chocolates). These are very popular in the winter and spring because the inclement cold makes people want to warm themselves by eating this rich sweet. Now that we are close to summer, Margarita is aware the demand for her chocotejas will go down. That is why she plans to buy more beauty products for her other business, which she likes as much as making chocolates. Margarita has always worked and put much effort into what she does. That is why the business she devotes herself to is satisfactory. As she says, “If one devotes themselves well to their work, the work will respond in kind.” This is her first loan with MFP with her new supportive group. She previously belonged to a different group. She now expects to be punctual like was with her previous loans. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy beauty products. That way she will get good income this summer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Hayfa'a

texts.en:
Hayfa'a is married with seven members in her family. She is a teacher in a public school and after work she helps her husband in managing their businesses.

Hayfa'a and her husband have a small grocery store and they also raise goats which they sell and also sell milk from them. Her husband used to work as a daily worker in Israel but because of the closure it became very hard for him to get there so they started these two businesses in addition to her work as a teacher.

This is Hayfa'a’s second loan from FATEN. For her first loan she took 3,000 USD and repaid it on time. Now she needs another 3,000 USD to buy feed for the goats and some products for the grocery store.

Hayfa'a’s husband appears in the photo with the sheep and goats.

loans.use: To buy feed for her goats and products for her grocery store

loans.name: Andrea Xiomara

texts.es: Andrea Xiomara Hernández Martínez tiene  de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues el único medio de vida que tiene para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que son lo más importante que tiene en su vida. Ella se levanta todos los días a las 4 de la madrugada para alistar en bolso sus productos y venderlos a sus clientes que hacen posible que su actividad económica mejore. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Andrea Xiomara Hernández Martínez sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for over four years. It is the only way of life she has to get her three children ahead. They are the most important thing she has in her life. She gets up everyday at four in the morning to arrange her products in a bag and sell them to her customers. They make it possible for her economic activity to improve. She is asking for the loan for working capital to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sahada

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de céréales dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet non seulement de se prendre en charge, mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins de ses 02 enfants. Elle vend en effet du maïs, de l’arachide et du mil. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. En ce moment elle veut prévenir une éventuelle rupture de stocks ; raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 08 sacs de maïs, 13 sacs d’arachides, 09 sacs de mils. Le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers le lieu d’approvisionnement. Cette femme n’est pas mariée.
texts.en:
This woman's source of income is selling grains in the Agoè quarter of Lomé. This activity allows her to cover her own expenses as well as cater to the needs of her two children. She sells corn, peanuts and millet and gets her supply in the central part of the country, tens of kilometers away from Lomé. She sells both wholesale and retail and would like to avoid running out of stock, which is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 8 bags of corn, 13 bags of peanuts and 9 bags of millet. The remainder of the loan will help cover her transportation costs to the supplier location. This woman is not married.

Translated from French by Owen Frivold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of corn, peanuts, millet and other products

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa, as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 38-year-old local restaurant operator. She is divorced and blessed with two children who are in school. She provides for the children through the proceeds from her business. In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local food like "fufu" and has been in business for two years now. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Yaa says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is divorced and has four children who are all currently in school. She is 40 years old and lives with her children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. Sarah works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. Sarah sells the food on a table top by the side of the road in her community. She buys her raw materials from nearby towns. Sarah has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and ingredients in bulk to make stew for sale

loans.name: Amanbaeva Jambu's Group

texts.ru:
Аманбаевой Жамбу 42 года, она разведенная мать 2 детей:старшему сыну 13 лет и учится в 7 классе, а дочь дошкольного возраста. Заемщица производит и реализует кисломолочные продукты, пирожки и беляши на скотном рынке Узгена. В неделю она выходит на работу два дня. Этим делом она начала заниматься два года назад, с момента развода, начальный капитал был получен в долг у сестры, который был равен около 70 долларам. Данный кредит будет использован для закупа 1 мешка муки, 1 мешка картошки, 5 кг курута (молочный продукт) - это около 1000 сом. Оставшаяся часть будет использована для аренды земли для выращивания риса. В будущем клиент планирует расширить ассортимент производимых блюд, и готовить плов, шурпа, манты и салаты. 

Манзурахон 24 года, она замужем и воспитывает двоих детей. Ее супруг работает таксистом в Узгене. Сама заемщица занимается выпечкой и реализацией лепешки уже два года. продукцию реализует на центральном рынке Узгена. На полученный кредит она планирует закупить 13 мешков муки, 14 кг сухого молока, соль и дрожжи. 

Маматкамил женат, и воспитывает 3 детей. Около их дома у них есть собственный ларек по продаже продуктов питания, на точке работает его супруга. Сам Маматкамил таксует в Узгене. Кредит будет использован для аренды 1 га земли для выращивания риса. В данное время он копит деньги, чтобы купить хорошую машину, чтобы у него была возможность работать на более рентабелных маршрутах, например Узген - Бишкек (столица).

Бурулкан, 52 года, замужем и мать 1 сына. Сыну 15 лет, ош школьник. Ее супруг работает частным строителем. Сама Бурулкан производит кисломолочные продукты, т.к. курут, айран, кефир, сметана. Кредит будет получен для закупа доеной коровы. Это позволит ей получать больше молока и увеличить объем производства молочных изделий.

*** STORY GOES HERE ***

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Jambu A. is 42 years old. She is a divorced mother of two children. Her oldest son is 13 years old and is in 7th grade, and the daughter is of preschool age. Jambu manufactures and sells dairy products, piroshky and belyashi (meat pies) at a livestock market in Uzgen. She goes to work twice per week. She started this business two years ago, since her divorce. Jambu obtained the starting capital of approximately 70 dollars from her sister as a loan. The current loan will be used for the purchase of 1 bag of flour, 1 bag of potatoes and 5 kg of kurut (milk curd product) – this is about 1000 som. The remaining sum will be used to lease land for growing rice. In the future, Jambu plans to expand the selection of prepared dishes and cook pilaf, shurpa (spiced lamb soup), manty (dumplings) and salads. Manzurahon is 24 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver in Uzgen. Manzurahon has been involved in baking and selling flatbread for two years. She sells her product at the Uzgen central market. She plans to use this loan to purchase 13 bags of flour, 14 kg of dried milk, salt and yeast. Mamatkamil is married and raising 3 children. They own a small food store near their home, where his wife works. Mamatkamil works as a taxi driver in Uzgen. He will use this loan to lease 1 hectare of land for growing rice. Currently, he is saving money to buy a good car to enable him to work more profitable transportation routes, for example Uzgen – Bishkek (the capital). Burulkan is 52 years old, married and is a mother of 1 son. Her son is 15 years old, and he is a student. Her husband works as a private building contractor. Burulkan manufactures dairy products, such as kurut, ayran (yogurt beverage), kefir and sour cream. This loan will be used for the purchase of a dairy cow. This will allow Burulkan to obtain more milk and increase the capacity of dairy product manufacturing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, potatoes, kurut and lease of land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more planks for resale.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en: Lazaro is a very enterprising barber, and one dedicated to providing his clients with excellent service. He began his career by working for another barber, and saved his money to go out on his own. Lazaro now has his own store and a loyal clientele base. He also rents chairs in his shop to other barbers. Lazaro is proud to create employment opportunities for others in his community. The proceeds from Lazaro’s ACCION USA loan will allow him to remodel and modernize his shop, including several "green" improvements. With the help and support of his parents, this Cuban-born entrepreneur is determined to continue succeeding. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To remodel and modernize his shop, including several "green" improvements

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en:
Abosede sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually friends, neighbors and residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She loves this business because she is able to help her husband with meeting the basic needs of the family.  

She is 38 years old and married with two children. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband sells beef and he also supports the home. She is requesting a loan of 120,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a forty-six-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. She is the mother of three children. Zeinab has been selling fishing equipment for five years, including fishing nets, fishing rods, fishing feeds, and more. This is the first time that she has requested a loan. She hopes to use the loan to purchase merchandise for her fishing shop since now it is a good season to fish. Some of her family members have been working as fishers, that is how she decided to open her shop. She also wanted to have independent work in order to improve her family’s income. For the future, she plans to improve her work and to keep attracting more clients thanks to her competitive prices.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her fishing shop.

loans.name: Tedo Koko

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle a plus de  15 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce ce qui lui a permis d’en acquérir une parfaite gestion, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville d’anié, ainsi elle réalise de plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes.  Elle veut gonfler son stock et sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 18 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs d’haricots. Elle est veuve avec 4 enfants à sa charge, c’est avec son revenu qu’elle subvient aux charges scolaires et diverses de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This lady has an income-generating activity selling cereals. She has more than 15 years experience in this business, which has allowed her to perfect her management of it. She gets her supplies inland in the town of Anié, so that she makes a higher profit margin on her sales. She wants to boost her stock and is thus requesting a first loan from WAGES, in order to buy 18 sacks of corn and three sacks of beans. She is a widow with four children in her care. With her income she can cover her children's schooling and other expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and beans

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.en:
Rabeca A. M. was born in Boane in the Maputo province of Mozambique. She is 40 years old and studied up to 7th grade. She had to stop because there was no place she could get to to study 8th grade. Soon after that she started working. She is single and has four children, age 20, 14, 6, and 2. The two middle ones go to school. She also supports a young nephew who lives with her. She has never left the city where she was born.

Rabeca has a small retail stall she has owned for the last 19 years, where she works without fixed timetable or employees. From it, she has a monthly income of 14,000 meticais. She is requesting a loan to buy cement, iron and other materials for the ongoing construction of her home. She is concerned about fluctuations in the material prices but with the help of Kiva lenders she hopes to see her house finished in the near future. After that she plans on working hard and investing in the education of her children.

loans.use: Cement and iron

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr: K. Noëlie est née le 23 Décembre 1971, et est mariée à SAGBO Jean, un vitrier. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a environs sept ans que Noëlie s’est installée à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, et y vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Noëlie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis sept ans environs, Noëlie vend des céréales et des produits vivriers à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Noëlie vend des condiments de sauce, ce qui lui permet de se faire plus de revenus. Noëlie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Noëlie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à renforcer son activité et à reconstituer son stock de produits, pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Noëlie K. was born on December 23, 1971; she is married to Jean Sagbo, a glass installation technician. The couple has seven children, some of whom go to school. About seven years ago, Noëlie settled in Djeffa, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where she now lives with her husband and children. Noëlie never attended school. Since about seven years ago, she has been selling cereals and staple foods from her home. In addition, she also sells sauce condiments, which allows her to increase her revenues. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is her first time seeking a loan from ALIDé, which would allow her to strengthen her business and restock her goods, in order to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing staple foods (corn, rice) for resale

loans.name: Srey Toch's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Toch P. is a group leader who has been selected by four members who are villagers in Krabau village, in Kandal province. Each of the members will use a portion of their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Srey Toch P. is 37 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Vey Tang, own a general store in the local village where they sell groceries to support their family. Since their business is going well they want to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Srey Toch P. is seeking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. She is a mother of three children: two attend the local public school, while the youngest one is only six years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mr. Sophak S. (shown in the photo), is 33 years old. His wife, Mrs. Sima Sam-rach, is 28 years old. They have been married for 12 years and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about seventeen kilometers from the city.  

Sophak has been a policeman for 17 years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. The walls of his house, as well as other parts of the house, are old and in need of repair. He is requesting his first loan of $600 to repair the house where he lives. He also will use a part of the loan to pay for school fees for his sister who is learning tailoring skills.

loans.use: To repair his house and pay for school fees

loans.name: Kuña Oñepytyvombava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se conformó mediante el deseo de trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias.

En la actualidad se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y así reciben las capacitaciones con el objetivo de ir mejorando sus actividades mediante el uso  de adecuado de los créditos.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Lidia, quien es ama de casa, muy trabajadora y activa. Ella además de los trabajos de la casa también posee un  negocio donde ofrece diversos productos para usos del hogar y otros artículos generales. En esta ocasión ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas como vinos, cervezas, gaseosas, ya que también quiere ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group was formed because the members wanted to work in order to move their families forward. They are currently in their seventh loan cycle as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. As participants in the program, the members receive training that will help them improve their businesses through the proper use of credit.

One of the members is Sra. Lidia who is a homemaker. She is an active member and a hard worker. In addition to performing the household chores, she also manages a business selling different household products and other types of general merchandise. On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy beverages such as wine, beer, and sodas to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wine, beer, and sodas

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 3  enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les trois  prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
SALI BOURAMA T. fait la culture du riz.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.500 FCFA en fin de  campagne, qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, 37 years old on average with 3 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Sekereni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are work with Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to manage their agricultural businesses properly during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the three previous loans were repaid properly. Sali Bourama T., one of the group members, grows rice. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment to manage 0.75 hectares. The products are sold in the village after the harvest to a clientele composed of consumers. She intends to realize an average profit of 25,500 FCFA at the end of the planting season, which will allow her to repay the loan and help her husband with the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and small equipment

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn H. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables such as "kalamongay" (leaves from the kalamungay tree make a healthy tea), "sayote" (a cucurbit like watermelon or cucumber), "squash" and more for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina P. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 45 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Marcelina owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells a raised animal. Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 4th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es: El Sr. Florentino es  cliente  que se dedica al servicio de transporte de larga distancia quien además casi la mayoría de la semana se dedica viajando y para no poder descuidar a la familia  el viaja con la hija y la esposa  para no romper los lazos familiares ya que para el la unión familiar es importante, es muy trabajador, y responsable como Padre y esposo ya que siempre piensa en el bienestar de su familia. El dinero que el cliente necesita es para poder  reparar su automóvil ya que  es su fuente de trabajo y el cliente ahora no esta generando ingresos debido  a esto, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Florentino is a long distance public transport driver, driving almost the entire week to be able to support his family. He travels with his daughter and his wife so that the family ties will not be broken. His family is very important. He is very hard working and he is a responsible father and husband. He always thinks of the well being of his family. The funds that he needs are to repair his bus. It is his only source of work. He is currently not generating any income because of this. He is very grateful for the support he is granted.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his bus.

loans.name: Amira Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
