Amira;   ella tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera; y tiene 2 hijos, La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa americana en el baratillo  en diferentes puntos debido a que este trabajo no está formalizado no tienen un lugar fijo, ella hace esto desde hace 4 años ella viene vendiendo todo tipo de ropa y peluches americanos, ella trabaja los sábados y los otros días lava ropa en diferentes casas, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda y venderlos en el baratillo.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Mujeres Unidas communal bank. The bank is located in the district of San Sebastián, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Amira is 34 years old and is a single mother with two children. She buys and sells clothing from the United States at different places in the El Baratillo market because her work is informal and she doesn’t have a permanent place from which to sell. For the past four years, she has been selling all types of clothing and stuffed animals from the United States. She works on Saturdays and washes clothing at different houses the other days of the week. She is requesting the loan to buy second-hand clothing to sell in El Baratillo.

She appreciates and values the loan provided and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing and sell it in the El Baratillo market.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou N. est une femme qui est âgée de 47 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est divorcée et mère de famille. Elle a une activité commerciale diversifiée car elle s’active depuis plus de 20 ans dans l’achat et la vente de poissons et de tissus. Et c’était pour soutenir  son mari et ses enfants qu’elle s’était lancée dans  cette activité.  Ainsi elle parvenait a satisfaire ses besoins. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis octobre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus( thioup, wax, etc.) en vue de développer son activité secondaire de vente de tissus. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de renforcer son épargne.
-
texts.en: Mrs. Astou N. is a 47-year old woman. She lives in Bambilor. She is divorced and has a family to support. She is engaged in different business activities as she has been selling fish and fabrics for over 20 years. She first started this work in order to support her husband and children. And  in this way she has been able to provide for her needs. She has been a member of the Bambilor credit union since October 2009. She already had a loan before. She is seeking a credit of 300,000 to purchase fabrics (traditional fabrics such as damask-type thioup, colourful “wax” fabrics, etc), in order to further grow her secondary business in fabrics. Her goal is to increase her revenues and boost her savings.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics

loans.name: Marcia Salvadora

texts.es: Marcia Salvadora tiene 40 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio pues han sido de gran ayuda. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil salir adelante con todas las cosas que ha atravesado. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que disfruta de su negocio y de interactuar con sus clientes. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en: Marcia Salvadora is 40 years old.  Her business activity is selling general merchandise.  This is not the first time that she has requested a loan for her business and they have been a great help.  She has had this business for more than 11 years.  It has been very difficult for her to get ahead with all the things that she has experienced but she is a fighter who enjoys her business and enjoys interacting with her customers.  This loan will be used to buy supplies that she needs for her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Floria

texts.en: Floria is a 30-year-old business-lady who runs a grocery shop. Being a single mother of two, she works hard in her business to provide for and educate her children.  She hopes to be financially stable in the future.  She hopes to own a real estate in the future.  She has requested for 40,000 Kes to buy onions.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Vehari, a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and popular for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family in the area of 63-WB for over 15 years. She is married to M. Y. who has a construction supplies sales business. He sells supplies through his shop which is located in the market. He has been operating this business for many years and has a good reputation among his customers due to the quality items he sells.

Nasreen is a very helpful woman, supporting her family through her bangles business. Wearing bangles is very common among women and young girls. She sells a good quantity of bangles every month in the nearby areas and also to different jewelry shops. The money she makes from her business allows her to pay the utilities expenses.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her bangles sales business. With the loan, she will buy different varieties of bangles such as steel, metal and glass in bulk, which will help her sell more and increase her monthly income. She is hopeful that an investment will take her business to a more profitable position. She is a new loan applicant with Asasah and hopes that it will bring her more profits.

loans.use: to buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna A. is from the village of Mitugas,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Paterna is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Paterna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector runing a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as coffee, juice, sugar, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and other items in the local community. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Paterna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Paterna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vergelita

texts.en:
Vergelita L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Vergelita is married and has two children. To make a living, Vergelita raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Vergelita has been farming for more than 12 years. 

Vergelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Vergelita is requesting a new loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 37-year-old married man and the father of three children. Ali has been working in auto repair, especially in car bodywork, for 15 years. He is a specialist in his domain and recommended by most of his clients. Because Ali and most people are suffering from the hard financial situation nowadays, he has another good source of income, transporting students to and from school. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some necessary maintenance in his garage. Ali hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance in his garage

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene T., 32, is married and resides in Bugarin, Pililla, which is located in the Province of Rizal. Airene has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. 

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. Her business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family to live in a decent manner. 

She hopes to provide her family with everything necessary to move forward against poverty. Airene’s dreams are to have an expanded business and to have a happy family. She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded to make her dreams come true, and she is hoping that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her overall quality of living. 

Her long-term goals are to invest and build a better house for the family, fund the college educations of her four children and have full-fledged mini-grocery store.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders across the world for sponsoring poor women who wants to get ahead, like her. She prays that they all will be blessed.

loans.use: To buy more food products and basic households necessities for her variety store

loans.name: Yoeuk

texts.en: Yoeuk K. is 39 years old and married Chan Hun, 44, many years ago. She is from the province of Siem Reap. Through fishing, the couple is able to generate a small income of $5 USD each day which they use to feed their family. They have four school-aged children. They have a small fishing business in and around Tunle Sap River. Recently, this family can’t catch as many fish as before because their boat is often broken. Therefore, Yoeuk K. is asking for a loan to buy a new boat.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a widow who lives in EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She has six children who are between 20 and 43 years old. Lilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to pay for repairs of her pump boat and purchase another pump boat so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Lilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To repair her pump boat and purchase another pump boat.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a thirty-seven-year-old single mother living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating her only child up to university.  She operates a taxi service and a retail shop, and has been in business for three years amidst challenges in car breakdowns.  Betty needs a loan to repair her vehicle to continue her taxi transport business.

loans.use: to repair her taxi

loans.name: Araz

texts.ru:
Araz M. 31 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Araz yavlyayetsya IDP personom , On pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi.
Araz uje 5 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Etom u biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo starsheqo brata. Araz seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti (akumulyator, noviye kalesa mashine i t.d)dlya pochinki mashini.
texts.en: Araz M. is 31 years old.  He is married and has two children who go to school.  Araz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in Baku with his wife and children.  Araz has been driving a taxi for five years.  He started this business with his older brother.  Araz now needs 2300 AZN to buy car parts (a battery, new tires, etc.) to maintain his car.

loans.use: to buy car parts to maintain his car.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka B. is 30 years old. She is married and lives in the village of Kldeeti, Zestaponi District. She lives with her husband and his parents. Maka and her husband are actively involved in agricultural activities. They have three cows and sell cheese at Zestaponi Market. Besides that, the family has agricultural land with an area of 0.7 ha where they grow maize, 600 grape vines and 100 nut trees. Harvested corn and nuts are sold locally. As for the grapes, Maka and her husband make wine and sell it in Zestaponi. 

With the requested credit, Maka’s family will purchase a tractor. It will significantly reduce their costs and improve the quality of land tilling. Accordingly family will have more funds to spend on domestic needs. Maka hopes that conditions of life for her family members will go in a positive direction as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is a 42-year-old married man and father of 2 children. His children are 10 and 7 years old. Leo is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He cultivates his land for planting rice crops. Leo spends hours on the farm making sure his land free of weeds and pests. He works hard to have a healthy product that he can sell at market.

Leo's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, se dedica a la venta de panes y refrescos, reside en Chilanga departamento de Morazán, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos: Alex de 23 y José de 18 años de edad; Su negocio consiste en vender panes y refrescos en una bicicleta, su horario es de 11:00 am a 6:00pm, el busco este negocio debido a la falta de empleo ya que él trabaja para la manutención del hogar, este negocio es rentable y lo inicio hace 7 años.
El solicita un préstamo para arreglar otra bicicleta, colocando más venta para cubrir otras zonas, este préstamo será de una gran ayuda porque tendrá mejores ingresos al disponer de dos bicicletas. 
Su objetivo es que sus hijos en el futuro sean profesionales, además que su negocio crezca y a través de esto lograr el objetivo.
texts.en:
Ricardo sells breads and soft drinks.  He lives in Chilanga, in Morazán department, with his family.  He has two children: 23 year-old Alex and 18 year-old José.  His business consists of selling breads and soft drinks on a bicycle.  He works from 11.00am to 6.00pm.  He started this business because he could not find a job.  He works to support his household.  This business is profitable and he started out in it seven years ago.

Ricardo is requesting a loan to fix another bicycle so that he can make more sales and cover other areas.  This loan will be a big help to him because he will make better income with two bicycles.

Ricardo's goal is for his children to become professionals in the future.  He would like to see his business grow so that he can achieve his goal.

loans.use: to repair his bicycle

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Unión y Amistad” perteneciente a la comuna de Colina.
Ella se dedica a atender y vender confites, helados y bebidas en un local que instaló en el patio de su casa. Además por las noches se dedica a preparar y vender comida rápida, específicamente empanadas de queso, papas fritas y completos. María trabaja en estos negocios desde hace dos años, de lunes a domingo, durante todo el día. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, supermercados mayoristas y en la vega central (feria de verduras para comerciantes). Ésta la traslada en un carro o a veces paga un flete (carga que se transporta).
Con el crédito comprará una bandeja calentadora, para mantener caliente sus alimentos y comidas que prepara, además una balanza digital y materiales de construcción para remodelar su local.
Sus metas en su negocio son obtener el permiso de consumo e instalación para su local, así vender más tranquila y segura. Además le gustaría comprar una campana de cocina, para extraer el olor de los alimentos cocinados.
María vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad. Su hijo mayor es quien le ayuda en su negocio, para la atención de público y compra de mercadería. Sus sueños a nivel personal son continuar con su negocio y que éste le genere mayores ganancias, para brindarle a su familia una vida socioeconómica más confortable. 
María está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y le facilitará prosperar en éste. Respecto a las reuniones con las demás socias del grupo comparten experiencias y datos. Además los talleres de ventas le han servido para aplicarlos a su propio negocio, especialmente en el registro de gastos y en la atención al cliente.
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
María is part of the “Unión y Amistad” (Union and Friendship) communal bank belonging to the Colina Commune.  She makes and sells snacks, ice cream and beverages in a locale she installed in her yard.  At night she makes fast food to sell, specifically cheese turnovers, fried potatoes and “completos” (Chilean hot dog).  María has worked in these businesses for two years, Monday through Sunday, all day.  She buys her merchandise from distributors, wholesale supermarkets and at the Vega Central (farmers market for merchants).  She transports it in her car or sometimes pays for it to be trucked to her. She will use the loan to buy a heating tray to keep her food hot, a digital scale and building materials and supplies to remodel her locale.

Her business plan is to get an installation and usage permit for her locale so that she can sell with more peace of mind and security.  Also, she’d like to buy a range hood to extract the odor of cooked food.

María lives with her mother and her two children who are 17 and 10 years of age.  Her oldest son helps her in the business tending to customers and buying merchandise.  Her dreams on a personal level are to stay in business, that it generates higher profits to provide her family with a more comfortable socioeconomic life.

María is very happy and grateful with the loan Fondo Esperanza granted her because with it she’ll be able to invest in her business and to prosper in it will be easier.

With respect to the meetings with the other members, they share experiences and data.  Besides, the sales workshops have been helpful and she’s applied them to her own business, especially in keeping track of expenses and customer service.

Colina is a commune in the northern part of the metropolitan region (where Santiago, capital of Chile, is located).  It is currently an important center of investment, principally in the agro business sector due to the installation of large and important firms that incidentally provide a large number of jobs in the community.  It is also an area of “parcelas de agrado” (former farmland converted to residential use) which has considerably increased the number of residents.  It also has spaces that are attractive to tourism, like thermal springs, sports in the Piedra Roja Lagoon and mountaineering.

loans.use: to buy a heating tray to keep her food hot, a digital scale and building materials to remodel her locale.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José Mercedes tiene 37  años de edad, el es soltero, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos menores de edad.  El vive en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Morrope  cuenta con servicios de agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

José Mercedes se dedica a la  comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado caprino (cabritos), entre otros  los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio. José Mercedes se dedica a esta labor desde hace 5 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el negocio.

José Mercedes desea comprar más animales con sus respectivos alimentos, pues desea ampliar su negocio en la zona ya que el, cuenta con clientela ya establecida,Jose Mercedes está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr dichos objetivos.

José Mercedes es un cliente antiguo  para Edpyme Alternativa, y en todo momento a demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad,  José Mercedes también cuenta con buenas referencia por parte de las personas que lo conocen, lo describen como una persona tranquila y honesta.
texts.en:
José Mercedes is 37 years old, single, and lives in his own home together with his two dependent children.  He lives in a poor, urban area in Mórrope district and his home has piped water.  The place in which he lives is a small community which houses approximately 100 families.

José Mercedes sells animals - mainly kids (baby goats) but also other animals.  He keeps them in an area behind his home.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who always visit his area.  He carries out his business from home.  José Mercedes has been in this business for five years and so he knows his work really well.

José Mercedes would like to buy more animals and the appropriate feed for them as he would like to expand his business in the area.  He already has an established customer base.  He is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve his goals.

José Mercedes is an existing client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has always shown himself to be responsible and punctual.  He also has good references from people who know him.  They describe him as a calm and honest person.

loans.use: to buy more animals and the appropriate balanced feed

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old. She is a married woman with three children, and her husband works as a farmer.

Myrna is in the hog raising business. She raises pigs for fattening and sells them at her town's local market. She also owns a sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods, eggs, and soft drinks. Myrna also helps her husband at their rice farm when she can.

Myrna's loan will be used to purchase two piglets, feed, and vitamins. She hopes her hog raising business will improve.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Jijie

texts.en:
Jijie is 28 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-age child.

Jijie works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to pay the labor costs for fishing boat repair and repainting.

Jijie has been a  member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Jijie hopes to earn more income and to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to repair and repaint her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jeiko Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a la iniciativa y entusiasmo de la señora María Ana, quien se enteró del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación a través de una conocida. La señora Ana contactó con sus vecinas y amigas emprendedoras para formar el comité en la zona. El grupo se denomina Jeiko Porave Rekávo, están en el Segundo Ciclo, con 15  integrantes. Es un comité muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor.
La Sra. Paulina tiene una despensa, por medio del cual ha podido salir adelante, por medio de su negocio ella ha podido generar mas ingresos con lo cual puede solventar todos los gastos de la casa. Ella sueña con algún día poder ampliar su negocio lo cual le servirá para poder tener mas espacio donde exhibir sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, y hortalizas para abastecer su negocio. Ella agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the initiative and enthusiasm of María Ana who found out about Fundación Paraguaya's Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program through an acquaintance.  Ana contacted her entrepreneurial friends and neighbors to set up a committee in their area.  The group is called Jeiko Porave Rekávo.  It is in its second loan cycle and has 15 members.  This is a very united, supportive and responsible committee.  The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit.

Paulina has a grocery store through which she has been able to get ahead in life.  Through her business, she has been able to make more income with which she is able to cover all her household expenses.  She dreams of some day being able to expand her business so that she has more space for displaying her merchandise.

Paulina is requesting a loan to buy food, drinks, dairy products and vegetables to stock her business.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products and vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Kalipa's Group

texts.en:
Kalipa, 59, is the treasurer of this group. She is married and has six grown children. She considers bringing up six children the main accomplishment of her life. Kalipa’s husband is a member of a Farming Committee. Kalipa is now retired, but the couple still owns a big household with vast acres of land and livestock. Currently, Kalipa and her husband are busy with gathering hay for winter. Since 70% of Kyrgyzstan’s population resides in rural areas, it is obvious that farming is important for employment and provides a good portion of the country’s gross domestic product (GDP).

Kalipa is requesting a loan to buy sheep to fatten and resell. Since their children are facing financial hardships now, Kalipa and her husband hope to promote their business and gain more profit than usual.


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut, 51, is the mother of two sons. Together with her husband and children, Ut lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is now retired and the family depends on the income that Ut makes from selling groceries from her stall in a local street market. Ut began this business five years ago.

Every morning Ut buys common seasonal fruit and vegetables such as water morning glory, cucumbers, pineapples, beansprouts and cabbages to sell in her stall. Ut would like a loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit and vegetables so that she can attract more customers. 

Ut hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to increase her sales.

loans.name: Bonifacio Rafael

texts.es:
El Señor Bonifacio es policía, está trabajando como guardia de seguridad en un banco de la ciudad donde vive. Tiene su residencia en la ciudad de San Ignacio, tiene pareja, la misma trabaja en un Laboratorio de análisis clínicos. Ambos, por medio de su trabajo, logran salir adelante y de esa forma pueden mantener los gastos que día a día tienen.
El señor Bonifacio es consiente de que el estudio es muy importante, por lo cual desea poder seguir capacitándose, aunque ya tenga una profesión. Es por eso que solicita el crédito, para el pago de un curso de computación, el cual le será de gran ayuda, ya que en la actualidad todo se maneja a través de las computadoras y aquel que no entiende sobre ello queda atrasado.
Sabe que a través del estudio podrá seguir creciendo también en el trabajo dentro del cuerpo de policía, ya que allí también tienen un área de computarizada. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Bonifacio is a policeman. He works as a security guard in a bank. He and his partner live in San Ignacio. She works in a clinic laboratory. They are both getting by in their jobs and are able to provide for their day to day expenses. 

Sr. Bonifacio is aware that studying is very important. Consequently he wants to be able to continue with his training, even though he already has a career. He is requesting this loan to pay for a course in computer science, which will help him greatly since nowadays everything is done through computers and those who do not understand how to use them are left behind.

He realizes that through study he will be able to continue advancing because the police also have a field of computing. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity since obtaining a loan will be a big help to him.

loans.use: to pay for a computer course

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 8 años de experiencia en la venta de comida en un centro educativo cercana a su casa. Para ella las mejores ventas son en la temporada escolar, pues tanto profesores como alumnos son sus fieles clientes. En ocasiones su esposo la ayuda en la atención, mientras que ella va terminando de preparar los platillos que le solicitan o en la venta de alguna golosina que le piden los niños. Su mayor anhelo es implementar su negocio con más productos y acondicionar mejor el lugar. Es la quinta vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, por ello espera la ayuda de todos ustedes. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos cubiertos y mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en: Julia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children in their home.  She has 8 years of experience in food sales in a school near her house.  For her, the best sales are during the school season, since teachers as well as students are her faithful customers.  From time to time, her husband helps her by attending to customers, while she is finishing preparing the food that was ordered or selling a snack to the children.  Her greatest desire is to upgrade her business by offering more products and improving the appearance of the place.  This is the fifth time that she has requested a loan with MFP, and for that, she hopes for the help of all of you.  With the money she has requested, she will invest in the purchase of new silverware and merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase silverware and products to supply her snack food store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and a single-mother of a 12-year-old.  

She has been operating a hardware store for three years.  She also practices livestock farming to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Grace has been able to improve her business income with her previous loans.

Grace has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy cows and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat is 39, married and a loving mother of one daughter. She has been buying and selling fruits and vegetable for about twelve years.  Her husband is unemployed and helps with this business too.  Matanat wants to improve her standard of living by expanding her business and earning profits. 

She wants to obtain a loan of 1300 AZN to purchase of a new variety of goods.   AqroInvest has been a significant part of Matanat´s business, having provided loans which have been used to expand the business.

loans.use: purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh Vit au Sénégal. Il évolue depuis 7 ans dans le secteur du transport. Il est célibataire et membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achèvement  d’une construction qu’elle avait entamé.  Ce financement l’aidera à améliorer son cadre de vie social.
texts.en: Mr. Cheikh lives in Senegal.  He has worked in transport for seven years.   He is single and has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since June of 2011.  He is requesting a credit of 500,000 frs in order to finish some construction work that he has started.  This loan will help him to improve his social standing.

loans.use: to finish a construction project.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas has been in farming for over five years with his produce of maize, beans and potatoes going to the local market. He is married and has two children aged five and three who are both in school. He runs a cereals retail shop in the local market for additional income. 

Douglas has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to enable him to venture into pig farming. He says the business will enable him provide for the family's basic needs due to high demand for pork and the high cost of other meat, which makes many clients resort to pork. He plans to acquire more land for more expansive farming and hopes to grow his cereals business to reach further markets. 

He mentions unreliable rainfalls as the major challenge to farming.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been a farmer in their village for four years. Within these years of operating his corn field, he has already experienced a year in which he earned nothing from his hard work because of a disastrous calamity. But this causes him to become stronger. 

He is very thankful to have Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. to help him by approving his requested loan of PHP 20,000 to buy corn seeds and fertilizers and pay for the labor cost that will be spent in planting. This will be serving as his starting line to begin his new journey as a farmer.

He needs to become stronger to face the trials that a farmer will encounter during his struggle for success. His wife and four children are depending on him, so he needed to be more industrious.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers and pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Adiyapagma

texts.en:
Adiyapagma, 53 years old, lives with her husband and younger daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her husband is an electrician, while their elder two daughters are employed and their younger one is a college student. 

Adiyapagma started her grocery retail business in 2001 by renting a counter in the market, expanding over the years to include a wide range of products. Now that her children are older, Adiyapagma has more time to devote to the business, and so has rented  another counter in the market.  She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more products for this second stall..

loans.use: to purchase more products for her business.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina de 27 años, convive hace 10 años con Osvaldo, su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 6 años. Esta cálida familia vive, por ahora, en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Tarma. Ya que se mudaron de Ricricán donde cuentan con casa y terrenos propios por asuntos de negocios.
Yanina aprendió de sus hermanas el comercio de ropa. Para ello viaja constantemente a la ciudad de Lima, donde adquiere su mercadería por docenas y cientos. “Traigo ropa surtida, pantalones, polos, chompas, pero lo que más sale son las casacas y zapato. Viajo cada dos meses”, comenta, añadiendo que, el éxito de su pequeño negocio radica en la captación de clientes fijos, pues empezó vendiendo de puerta en puerta y como ambulante en las ferias. 
A la vez, se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de papa blanca, pero en poca cantidad para el consumo de su familia. Por su parte, Osvaldo, su pareja, apoya con ingresos que obtiene como conductor de su propia mototaxi. Con el tiempo, Yanina quisiera comprar un lote de terreno en la ciudad de Tarma y si hay suerte construir su casa, de esa manera educaría profesionalmente a sus hijos. Con su ayuda, éste sería su préstamo número 15 de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. Le gusta trabajar dentro de su banco comunal por la oportunidad de crecimiento entre los socios.
La campaña navideña le exige que su mercadería esté surtida y sea abundante, por ello invertirá todo el dinero en la compra de ropa en la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Yanina is 27 years old and has been in a common-law relationship for 10 years with her partner Osvaldo. They have two children, ages 10 and 6. Her family currently lives in a rented house in the city of Tarma. They moved from Ricricán, where they own a house and land for their businesses.

Yanina learned how to sell clothes from her sisters. She travels constantly to the city of Lima, where she acquires her merchandise in quantities of 12 and 100. Yanina says, “I bring back an inventory of trousers, polo shirts, and sweaters, but the items that sell the most are coats and shoes. I travel twice a month.” The success of her small business stems from being able to acquire established customers. She started out selling door-to-door, but now she travels to the fairs.

Yanina also spends time farming, growing white potatoes in small quantities for family consumption. Her partner Osvaldo helps generate income by driving his own motorcycle taxi. In time, Yanina wants to buy a plot of land in the city of Tarma so that she can build a house where her children can stay while they pursue their professional education.

This will be Yanina’s 15th loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with her monthly payments. Yanina enjoys working with her Communal Bank because she has the opportunity to grow with the other members. For this Christmas season, she wants to be stocked with an abundant amount of merchandise so she will invest all of the money in the purchase of clothes from the city of Lima.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 64 years old and lives in Manamong Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children.
 
Paz has a general store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Paz has been a member of PMPC for seven years

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Noemi Luz, es casada y tiene 51 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ferreteria y tambien vende materiales de construccion como pinturas,clavos,yeso y arena,la socia sigue trabajando junto con su esposo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar sus negocios . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arena,pinturas,clavos,yeso y tornillos par que implemente su ferreteria y negocio de venta de materiales de construccion. 

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Señora Noemi Luz is married, she is 51 years old and she has 4 children. The member is still working in the hardware business and she also sells construction materials such as paint, nails, plaster and sand. The member is still working with her husband. Her dream is to expand and improve her businesses. The member is requesting the loan to buy sand, paint, nails, plaster and screws for her hardware store and business of selling construction materials.

The member appreciates and is grateful for the loan she has been granted and she promises to be disciplined in the repayment of her debts.

loans.use: to buy sand, paint, nails, plaster and screws for her hardware store and business of selling construction materials.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es: La señora Janneth es profesora del nivel primario y su esposo trabaja en la mina. Con dichas actividades ellos generan ingresos para ayudar a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para compra de una impresora y material didáctico para facilitar su trabajo. Janneth  es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno de ellos es independiente. Vive en casa en anticretico la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Rió Seco  de la Ciudad de El Alto. Es la tercera vez que trabaja con Impro y la segunda vez junto a Kiva.
texts.en:
Janneth is a primary school teacher and her husband works in a mine. With these jobs they make an income to help their family. She needs the loan to purchase a printer and educational material to facilitate her work. 

Janneth is married and has three children, one of which is independent. She lives in a house under an "anticrético" rental contract located in the area of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. This is the third time she has worked with Impro and the second time together with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a printer and educational material for her work as a teacher.

loans.name: Fida

texts.en: Fida is a 44 year old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy blankets to sell. She would like to improve her economic status in this way. She plans on owning her own shop to sell the blankets. She aspires to own a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Finangnon Group

texts.fr: FINANGNON est un groupement composé de dix neuf personnes qui sont résident dans un même quartier. Virginie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Virginie, est une veuve, mère de sept enfants. Certains parmi ces enfants sont scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Virginie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par dame Virginie. Pour y arriver, Virginie prépare des nourriture qu'elle vend de façon ambulante depuis une vingtaine d'année. Virginie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Virginie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FINANGNON un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du riz et du maïs.
